column1:
Who is Isa?

Hello Everyone,

My name is Isa Marina Lopez, better known by my stage name Isa. I am an American singer, songwriter, and model. Born in Bronx, New York to Dominican and Cuban parents, I quickly became a product of the urban-Latino culture that surrounded me, and later, the larger, more eclectic culture that encompasses all of New York City. As a teen, I received classical vocal training at the Marianela Sanchez School of Music in the Dominican Republic. Since returning to the U.S., I’ve had the opportunity to  perform on many iconic NYC stages such as The Bitter End, Tammany Hall, SOB’s [Sounds of Brazil], the Trash Bar, and most recently The Theater at Madison Square Garden to sing our nation’s anthem. In April 2013, I released my debut EP Montage, which generated industry buzz by way of the EDM-influenced “Safehouse” and hauntingly beautiful “You &
column2:
I.” I’ve finally completed my next project, Mirrors Volume I, and I need your support for its release! #TeamIsa, the production team, and my live band want to make this second EP and the accompanying visuals reflective of the high quality of the music contained within.


The Vision of Mirrors Volume I

My team and I have worked on this project over the course of two years! I’ve had the privilege of working on each track with Deborah Robb and Bruno J. Sutter III of B3D Music Productions, building each song from the ground up. Mirrors Volume I is a true exploration of self - with each song diving into a particular story of my life word for word. You are truly catching a glimpse of the woman behind the voice.


Keep Mirrors Volume I on Track! 

We’re looking for to raise $10,000 for the release of this project.  All funds donated will be used for 3 single-driven music videos, the official album photoshoot, digital ad placement, physical CD production, promotion materials (such as posters and stickers), etc.

If you donate you can grab yourself some pretty awesome perks, like: digital copies of the album, physical CD copies of the album, songwriting sessions, and much more! #TeamIsa wants to make sure our supporters are spoiled! 

If we do not reach our goal, all of the funds are still going right into the release of this EP, so every bit helps.


Share! Share! Share!

If you cannot donate to the campaign, become a member of Isa’s virtual street-team. Share this with everyone! Tell your friends, tell your families, tell your friends' families. Just by getting this campaign out there, you are helping out. Use all the Indiegogo share tools and help us release Mirrors Volume I. 

Please make sure to check in on this page for updates.

All my love,

Isa

column1: Hello Everyone. Our campaign is over. We would like to thank all of our contributors. We were able to purchase 6 GUITARS for our students... We are extremely excited about that. THANKS.!!!!!
It's true, we did not meet our financial goal but we met another goal that surprised us. We met some great people and many that has promised to support us in the future.
Again, a special thanks to our contributors for helping us make this happen it would not have been possible without YOU.
We are the Mount Vernon Strings Project
and we are reaching out to supporters of music and music education to help us purchase string instruments for our students. WE NEED:

The Mount Vernon Strings Project enables students the ability to explore the power of music and their own creativity. We are very excited about  offering constructive activities to our community and the vehicle we have chosen is music education and performance through strings. It is our pleasure to offer the youths and adults in our community access to music education. As musicians and music educators it is also our responsibility to embrace the next generation of musicians.
WHAT WE NEED We Need String Instruments For Our Students. With your support we will purchase string instruments and songbooks that will allow the program to offer students the following:

GIVE WHAT YOU CAN... 10, 25, 50, 75, or more. We appreciate your support!Your donation speaks as a voice of support heard. When you make a donation to this campaign we gift you back. We offer perks to our supporters. Please take a look at our PERKS...it's our way of thanking you for your generosity and support..! We will be adding and updating our perks through out the campaign.
A 100%  Cotton Premium quality T-Shirt with our campaign logo when you make a contribution of $50.00.
My personal philosophy is to offer an opportunity to perform music to every child that is interested.  We want to not only serve the youth of our community, but the adults as well.""

Mr. Mansa Gory has practiced Music Education for over 15 years. Attaining his Bachelor of Music Education from the University of South Carolina and Masters from Lehman College. Mr Gory strives to bring communities together for higher achievement. Mr Gory plays many instruments, including the Trumpet, Trombone, Bass Guitar, Acoustic Guitar, and Percussion.

Musicians need their tools. ""It's important that students have proper instruments. It makes them feel more comfortable in their learning environment, and if they have that they will have a great learning experience.""

GARY PRESS grew up in Mount Vernon, New York and has been involved in the music scene as a guitarist, songwriter and producer for many years. He is especially known for performing in local bands.  He studied music, art and design at the Phoenix School Of Design in New York.

As our roster grows with enthusiastic students ready to learn songs, music theory and how to participate in an ensemble as performers, we are finding that many of them are not able to afford the learning tools. Tools needed to succeed and achieve their goals in the class.  It is vital for us to survive and keep the program going, we just need a little help from you.

and tell the world about the Mount Vernon Strings Project  and our campaign...!
Thank you for your support!",7.0,0,"1 Campaign

","My desire is to make financial assistance available to area women who are the victims of  Breast, Ovarian, And Pancreatic Cancer.To accomplish this, my husband and I bought a website called MySearchGirl.com,  a state of the art ""pay per click"" search engine.

What is Pay Per Click? Pay per click (PPC), also called cost per click, is an internet advertising model used to direct traffic to websites, in which advertisers pay the publisher (mysearchgirl.com) when the ad is clicked. It is defined simply as “the amount spent to get an advertisement clicked.” So every time a web surfer clicks on an ad listed on this website, Mysearchgirl.com will not only send the advertiser the targeted customer that he needs, but will also at the same time generate funds earmarked  for cancer victims to offset the cost of medical bills, prescriptions, and transportation for doctor appointments.

We want to form a non profit organization and use this website as a platform to generate funds for  Breast, Ovarian, And Pancreatic Cancer victims. We believe that with the requested funds, the right team, and two years work, we will gain a market share of 2%, this translates to fifty-eight million in a market that generates over twenty-nine billion a year. If we reach our contribution goal, mysearchgirl.com will leverage enough momentum in pay-per click sales to support our cause without having to seek further public or private contributions.  See the chart below of search engine dominance.

We need your help! We need as much support as you can afford!  We are starting off with nothing except MySearchGirl, a plan to start a non profit organization, and a desire to make the world a better place by providing financial assistance and relevant information about breast,ovarian, and pancreatic  cancer to those who need it most.
How Will My Contribution Be Used?
1. for Administrative Start-Up Fees, which includes:

Secure Office Space: Electricity, Heating, Office Supplies, Computers, A Computer  Server, and rent for the first year,  etc. We currently do not have an office,  but We are looking to secure a space that will serve as an official location to meet with cancer victims,  assess their financial needs, and assist them in their struggle.

2. We will Hire Business Managers : MySearchGirl.com  will hire upper management employees who are capable of taking this search engine to the next level.  In addition, We will hire  a Sales & Marketing Manager,  as well as an accountant and a code junkie, a skilled developer who knows coding to maintain the security of the website..
3.we will start assisting area cancer victims who are in a financial emergency and need immediate assistance paying for prescriptions and/or medical bills transportation and rent.
WHAT DO I GET FOR HELPING?

Being a pay per click search engine puts us in a unique position to offer you some really cool incentives when it comes to advertising. See all of our exciting perks listed on the right side of this page!
THIS IS PERSONAL, I MEAN VERY PERSONAL.

My name is Tammy Bellamy and my husband is Bruce Bellamy, and we're from Harrisonburg, Virginia. our desire is to help  women who suffer from the diseases of cancer. You see, my mother in-law,Betty, had a double Mastectomy and struggled with paying all the medical bills, on top of the stress she was already suffering. And back in 2008, My mother, Barbra, died from pancreatic cancer. I was devastated on both accounts, as was my husband. My mother died at home, and there was no one to help her. No one to help pay for the prescriptions that would have eased her pain and possibly could have saved her life. And there was no one there to lighten the financial burden this disease caused.... No friends, not even the government.....no medicaid or medicare.

I vowed that one day I would make a difference in someone's life. Knowing that no one should have to suffer and die the way mom did, I vowed that one day somehow I would discover a way to lighten the financial burden that some women experience when they get diagnosed with cancer...and finally, I have found a way....The way is through MySearchGirl.com.
I know that We can do this,
But to succeed, we need your help.
No one is an island, entire of itself
column2: everyone is a piece of the continent, a part of the whole, therefore never send to know  for whom the bell tolls.

column5: >Minds Like Mirrors is the product of 2 years in the making. We're not going to tell you who we may or may not sound like because honestly we wouldn't know. However, we are an ambient/metal style of music that has poured every ounce of ourselves into this project. The sound you'll come to know us for is our own personal reflection of the human spirit and yet we still wish to take our ideas to new heights.

column1: We aspire to do more, to travel, and to give our music purpose. We appreciate and thank everyone who has supported us over these years, and now we want to bring our experience of music across the U.S.. With your contribution to this campaign, you are helping us purchase a vehicle that we can use to start booking tours that are outside of our current reach. After playing with bands like Glass Cloud, I the Breather, White Chapel, as well as many others of note in our area, we want nothing more than to progress our musical reach beyond our local sphere of influence and continue to make unique and lasting experiences with new friends and fans beyond our current horizons.

Our Goal:

Our Goal is to raise $3000 for the purchase of a vehicle to begin touring as soon as possible. However, even if we do not meet this goal, it will not keep us from touring. This music is a fervent passion of ours that keeps us moving forward no matter the cost or the current situation. Your contributions are what will speed up the process in order to get us on the road and sharing what we have to offer with others as quickly and effectively as possible.

We'd like to thank everyone who has taken an interest in our project and we would like to let everyone also know that if we exceed our goal that the extra funds will be going into merchandise as well as other avenues in order to give back to the people that have helped fund us in our musical endeavors. The people who donate in higher quantities will be personally contacted and rewarded by us because of how much we truly appreciate the continued support that they have shown.

How You Can Help:

We are asking for financial contributions to our project, and we want everyone to know that no amount of contribution is too small and no donation will go without recognition and complete gratitude from everyone involved in MLM.

We also know that not everyone can contribute financially and we totally understand this. If you enjoyed our music and still want to help out, by simply going to any one of our social media outlets listed (Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, etc.) and giving a share on a post, a like on a page, and/or a view on a video we would be indescribably grateful. We are very excited to share and release all of our upcoming music with you and we can't wait to see what the future holds. Thank you to everyone for your continued support over the years and we look forward to seeing all of you on the road soon.


Our Sincerest Thanks,

Minds Like Mirrors is the product of 2 years in the making. We're not going to tell you who we may or may not sound like because honestly we wouldn't know. However, we are an ambient/metal style of music that has poured every ounce of ourselves into this project. The sound you'll come to know us for is our own personal reflection of the human spirit and yet we still wish to take our ideas to new heights.

We aspire to do more, to travel, and to give our music purpose. We appreciate and thank everyone who has supported us over these years, and now we want to bring our experience of music across the U.S.. With your contribution to this campaign, you are helping us purchase a vehicle that we can use to start booking tours that are outside of our current reach. This music is a fervent passion of ours that keeps us moving forward no matter the cost or the current situation. Your contributions are what will speed up the process in order to get us on the road and sharing what we have to offer with others as quickly and effectively as possible.

We'd like to thank everyone who has taken an interest in our project and we would like to let everyone also know that if we exceed our goal that the extra funds will be going into merchandise as well as other avenues in order to give back to the people that have helped fund us in our musical endeavors. We are very excited to share and release all of our upcoming music with you and we can't wait to see what the future holds. Thank you to everyone for your continued support over the years and we look forward to seeing all of you on the road soon.Our Sincerest Thanks,

Darren Curtis Skanson and Gregg Hansen are a virtuoso guitar duo and the inventors of the unique double finger-style guitar
column2:
Classical - nails on nylon strings, joined by Folk – flesh on steel strings.

On March 13th, 2016, Skanson &
column3: Hansen will fly to London and Abbey Road Studios for 4 days of intensive recording of the world's first double finger-style guitar cd of Beatle arrangements. On their previous four Skanson &

column2: H have re-imagined and restructured dozens of timeless songs, but, at their concerts, the audience request they hear most often is for a full CD

column1: of exclusively Beatle arrangements. So they went right to work
column2: not merely covering Beatles’ songs, but uncovering the musical roots and inspirations that made each song so popular and memorable. Help! in a country feel, A Hard Days Night with its roots as a blues tune, and many more. To make our Beatles project even more authentic, they are recording these new arrangements where the magic was first created - Abbey Road Studios London, England
column3:
in the same studio where the Beatles recorded all their music.

Skanson &
column4: Hansen have reserved Abbey Road’s ""Studio Two"" from March 13th through the 16th of 2016. So they are committed! And... they're looking for a ""A Little Help From..."" their friends – and, of

column1: course, life-long Beatlemaniacs – to help make this project a reality.
Please help them record these loving double fingerstyle re-inventions of the greatest pop music ever created. Together, it will be a “Magical Mystery Adventure”.

WHAT WE NEED - Our Abbey Road sessions combine historic music with a historic location to capture the spirit that lives on in the Beatles' canon of work. It will take $35,000 for:
1. Studio Time - including the recording, mixing, and mastering of the music.
2. Travel Expenses - Organizing the logistical needs in and of itself is a daunting task. We will need flights, ground transportation, equipment shipping, and accommodations.
3. Manufacturing Costs - CDs and limited commemorative vinyl album release.
4. Live Video - The Abbey Road recording sessions and the special Cavern Club live concert will also be recorded and videotaped for multimedia support of Skanson &
column2: Hansen's Magical Mystery Adventure concerts upon their return from the UK.

column1:
HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT YOU CAN GET.
Skanson &
column2: Hansen appreciates your help and they have have some great rewards for your patronage: Personalized postcards mailed to you from Abbey Road, one of the first 50 cd's made, a limited edition vinyl album of the project, strum a guitar on stage at one of their shows, or even a private dinner with these modern masters. And there are many more! See them all at the right. Thanks.

column2: >The Local Listen podcast is Cleveland's answer to the growth and support of our local and regional music, bands and artists of all genres. There is a wealth of talent in our city and we want to help them reach their goals.

column1: We hope to reach our goal and be able to fund everything but if for some reason we do not, every contributor will receive their t-shirts and we will continue to work as hard as we can to launch this podcast and help the music community.

The Impact

The Local Listen is more than just a podcast. We want to be able to showcase local talent and their music but we also want to be able to help educate artists and musicians to look at themselves as a business and be able to successfully earn money doing what they love the most, Creating Music!! We have been building a network of professionals that are authorities in different aspects of the music industry and want to share with everyone their knowledge to help grow your fan base. We have devoted a special  section of each podcast to the distribution of this information.

We plan to have a segment devoted to live question and answer sessions as well as a live streamed performance of the featured artist of the month. Whether you're an artist, singer/songwriter, musician in a band or strictly a listener of music, there is something for everyone to enjoy with The Local Listen.

column2:
Challenges

In todays market there seem to be thousands of podcasts fighting for identity and space. What I believe will make us different and unique is the fact that we are not just sharing opinions, we are also trying to make a difference by helping musical artists to become more educated within the music industry so they can help themselves. I personally have 15+ years as a professional in the music business and I am surrounded by others with equal profiles. Helping local music grow won't be easy but we are willing to do whatever it takes to make a difference because we believe in Cleveland and it's surrounding cities.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit counts. Help us spread the word about our campaign and tune in to The Local Listen podcast.
Using Indiegogo's share tools will help us make an impact!!

The Local Listen podcast is Cleveland's answer to the growth and support of our local and regional music, bands and artists of all genres. There is a wealth of talent in our city and we want to help them reach their goals. The success of our campaign will give us the tools and resources to create a source of entertainment for music listeners in addition to helping them connect with local artists. Through your contribution we can not only improve the local music scene but we can help the development of future musical artists.
What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will cover the cost of completing the The Local Listen website, marketing and promotion.  In addition funds will cover costs for interactive features and the Live Streaming as well as additional equipment and the printing of The Local Listen t-shirts.
We want everyone that contributes to be a part of this so thats why we have decided to make our perks something every avid music listener likes, cool t-shirts!

You can help support The Local Listen with your contribution but you can continually support by wearing your TLL T-Shirt and help us brand our podcast and grow an audience which will be helping every local artist that we connect with.

We hope to reach our goal and be able to fund everything but if for some reason we do not, every contributor will receive their t-shirts and we will continue to work as hard as we can to launch this podcast and help the music community.

column5:
>WHY AM I DOING THIS AT ALL?

One of the things that makes me feel overflowingly happy is to see messages from the people on my mailing list, telling me they love the music, or that they like hearing about other people's art.

One friend even asked if he could print my emails and give them out in his tea shop!  This is such a nice compliment I can only try my best to return it by doing things to help more and more people as we grow.

Every little bit helps and I want you to know that you're all making a huge difference.
column9: >Thank you again to all of you who are reading this, you are part of something bigger than you may realize.

column1:
INTERVIEW WITH THE VOICE OF EXPERIENCE

These are some nuts-and-bolts things I suppose we should talk about.
Steve, how are you actually gonna make these prints and Tshirts?
column3: >I'm doing the printing at Tech Shop here in Pittsburgh, where you pay a monthly membership (like a gym) but instead of exercise machines, you use tools in the machine shop, wood-working shop, and print shop.  Cut digital vector-graphics onto vinyl with computerized machines!  Easy, fun and I get to learn something new.

column1:
Yeah but what do you actually know about solar power?
ANSWER:  I'm working here in Pittsburgh with a company called Zero Fossil, an electric energy supplier, using solar-powered sound systems for outdoor events.  It can be done, we're already doing it, and I plan to put these pieces together ASAP.  Thanks for asking.

Steve man, how are you going to make a whole album in one month?   ANSWER: It's already done! I've got the instrumental beats all in place ready for the live set.  Just need to record the vocals, mix them and master the album, which is not hard to do.

ok Mr. Knots, how do we know you are organized enough to pull this off?  Well, I spent the last five years working as soundman, booking agent and program manager in a music club (Mosaic House).  

During this time I also co-founded the BLEM festival, which was a series of events combining DJ's, live electronic music, raw concrete abandoned urban spaces, and video projection art.  

While doing these things I held several DJ residencies and started two bands -- Stallion Grip and Uptik Harmonik Orkestra -- to play both acoustic and electronic music for people who love to get sweaty and dance.  So I'm comfortable managing this kind of thing.

• write and ask me about solar power

column2: >re-post this campaign when you see it on facebook and twitter

column1: • Think of the planet as one big peaceful garden -- a mental exercise --  you will feel the difference.  Try it!
And that's all there is to it.

Hi, I'm Steve Knots.  Welcome to my fundraiser, and thank you to everyone who has helped so far!I'm raising money for a trip to Goulash Disko Festival in Croatia next month, the best music festival in the world. I'm booked to play my new music there and also help as a volunteer in the Goulash crew.Little do they know I bring with me the solution to run sound systems on solar powered free electricity, which I am already doing as my job in Pittsburgh.  We are putting all these things together to make a new way of life on our dear little planet -- temporary music festivals will soon become permanent living communities
column2: we have all the parts and we have many people who are interested.  That's the big picture. But first, I need to get there.  My goal is to raise $3000 to pay for travel expenses and the costs of this campaign.We only have three weeks to do it so please jump in and help!   Every donation makes a big difference.Check out the music and art that you can enjoy when you donate, and keep reading to see what bigger things this project fits into.

column1: THE BIG PICTUREThis is a multi-purpose trip with several layers.  One, play my new music with wonderful people from all over the world.  Two, talk with them about how to run the festival on solar power next year.  (!!!)  Three, to share this message with you -- we have everything we need to solve the problems on Earth, right now.We are not ""partying to escape from life"".   We are making the kind of life from which you do not need to escape.  Five years from now I would like to see music festivals like Goulash Disko running on their own free electricity from solar power, parked next to organic farms to grow food, and slowly turning from temporary events into permanent villages.  We can completely transform life on earth using music, art, culture and a few bits of technology -- not just in one place, but all over the world -- without giving up our laptops & internet.  It's a win-win situation!  That's my motivation for working on the individual level, the community level and the global level to put the pieces together towards one unbreakable Peace.And you can be a part of it by donating to my campaign.JUICY DETAILSGoulash Disko 2015 is taking place in Pula, Croatia, on the site of an old fort.  Musicians, bands, DJ's, jugglers, acrobats, and artists of all sorts come from all over the world to perform here and enjoy music, food and swimming together.  It's a totally incredible vibe created by crowdfunding!  See if you can find me in this video from last year (hint: 2min 30sec).Then donate to help me get there and bring my piece of the puzzle.  Thank you!WHAT DO YOU GET OUT OF IT?When you donate to my fundraiser, you get the same stuff you've already been getting in the email newsletters  -- Music, Art and Inspiration -- but this time they come to your physical mailbox, not only to your email inbox.  First, music.  The full album will be finished at the end of the summer after we do vocals and mastering.  When you make a donation, you get yourself a copy of the new album on USB flash drive with some extra surprises -- printed comic book with the lyrics and pictures! wow!Check out the preview:Second, ART!When you make your donation (what a good idea) you get some fun black & white prints to share a positive message in the world around you.  These are available as stickers, posters and Tshirts.  Click HERE to see them all in detail and pick the ones you like.Third perk, and this is the biggie Finally, my kitchen of secrets is open and you can get your hands on a few of my private recipes, and I mean cooking recipes, that I developed during the ""Sunday Soup"" series of parties.For serious donors only, not to be attempted by amateurs.  I'm talking about the infamous garlic-bomb salad dressing, the tongue-twisting toasted spices lentil curry, the banana pudding chocolate cake... If you're gonna be a long-distance goulash emissary, you'll need to know how to keep people happy after a hard day's work transforming negativity into warm subwoofers.  Yes, life requires a sense of humor and we're all gonna get there in the end. See PERKS to click and smile.  Smell this flower to practice using your imagination for wonderful things.

It's pretty simple, I'm fundraising to pay for travel expenses, for the cost of the campaign itself, and to make the Art to share with you.My fundraising goal is $3000.  This pays for plane tickets, travel costs such as local bus tickets and food in Croatia, and the production costs for the campaign itself.  ""Production costs"" means that the indiegogo crowdfund website takes a small percentage of the money we raise, and I have to pay for shipping to send out all the envelopes, plus printing costs, etc.  Stuff like that.  Oh and also album mastering, which I do with friends in their studios so it is not terribly expensive.  (Comes in handy to be an audio engineer sometimes :) )By the way, this is a ""flexible funding"" campaign, which means that whatever you donate will definitely help me get there.  The campaign does not abort if we come up short of the goal (which we won't, because you're about to Donate... right?  Right.)As for payment types, we can accept Paypal and credit cards through the indiegogo secure payment system, so there's no reason to hesitate!  Donate now and grab your perks hot off the presses.

WHY AM I DOING THIS AT ALL?One of the things that makes me feel overflowingly happy is to see messages from the people on my mailing list, telling me they love the music, or that they like hearing about other people's art.One friend even asked if he could print my emails and give them out in his tea shop!  This is such a nice compliment I can only try my best to return it by doing things to help more and more people as we grow.Every little bit helps and I want you to know that you're all making a huge difference.Thank you again to all of you who are reading this, you are part of something bigger than you may realize.

Steve, how are you actually gonna make these prints and Tshirts?  ANSWER: I'm doing the printing at Tech Shop here in Pittsburgh, where you pay a monthly membership (like a gym) but instead of exercise machines, you use tools in the machine shop, wood-working shop, and print shop.  Cut digital vector-graphics onto vinyl with computerized machines!  Easy, fun and I get to learn something new.

Yeah but what do you actually know about solar power?ANSWER:  I'm working here in Pittsburgh with a company called Zero Fossil, an electric energy supplier, using solar-powered sound systems for outdoor events.  It can be done, we're already doing it, and I plan to put these pieces together ASAP.  Thanks for asking.

Steve man, how are you going to make a whole album in one month?   ANSWER: It's already done! I've got the instrumental beats all in place ready for the live set.  Just need to record the vocals, mix them and master the album, which is not hard to do.

ok Mr. Knots, how do we know you are organized enough to pull this off?  Well, I spent the last five years working as soundman, booking agent and program manager in a music club (Mosaic House).  During this time I also co-founded the BLEM festival, which was a series of events combining DJ's, live electronic music, raw concrete abandoned urban spaces, and video projection art.  While doing these things I held several DJ residencies and started two bands -- Stallion Grip and Uptik Harmonik Orkestra -- to play both acoustic and electronic music for people who love to get sweaty and dance.  So I'm comfortable managing this kind of thing.

And that's all there is to it.

THE EARTH MUSIC PROJECT

Hello and welcome to The Earth Music Project. My name is Pedro Crump, I am an independent musician, pianist and composer born in Bogota, Colombia. I have a diverse musical background because I lived many years in Boston (USA) first studying Fine Arts at Curry College and then attending music schools like Berklee and New England Conservatory. I also lived in Paris where I collaborated with Radio Latina, a radio station that plays Salsa, Brazilian music and other urban latin music. Thees experiences helped me learn and view the music world in an ample way. Also, being far away from Colombia, made me realize the great richness of its music.

I have many musical influences like contemporary Jazz, progressive Rock from the 70s, Ambient, Minimalism, Classical, Cinematic music and of course Colombian music.  I am also very interested in the transformative effect music has upon us. All this, and my love for Nature made me start the series THE ELEMENTS: a collection of CDs celebrating the four Elements: Water, Fire, Earth and Air. I am also the director of my group, a sextet called EL CIRCULO DORADO (THE GOLDEN CIRCLE). We have been working together for five years in which we have become very close musically and personally and this has prepared us for this recording.

The Idea behind this campaign is that by inviting you to be a part of this project and pre selling our products, we will complete the funds to finance and finish the production of the album TIERRA (EARTH) the third in the serien THE ELEMENTS.
(The first album: EL SILENCIO DEL AGUA (THE SILENCE OF WATER) was published in 2006.  DORADO (GOLD - “The Color of Fire”), the second one was launched in 2010).
Earth is the third CD of the Series.
This third CD is an importan one of the Series because it celebrates EARTH, the ELEMENT and also THE PLANET. With this music we will promote consciousness towards the need for sustainable practices
column2: we are part of Nature and what we do to It, we also do to ourselves. Also awareness of the fact that we must take good care of our Planet and start cleaning up as soon as posible.

Please help me to build the Lilja Martin Scholarship Fund for the Evergreen Festival of the Arts.
I was the fortunate beneficiary of many scholarships which
helped me find my way to a career as a professional violinist, from The
Royal Conservatory, to Manitoba Government Bursaries, to the amazing
Wawanesa Mutual Insurance Scholarships at Brandon University. Now I want

to pay it forward.

I grew up in a community rich in culture but with limited resources for growth. My mother, Lilja Martin
had begun the same way, and was the catalyst for the opportunities
which lead to the career of which I am so grateful. Each year I
recognize more and more what inspiration, commitment and leadership she

brought to her teaching.

My violin studies began with her beloved brother Johannes Palsson, an
accomplished violinist. I was completely overwhelmed with the beauty of his
sound from before birth as he and my mother performed throughout the area for
every conceivable function. He developed my playing until age fourteen.
Harold Vidal, a family friend who was a professor at Brandon University was
instrumental in bringing me to Brandon on a scholarship provided
by Wawanesa Mutual Insurance. Harold was one of my guardian angels while I had
private violin, piano, and theory studies beginning with Albert Pratz and then
Francis Chaplin spanning eight years. Harold and Mr. Chaplin eventually helped

my parents and younger brother and sister relocate to Brandon.

A summer in Toronto with the National Youth Orchestra in 1971 gave me the taste of Symphony
Orchestra which ultimately inspired me to come to London where I benefited from the
kindness and generosity of my teacher, Ralph Aldrich. London became my home where I
enjoyed a forty year career with Orchestra London.
From the humble beginnings in Hnausa, Manitoba, I have been privileged at
every step of the way with unbelievable good fortune without which, my talent
would not have been of any value and I now honour my mother’s guidance and the

community that supported me.

At 2:30 on Sunday, April 19, at Johnson Hall in Gimli we will present a Benefit concert for this Scholarship.

I am privileged to have Todd Martin, Wesley Wilson, Heida Arnason, Don Benedictson playing on this concert. The program will be eclectic including some classical, gypsy, jazz, and swing. Please join us.

Admission: By Donation

Our Goal is Seven Thousand Dollars including all costs for this campaign.

The
scholarship is currently Two Hundred Dollars and a principal
amount of Six Thousand Dollars is necessary for to provide this scholarship annually.
Please support our campaign to build the “Lilja Martin Memorial
Scholarship Fund”. Contributions through Indiego, The Westshore Community
Foundation, and at the door on April 19th.

every conceivable function. He developed my playing until age fourteen.
Harold Vidal, a family friend who was a professor at Brandon University was
instrumental in bringing me to Brandon on a scholarship provided
by Wawanesa Mutual Insurance. Harold was one of my guardian angels while I had
private violin, piano, and theory studies beginning with Albert Pratz and then
Francis Chaplin spanning eight years. Harold and Mr. Chaplin eventually helped
my parents and younger brother and sister relocate to Brandon.A summer in Toronto with the National Youth Orchestra in 1971 gave me the taste of Symphony
Orchestra which ultimately inspired me to come to London where I benefited from the
kindness and generosity of my teacher, Ralph Aldrich. London became my home where I
enjoyed a forty year career with Orchestra London.
From the humble beginnings in Hnausa, Manitoba, I have been privileged at
every step of the way with unbelievable good fortune without which, my talent
would not have been of any value and I now honour my mother’s guidance and the

community that supported me. At 2:30 on Sunday, April 19, at Johnson Hall in Gimli we will present a Benefit concert for this Scholarship. I am privileged to have Todd Martin, Wesley Wilson, Heida Arnason, Don Benedictson playing on this concert. The program will be eclectic including some classical, gypsy, jazz, and swing. Please join us.Admission: By Donation
Our Goal is Seven Thousand Dollars including all costs for this campaign.The
scholarship is currently Two Hundred Dollars and a principal
amount of Six Thousand Dollars is necessary for to provide this scholarship annually.
Please support our campaign to build the “Lilja Martin Memorial
Scholarship Fund”. Contributions through Indiego, The Westshore Community
Foundation, and at the door on April 19th.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

","Pistol Fist's Wrist Soup Emily, Pete and Ben are friends who play music together. One beautiful day near the end of last year, Mike Wheeler of Don Zeno Productions converted our drummer's home into a recording studio. We recorded the basic tracks of our fourteen songs.
The album is in the mastering phase. We want to release it on vinyl. It rocks & rolls.
Help. We are looking for 4500 dollars.
Firstly, 1000-1250$ will be covering our accrued recording and mastering expenses to Central Vermont's own Don Zeno Productions.

Secondly, 3250-3500$ will then be going to the production of the album into as many formats as affordable, listed here in the order of priority: digital download, vinyl, compact disc, then, fingers crossed, cassette tape.
We have many one-of-a-kind offerings as perks, from instant parties to forever treasurable knick knacks. Look to the right.

Full disclosure, the future of Pistol Fist is evolving. Collectively we are: Expecting our first child, trying to sell our house, and making plans to move. That being said we are in love with this band enough to be committed to pursue it however necessary.
The production and physical distribution of the record of our musical efforts will be the propeller into our second chapter.
The music will not fulfill its destiny until it hits more ears.

Pistol Fist is comprised of founding members of the Goldendome Musicians Collective, who, with our record label, State & Main Records, have successfully produced 13 releases and counting, original EPs, compilations and LPs in mediums from vinyl to t-shirts with download code tags.
Listen to us and stuff here: https://pistolfistband.bandcamp.com
Watch our pitch video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UX12iQEC6b8",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
This is a short glimpse of the tracks that are going to be in the First EP. It is pretty raw and unmixed, but you can get a good taste of what it will sound like.
We are a musical duo called DizeeChroma. Our names are Staz &
column2: Leni. We live, work and study in NY. Making and playing music is our life. It's essentially the way we spend the majority of our days and we'd be eternally grateful if we could put all this creativity, energy, thoughts, sounds and images into some sort of tangible form. With the help of your donations we could do just that and in return we'll continue doing what we love, and hopefully put out music and art that's beautiful, provoking, but most importantly honest.

What You Get

This project is titled ""After the studio..."" for the following reasons:

column1: • We have already recorded all of the tracks and all that is left is the mixing and mastering of the albums...

In the case that we don't reach our goal, we will make the best use of whatever amount we gather and try to finish the mixing and mastering process and pay the people that we have worked with.

If we exceed our goal (!!!!) then we plan on using that money to enhance our live performances, buy some new gear, and most importantly save it for the next EP we plan on releasing hopefully by the end of the year 2015.

This completion of this project will launch a world of possibilities and capabilities for our musical futures, and the artistic futures of the people that we are working with, binding a very talented group of people into collaborating in promising projects in the future...

column2:
Challenges

The music is in the final stages of mixing and mastering, the music videos are in production, and the riskiest part of project will be marketing and promotions.  Thankfully, we have met some amazing people that are helping us fulfill these steps and we want to invest in their future as they have with us.   We appreciate all the work that is going into this project and your donations are going to help pay for these individuals hard work and time.

column1: You can absolutely help if you share and spread the word about this campaign and if you really like the music, party on and tell people!!!

Logan Arceneaux is a 17 year old Singer/Songwriter working with 7 time nominated Grammy Producer Haskel Jackson in Los Angeles, California.

Logan Arceneaux has 4 singles out at this time with more scheduled to come out throughout this year. Logan's fan base is growing internationally at a steady pace of approximately 500-800 fans per week. Logan's sound has been said by many to not only be unique but innovating. Logan has the ability to sing, write and produce many genres which has made her stand out from the crowd. Logan is booking shows this year at a rapid pace and has added dancers to her performance regimen to add even more value to her show. We have been selected to go perform in front of labels. Please help us get there!! :) <

column5: >With Logan's ability to perform many different genres, she has attained a fan base that continues to grow at every age range from 14-50+. To acquire a fan base with a vast following of ages alone is a major feat for any artist as you know. Logan is known for making music she loves and being relatable to a great majority of people from all walks of life. She and her team focus on quality, not quantity from which you will find by listening to her music. Logan's goal is to be a lifelong performing artist that is suitable and relatable to all age groups for life, not just hit what is appealing to some now. This feat, thus far, is being accomplished at remarkable speeds with great welcoming from the people on an international level. Logan's music is now being played on almost 250 radio stations internationally and she has been interviewed and featured by some of the industry leaders such as iHeart Radio, NowHipHop.com, EDMLive.com and many others. She is promoted by several
column6: such as, HJENT, Exodus Indie Label, The Akademia, Shelton Management, Genesoul Productions and more. I encourage you to Google Logan Arceneaux and see the results of just a few of this up and coming International artist's accomplishments.

column1: Meet Logan Arceneaux: Akademia Award Winner for Pop Cover Song February 2015! http://www.theakademia.com/february2015_bestsong_popcover.h…

Logan Arceneaux is now totally funded by her single mom, like many others, and she is struggling to keep up with the pace of how fast Logan Arceneaux's career is growing. Rapid growth in any business needs more capital. With music streaming, independent artists are making less and less. Sponsors aren't putting forth the funds they used to do to get their products out there to new markets. Industry still has not fully recovered. This campaign will allow their funds to be put towards more innovative ways ways to produce more income such as merch sales, etc and not bear the weight of all costs involved in producing more music and travel to perform at shows across the country for the different communities. Our marketing and development team has come up with many ways to grow but we just need a little more capital to initiate. You can see from past actions, we are here to produce and move forward. It's actions that speak, not words. We cannot thank you enough for your kind and thoughtful donations. All donors will be heard on social media outlets.
Here are some of Logan Arceneaux's Current Singles:

I’ve been singing all my life and over the 22 year history
of The O-Tones, a New England Swing and Motown band, I’ve had the pleasure and
good fortune of singing with many talented vocalists. Now is the time to get
into the studio to have some fun with this! I will be collaborating with a
dozen singers plus a rockin' rhythm section on hidden gems by Etta James, Ray
Charles, Anita O'Day, Keb' Mo', Shelby Lynne, James Hunter, kd lang, Mayer
Hawthorne, Dinah Washington, Allen Toussaint, and Mutlu, Here's where we are
now: www.theotones.com. And we are traveling to new heights with this endeavor!
Lechner (jazz vocalist, director of Rock Voices)
Henry (sings like butter, tours with Mary Chapin Carpenter, among others)
Cogen (jazzy director of Valley Jazz Voices)
Nayak (soulful singer of rani arbo and daisy mayhem)
Patterson (creative songbird, creator of Rise Up Singing)
Henry on guitar (one of our favorite sidemen, Jim works with a number of
touring musicians including Paula Cole, Tracy Grammer, among others)
Haynes on piano, organ, and accordion, as well as producer and arranger<span>  for the project (world class musician,
Dostal on bass (upright and electric, superb musicianship, has toured with

Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, teaches and performs liberally)

I will also
add my bass stylings on a few tunes, but will be kept busy singing with so
Struyk on drums (The O-Tones own drummer, incredibly versatile and talented, as
will include guitarists Jim Henry, Anand Nayak, John Caban, and John Mason as
well as sax players Charles Neville (of The Neville Brothers!) and Kerry Blount. Some songs will also have
horn sections covered by the above plus sax Rick Page, trumpet Don Anderson,
and trombone Joe Sabol. These soulful guys all have so much to contribute to
project is an ambitious one and we need help covering all the costs. That's
where you come in! If you can pre-buy the recording as well as consider some of
the other perks, and even kick in some extra to make it all happen smoothly, we
would so appreciate it! And please help spread the word too. It makes such a
difference to feel the support from our community. The O-Tones have gathered so
many friends over the years. We are so grateful for all the people who listen
and dance to and buy our music!
might sound like a lot but that's what it costs these days for a project like
this! We need to cover recording costs, artwork, photography, packaging,
distribution, you name it. But we hope you like the perks selection we offer in
exchange for your generosity and support!
are excited about bringing this project to fruition because it feels like the
culmination of many years of collaboration with other musicians, a real
community effort. One of the joys of music is playing it with other people, a
stimulating conversation! It's fun to imagine the coming together of all these
great artists. Going into the studio is always so rewarding, to be able to
record moments that just fly by in a live performance. The O-Tones have
recorded several CDs over the years (http://theotones.com/?p=songs) and each
one gets more ambitious and rewarding. Moving forward in this musical journey

""Where words fail, music speaks.""

                    ~ Hans Christian Andersen

OUR GOAL: to give kids the chance to learn, play, and love music and musical instruments for as long as they want.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Here's why we are raising our goal of $5,000 through Indiegogo:

Ever see a group of kids just enjoying the day, making sounds and

column1: harmonies you had no idea they could create? Does this melt your heart
as much as it does mine? My name is Dee Fretwell and I'm the founder of

the Modern Roots Foundation.

Here's what we do at the MRF:

We raise money, we spend money. Monthly fee payments go DIRECTLY to instructors providing music lessons and instruction to kids who couldn't afford it otherwise! It's that simple!
• A family who needs support applies to the Modern Roots Foundation.
• A kiddo and an instructor are matched together for upcoming lessons!
• The instructor is vetted and listed within the MRF system.
• The kiddo begins music lessons the very next available month!

In February 2015, we headed to Wintergrass Bluegrass Festival where we solidified our partnership with the WG Youth Academy so that in 2016 we can bring another team of kids to their acclaimed 2-day Academy. There, the kids work with Joe Craven and his crew of amazing talent for two days learning and playing, ending with an amazing afternoon of performances in front of hundreds!
column3:
/>


WEST COAST COUNTRY MUSIC FESTIVAL
Our annual awareness and fundraiser event, the 3rd annual West Coast Country Music Festival, kicks off next August 15th, 2014 at the Green Springs Inn in Ashland, Oregon! Check out our perks when you donate for some fun WCCMF '15 packages connected with this exciting event!

The Impact

It's no secret, school music programs are being cut all over. We can no longer rely on the school system to give our children the musical exposure they once received. And let's be honest, there is no comparison to the real deal... an instrument they can call their own, a teacher who dedicates an entire lesson each week to just them, a chance to be with other kids who share the same dream of making music simply for the act of making music... together!
column8:

Even if we don't reach our goal, the funds will become

Other Ways You Can Help

","""Where words fail, music speaks.""                     ~ Hans Christian Andersen

OUR GOAL: to give kids the chance to  learn, play, and love music and musical instruments for as long as they want.What We Need & What You GetHere's why we are raising our goal of $5,000 through Indiegogo:    Ever see a group of kids just enjoying the day, making sounds and
harmonies you had no idea they could create? Does this melt your heart
as much as it does mine? My name is Dee Fretwell and I'm the founder of

the Modern Roots Foundation. Here's what we do at the MRF: We raise money, we spend money. Monthly fee payments go DIRECTLY to instructors providing music lessons and instruction to kids who couldn't afford it otherwise! It's that simple!
A family who needs support applies to the Modern Roots Foundation.
A kiddo and an instructor are matched together for upcoming lessons!
The instructor is vetted and listed within the MRF system.
The kiddo begins music lessons the very next available month!

In February 2015, we headed to Wintergrass Bluegrass Festival where we solidified our partnership with the WG Youth Academy so that in 2016 we can bring another team of kids to their acclaimed 2-day Academy. There, the kids work with Joe Craven and his crew of amazing talent for two days learning and playing, ending with an amazing afternoon of performances in front of hundreds!WEST COAST COUNTRY MUSIC FESTIVALOur annual awareness and fundraiser event, the 3rd annual West Coast Country Music Festival, kicks off next August 15th, 2014 at the Green Springs Inn in Ashland, Oregon! Check out our perks when you donate for some fun WCCMF '15 packages connected with this exciting event!The ImpactIt's no secret, school music programs are being cut all over. We can no longer rely on the school system to give our children the musical exposure they once received. And let's be honest, there is no comparison to the real deal... an instrument they can call their own, a teacher who dedicates an entire lesson each week to just them, a chance to be with other kids who share the same dream of making music simply for the act of making music... together!Even if we don't reach our goal, the funds will become
immediately available for our scholarship applicants for the next session. Evaluated on a per-need basis, lessons, instruments and more will be made available to

some very excited kids.Join us in the Musical Movement to keep our kids connected!Other Ways You Can HelpUnable to donate right now? That's okay!Spread the word! My name is Noah Larssen, I am a 15 year old singer songwriter / blues musician out of Asheville North Carolina. It has been 2 years now that I have been a full time student and a full time artist, My journey so far with music has been more than amazing, I have had opportunities of a lifetime and I have met people who I will always look up too.

Now I feel like it is time to bring my career to the next level, I want want to introduce myself to the world and I want to take this first step into making my music available to anyone

To make this happen cost money, I am shooting for a goal of $3,000 this money would help cover the cost of studio time, mixing, mastering, and everything else involved with the single and the album.

Your contribution would help empower a dream I have always had, I want to bring joy to people through music, I want to show the world what I bring to the table, and how it can help or empower them to chase their own dreams

A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, That is a quote from Bob Dylan I am asking you to take this first step with me and my music, and theres no telling where it may take us.

Hello!! My name is Ana Barreiro, I'm a musician originally from Brazil now living in Los Angeles-CA where I am finishing my masters in Jazz Studies at the University of Southern California. I play the drums and have for over 14 years! Besides USC, I've also studied at the Conservatorio Souza Lima in São Paulo and went to Berklee College of Music for my undergrad. I've been studying music for a while and I love playing jazz and Brazilian music. I'm also passionate about people and one of my favorite characteristics of music is the strong connection that it can create with people. I love that music forces us to a deeper level of interaction and can translate a message from one individual to another.
Listen To The Story came to be after going to an
event at USC organized by the “Jewish World Watch” where they had Dr Denis

Mukwege speak about his work in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Dr Mukwege is the founder and medical director of Panzi Hospital in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), known for its support for survivors of sexual violence. After
hearing his stories, he told us to keep telling these stories so other people
would become aware of their situation. I realized that this is what musicians

column2: we try to tell stories. I've always heard from teachers how you should be telling a story when composing a piece of music, or when playing a drum solo. I decided then to combine our

column1: artistic role of storytellers with this calling from Dr Mukwege to share these
Listen To The Story is working towards creating music that tells the
stories of Congolese people and how the conflict over minerals have affected
their lives. Our purpose is to connect people through music, by sharing their stories to raise awareness and create a community that acknowledges things need to change.
Our goal is to tell four stories and have those recorded and made
available in any and every outlet possible. We will also record videos and
print booklets with artwork and information such as the lyrics, how to listen to these
stories and what to do to help. We aspire to create transformative and
informative music opening a door for people to think and act with what they

I believe that this project will open a door to reach people that otherwise wouldn't hear about these women, and also stimulate the artistic community to get more involved in diplomacy and world issues.

We are trying to raise $11000.

$1000 general expenses (choir transport $300+fees and taxes+in studio budget)

We have some reeeeeally exciting perks! All of them show our gratitude towards you. You can get postcards, a personalized poem, awesome CDs... and you can also be in the special thanks area of the booklet. :) See what works for you and get on board with Listen To The Story!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our project and ideas with your friends!!! Just as we are trying to tell stories, tell our story to anyone you think would consider engaging in our campaign.

The Hootshare Story

Welcome to Hootshare! Thank you for visiting our campaign. We began our journey early 2011 and have come a long way. The two founders, Tom and Gary first came up with the idea of a mobile application that can stream video in real time rather than record it on the device. This idea went through several iterations and we finally settled on the Hootshare model. So what is it?

First, Hootshare is a mobile application that is tightly integrated with the website Hootshare.com. The idea is to stream live video to the website so friends and family can see what you are doing in real time. Then we archive the video for later playback for those that can not watch right now.

Second, we wanted it to be social. Social Media is a great force in today's society. People want to share what they are doing. Hootshare lets you do that without delay, in real time. You can post links to your Facebook and Twitter accounts right from the app, without interrupting the stream. Once the stream ends, those links remain active and will point to the archived version of the stream.

Additionally, we wanted to make it secure. Some people will share with everyone, and we love that! It drives interest in your activities and builds the Hootshare brand. But, we know there are times when you need a little privacy too. So we have built a follow system that lets you decide who can see your streams!

Hootshare is built to be fun and easy to use, as intuitive as possible and did we mention fun?

The Future of Hootshare

So far we have the website and the initial (iOS) mobile application completed. We are almost ready to start beta testing, and begin working on the Android version. We also need to grow our infrastructure by adding more servers to handle the load when we go live. We dont want any server crashes!  We are continuing our R&
column2: D to enhance both the web site and applications with new and better functionally. That's why we need your help! With your generous support, Hootshare will be the phenomenal success we know it can be. And of course, we want to give you credit for all your support! Check out our perks to see how we plan to honor you!
column3: >The funding we receive will go towards the following:

column1:
With Your Support

We will bring Hootshare to the masses. It will be a free service for anyone to use, and will revolutionize the way we share video! We want to be the coolest and easiest social sharing program out there! Come join us on what we know will be an incredible ride!

I Love it! How can I help?

We love it too! You can help by supporting our campaign and helping us spread the word! 

  • Tell your friends about us, and how awesome Hootshare is!
  • Share, Post and Tweet @hootshare
• Like our page and share on your social media wall

• Tell us what you think, and what you would like to see Hootshare become!

    • Thank you for checking us out. We look forward to seeing all your wonderful hoots!

Ma fille a une maladie qui se nomme l'amyotrophie spinale type 2. C'est une maladie qui se compare à la sclérose latéral amyotrophique chez l'adulte. Elle a une grande faiblesse musculaire, doit porter un corset pour maintenir sa colonne vertébrale et elle circule en fauteuil roulant. Nous devons à chaque fois l’amener à la toilette lorsqu'elle a envie, faire 1 heures d'exercice physique et respiratoire à chaque jours et aller à de multiples rendez-vous médical. Heureusement, c'est une petite fille super attachante, pleine de vie et très intelligente.

Nous avons déjà déménagé et nous sommes temporairement chez mes parents. Le projet est de reconstruire une seconde maison et qui vas être adapté aux besoins de ma fille.

Nous voulons également que celle-ci soit la plus autonome possible lorsqu'elle circulera avec son fauteuil. Alors, je veux faire l'achat d'un élévateur pour qu'elle ait accès au sous sol comme le reste de la famille.

J'ai fait une demande d'aide financière au gouvernement mais qui nous a été refusé. C'es pourquoi que je demande cette aide.

Je veux rendre la vie de ma fille le plus normal que possible. Elle vivra avec le minimum de restriction physique.

Merci de nous appuyer

La famille Vignola

In cities and towns all over the country, kids and teens have no access to musical instruments. Music programs at schools are being cut, and music lessons are expensive. Without a hobby or outlet like music, many of these kids will go on to do destructive things to fill their time, often out of boredom or a desire to fit in somewhere. I personally saw many kids from my hometown drop out of school and abandon their dreams because they didn't find school or sports fulfilling. I realized that a program like Youth Music would give them a place where they would find people like them, as well as a hobby and a way to express themselves.

The Funding

Funds would go exclusively to these things:

We have a very low-cost approach. We plan on having our team of three people be the only workers in the initial program. We will travel to schools in the Santa Barbara area and work with them to form a schedule, as well as get access to a room in each school twice a week. Kids would be able to come in after school and spend a few hours learning and playing any instrument of their choice, for free. The three of us have extensive musical knowledge, so we would also offer free lessons for kids who choose to come to Youth Music every week.

We hope to grow Youth Music to the national level through crowd-funding, sponsorship and donations. As we grow we plan on continuing the low-cost approach, utilizing mostly volunteer workers, secondhand instruments and inexpensive buildings. We hope to eventually be able to award scholarships to teens who have participated in the program and have hopes of going to college. I believe that Youth Music has the potential to give young people an opportunity to not only express themselves and find a hobby, but also to give them the confidence and means to pursue their dreams.
Thank you for helping make their dreams a reality

Hey guys!

We're a four-piece indie rock band from Orlando, FL. We started playing music in early 2014. We've released one EP, toured around Florida, and up the East Coast. This is our passion. We absolutely love what we do, but we need your help! Recording and distributing a record can be extremely pricey and we've got some awesome rewards lined up if you decide to help us out! Thank you so so much for helping and supporting us. We're truly grateful!

Also, a huge shout-out to Sara for making such an amazing video!

column1: Vinyl on Demand will cater to short run orders (3- 88) for recording artists and labels while
column4: >Super Specific Vinyl is for the enthusiast, the collector or fan who wants a (rightful, legal) ""MIX TAPE"" 12"" of favorite songs, or a play copy of a rare record or just one copy of an original recording.

column1:
Immediate Funding Needs and Goals:
We plan to expand operations and triple our output in two more phases beginning in 2016. The funds we raised from the first IGG campaign (above the expenses of the inventory and operations to fulfill perks) were well spent on two websites  which will be launching before 9/30 (SuperSpecificVinyl.com and VinylonDemand.com). 
The funds we raise with this second, short, campaign will allow us to maintain operations through the New Year + add inventory (vinyl, sleeves) as we seek out a workspaces as well as develop collaborative partnerships with artists, record stores, labels and other vinyl vendors.

column2: >David Freel,  (the engineer) has been steadily cutting vinyl since 2012. Setting up just outside of Portland, OR he began filling orders for a dedicated (mostly European fan base) from a single catalogue of songs recorded by his band Swell. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swell_(band)

>Jennifer Dawson, (the manager) joined forces with Freel last year ( adding the SSV part to VOD) and she has been a film producer, professional surf instructor and project manager . Last year she founded Super Specific Devices. a company that designs, builds and wholesales tDCS devices.
>Andy Tenberg, (the rep) lives in Austin, TX and is a musician, a teacher, activist, coder. Andy joined SSVOD in August.  He is rad.  http://andytenberg.com/

column3: >How it works (and what you will get, by when)

column1: When you pledge your support to SSVOD + choose a vinyl perk we will send you a Drop Box link.  You upload the song files and we send you your vinyl*
Standard audio files are all fine: FLAC. wav. mp3, etc.
column2: > (The higher quality the mix and song files,  the better and songs should be finished  but you do not have to have your songs mixed for vinyl.)

Hi Jennifer!The vinyl came today! It sounds AMAZING :):):) Thank you sooooo much for this! I am hoping to put in future orders at some point. Are you guys extremely backed up now? Thank you again!!!!""  (He ordered 4 more)Who we are what we are up to: Vinyl on Demand / Super Specific Vinyl is one company with two parts.

Vinyl on Demand will cater to short run orders (3- 88) for recording artists and labels while Super Specific Vinyl is for the enthusiast, the collector or fan who wants a (rightful, legal) ""MIX TAPE"" 12"" of favorite songs, or a play copy of a rare record or just one copy of an original recording.

Immediate Funding Needs and Goals:We plan to expand operations and triple our output in two more phases beginning in 2016. The funds we raised from the first IGG campaign (above the expenses of the inventory and operations to fulfill perks) were well spent on two websites  which will be launching before 9/30 (SuperSpecificVinyl.com and VinylonDemand.com). The funds we raise with this second, short, campaign will allow us to maintain operations through the New Year + add inventory (vinyl, sleeves) as we seek out a workspaces as well as develop collaborative partnerships with artists, record stores, labels and other vinyl vendors.The Team:

David Freel,  (the engineer) has been steadily cutting vinyl since 2012. Setting up just outside of Portland, OR he began filling orders for a dedicated (mostly European fan base) from a single catalogue of songs recorded by his band Swell. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swell_(band)

Jennifer Dawson, (the manager) joined forces with Freel last year ( adding the SSV part to VOD) and she has been a film producer, professional surf instructor and project manager . Last year she founded Super Specific Devices. a company that designs, builds and wholesales tDCS devices.  https://www.linkedin.com/pub/jennifer-dawson/77/78/ba2
Andy Tenberg, (the rep) lives in Austin, TX and is a musician, a teacher, activist, coder. Andy joined SSVOD in August.  He is rad.  http://andytenberg.com/
How it works (and what you will get, by when)
When you pledge your support to SSVOD + choose a vinyl perk we will send you a Drop Box link.  You upload the song files and we send you your vinyl*
Standard audio files are all fine: FLAC. wav. mp3, etc. (The higher quality the mix and song files,  the better and songs should be finished  but you do not have to have your songs mixed for vinyl.)
Maximum length for 12"" is 20 minutes per side
Maximum length for 7"" is 4 minutes 30 seconds per side
You will receive a form with some options after you send us song files such as:
Label: No label, plain white label, white label with ""Side 1"" and ""Side 2""
Jacket: Plain Kraft, Plain White or one of two choices (we issues) for artwork
*Every Perk in this campaign will turn around in time for the holiday

BUT if you are in no rush - every perk is good for a year from time of purchase. If you purchase a Gift Certificates:  please note the cards  will be mailed immediately --- in good time for the holidays ---but cannot be redeemed until after Jan 1 2016.  All GC's from this IGG campaign will be good for one year (Jan 2017), are fully transferable and will include all necessary details to redeem for vinyl/perk.  Gift Certificate orders will be expedited and turn around is on average two weeks (but can vary).",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
<div>We are Dark Matter: An Artist/Producer duo consisting of Madison McFerrin and Jarred Barnes (ARKTKT). Our sound is hard to classify but we pull influence from several different genres
column3: B, Electronic, and Bass are among a few.

column1: We're currently based in NYC/NJ and plan to release our debut project at our debut show on October 8th at Brighton Music Hall in Boston, MA.

Dark Matter is completely independent. We handle all production/writing, marketing, and manufacturing all by ourselves! We do not have a label to do the heavy lifting for us so preparing and releasing a quality project is no easy task! We want to make sure we deliver the best body of work we possibly can to all of our supporters.
You may be thinking, ""5k is a lot of money to just release an EP...""

We can attest to the fact that the climate in today's music industry is very harsh. Due to sinking sales and streaming services monopolizing yet only paying indie artists around $0.007 a stream, earning a living as an honest, hard-working artist is extremely challenging. The struggle is real. Funding our campaign would not only help us achieve the short term goal of releasing a quality EP for our supporters, but it would also kick start our life-long dreams. As artists, it is our duty to create honest art that people can connect to.

Marketing, PR, Cinematography, Mixing and Mastering, and Physical Copies all come at a cost that is beyond our scope at this current point in time. By funding our campaign, you will be aiding us in a journey that began back in 2012 at Berklee College of Music!

The $5000 will go to the collective costs of professionally mixing and mastering, Marketing, creating music videos/photography, and producing physical copies for the Dark Matter EP. We also would use the money towards travel and accommodations for our upcoming show in Boston at the Brighton Music Hall.
Mixing and Mastering in today's market would cost anywhere between $400-$500 dollars for a 5 song project.
Cinematography done right would cost close to $1000...Physical copies are also close to $1000 for about 1000 copies.

Marketing via hiring PR will be the most costly aspect of our project.  As you know, social media plays an important role in the spread and distribution of music in today's age.  That being said, there is only so much our personal social medias can do, and because of that we are looking to hire outside PR to ensure our music reaches the masses.  Good PR can cost anywhere from $2500-$4000, and we want to make sure that we can hire the best team possible to push our project forward.  Since we are independent artists without a label to promote our product, hiring good PR will make the difference between staying local and going global.

column2: >The remainder of our fund will go towards travel and accommodations
column3: > for our debut show in Boston at Brighton Music Hall on October 8th.  We will each be traveling from our respective homes in NYC &amp
column4: NJ, and since we will be traveling separately, that unfortunately means double the gas.  This means a round trip travel fund of about $200, plus an additional $100 for one night's stay in a hotel.

column1: Any and all help towards funding and/or promoting our campaign is appreciated, even if it is simply sharing our link and listening to our music :)
THANK YOU SO MUCH, we can't wait to share with you what we have in store!
We are Dark Matter: An Artist/Producer duo consisting of Madison McFerrin and Jarred Barnes (ARKTKT). Our sound is hard to classify but we pull influence from several different genres
column2: Hip-Hop, R&B, Electronic, and Bass are among a few.

column1: We're currently based in NYC/NJ and plan to release our debut project at our debut show on October 8th at Brighton Music Hall in Boston, MA.

Dark Matter is completely independent. We handle all production/writing, marketing, and manufacturing all by ourselves! As artists, it is our duty to create honest art that people can connect to.

Marketing, PR, Cinematography, Mixing and Mastering, and Physical Copies all come at a cost that is beyond our scope at this current point in time. By funding our campaign, you will be aiding us in a journey that began back in 2012 at Berklee College of Music!
What We Need & What You Get

The $5000 will go to the collective costs of professionally mixing and mastering, Marketing, creating music videos/photography, and producing physical copies for the Dark Matter EP. We also would use the money towards travel and accommodations for our upcoming show in Boston at the Brighton Music Hall.
Mixing and Mastering in today's market would cost anywhere between $400-$500 dollars for a 5 song project.
Cinematography done right would cost close to $1000...Physical copies are also close to $1000 for about 1000 copies.

Marketing via hiring PR will be the most costly aspect of our project.  As you know, social media plays an important role in the spread and distribution of music in today's age.  That being said, there is only so much our personal social medias can do, and because of that we are looking to hire outside PR to ensure our music reaches the masses.  Good PR can cost anywhere from $2500-$4000, and we want to make sure that we can hire the best team possible to push our project forward.  Since we are independent artists without a label to promote our product, hiring good PR will make the difference between staying local and going global.

The remainder of our fund will go towards travel and accommodations for our debut show in Boston at Brighton Music Hall on October 8th.  We will each be traveling from our respective homes in NYC & NJ, and since we will be traveling separately, that unfortunately means double the gas.  This means a round trip travel fund of about $200, plus an additional $100 for one night's stay in a hotel.
Any and all help towards funding and/or promoting our campaign is appreciated, even if it is simply sharing our link and listening to our music :)
THANK YOU SO MUCH, we can't wait to share with you what we have in store!
