This Bard is Looking For a Little Love

Hello!  I am Mama Gina, Fearless Bard and Folk Artist.  I travel with an acoustic 12 string guitar, djembe and frame drum, sharing my Muse and all original music at festivals, book stores and shops, and living rooms all over the US.  Last year, a friend commented, ""Oh, you don't really write love songs, do you?""  I took that as a challenge, and looked and listened for love stories that needed to be told.  My new CD project ""I Remember Love"" has 10 stripped down, raw, acoustic songs about love - and it's all love.  A song for handfasting, the story of my love affair with Kali, a tale of soul mates, a chant reminding us that we are worthy of love, and more.  Your donation will help me finish the mixing, mastering and production of the CD, so that this music can be shared.
Keeping It Simple:  ""I Remember Love"" Happens With Your Donations and You Get Some Love Back

column4: >Recording studio, mixing and mastering, and the actual CD production take time and money, and while I have invested my heart and soul, and personal time and finances crafting this music, I need just a bit more love to finish the project.  $2,000 will cover the remainder of the cost of mixing, mastering and the digital production of the actual CDs.

column1: I know that you deserve great perks.  I am a traveling musician, and I want to be sure that I can deliver your rewards in a timely fashion.  So, I'm keeping it simple and straightforward, much like the CD.

column2: >Please know that I will not take your generosity for granted.  Should I not meet my $2,000 goal, I will do everything possible to finish the CD and provide your rewards timely.  I will keep you posted along the way.  And any money received over my $2,000 goal will go into my gas tank and travel expenses as I continue to tour.

column1:
The Songs

You probably want to know a bit more about what your donation will support.  I'll be sharing more details about each song, including the stories behind the stories, over the next few weeks.  In the meantime, here is a bit about each song:

I wrote ""Binding Wood"" as a Handfasting song for a lovely couple handfasted this past Spring.  ""I Remember Love"", the title song on the CD, is about my son and me, and our soul contract.  ""Collapse"" is a sweet ballad about love that is bigger than time and space, and I still get rather choked up when I sing it.  ""The Empress Down Rattlesnake Road"" is the willful, bluesy tale of my becoming an orphan and my love affair with Kali and she guides me through the process.  ""The Eagle and The Owl"" is a percussion and voice piece that you will want to play and sing along with.  ""Between"" - ah, this is about loving yourself.  The chant ""Worthy"" is such an earworm that my studio engineer said, ""I went home singing it.  It stayed in my head.""  There is an incredibly amazing ficus tree in Bonita Springs in south Florida that my friends call Grandmother.  I tell the story that she told me in ""Grandmother Tree"".  ""BeBop Betty"" is a jazzy/bluesy little number about a sprite that ""do what she love, and love what she do.""  Finally, ""Mamaji's Travelin' Hugs Workshop Show"" is inspired by a few hug workshops I have attended at festivals, and I know you'll love this stripped down, funky groove.

This Bardic Life

If you had asked me three years ago what this Bardic life would be, I would have told you that I would be traveling and singing my songs, telling my stories.  While that is part of it, I have learned so much in the last few years.  When I began traveling, I was reluctant to ask for help, to ask for donations, to ask for tips, to ask for money to play actual gigs.  I was afraid to ask to stay in people's homes, to ask if I could sleep on their couches and share meals.  This fearless Bard is not really fearless, but less afraid than I was about so many things.  I know now that this is a most vulnerable path - that asking for money to travel and play a gig is a fair exchange of energy, and that most folks really appreciate and value the intimacy of my music and performance.  I have learned that I am not here to simply share MY stories ... I am here to LISTEN ... to listen deeply ... to hear YOUR stories and share them with the world.  I have learned that folks are genuinely awesome and perfectly willing to let some stranger with a guitar enter their homes, sleep on their couch, and break bread (and sometimes share a bottle of mead) together, and that those moments provide great opportunities to connect on a very deep level.

I do what I love, and I love what I do.  Do what YOU love, and love what YOU do.  That is the message that I hope to convey with this new CD.  I don't do any of this alone.  Let's make this happen together.

Don't Have $1?  You Can Still Help!

Every single share, every time you reach out to a friend and let them know about my music and this campaign to get ""I Remember Love"" out to the world, it's all vital to me.  Please share this with everyone you know, and keep checking in.  I'll be posting stories about each of the songs - the stories behind the stories, lyrics, and perhaps some video from the studio sessions, over the next month.
Thank you for your support!  Share, share, share!

Peer Amid Mind \\ Tear the World Down out now!

Donate $1 to receive the album free.
Listen first before you commit:
https://soundcloud.com/goldenbowlmusic/sets/pee...

New concept for what my shows will be like: 

... put love into the Golden Bowl, and it will be redistributed to charity...
Hello, and thank you for listening to my story ^_^

Hey everyone, this is Johnathon (Golden Bowl). I am a 25 year old kid living in an apartment near downtown Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

I want to share my music with the world.

For the past two months, I’ve been working night and day creating music (I have written and produced 24 original electronic songs (various genres, including trap, dubstep, downtempo, and just general weird-step), all available to stream for free on my Soundcloud page), as well as 10 full length indie-hop-hop tracks I wrote and produced in collaboration with some other artists (7 of which comprise a brief album called x.x roads, detailing a poetic narrative of my mind in a dark place). I like to look at the 10 hip-hop tracks as an interesting way you can get to know me on a personal level. Electronic music has developed into such a discordant, cold, industrial place, which is cool, because that's the aesthetic of the times, but I like to put a twist on that by introducing myself as a person into my music. My goal is never to create something that doesn't contain my distinctive footprint: me. And I want to share that with you. The quirks and everything.

Since I’m interested in so many different kinds of art, I’m trying to build an internet-based network of electronic artists called Snailsnap. The goal is to bring together everyone out there like me, who’s working a 9-5 job and making music on the side trying to figure out how long we can take being in our current situation.

This would be an amazing way for me to dedicate more resources to developing and implementing the big ideas I have to build a collective from the ground up. 

If you can’t spare anything but you still want to show love, it would mean the world to me if you’d share my music with your friends. Thank you so much. Reach out to me on twitter or email if you ever want to talk about art, philosophy, history, culture, science, or the way your butter melted just right into the texture of your toast. Art is meant to be a social activity. It's about sharing minds, feelings, lives, and love.

Since I have so many social media accounts, I would like to let everyone know that I'm most active on twitter and soundcloud. If you'd like to talk to me, send me a direct message on either twitter or soundcloud (or both) and I promise I'll respond. I'll be on most of the time over the weekend.

Again, thank you so much.

Johnathon (Golden Bowl)

My personal commitment, my vision, and what I'll give you in return:

• Let's connect and get to know each other. For everyone who makes a donation, I will (if you want!) add you to my personal Facebook page so we can keep in touch. I commit to you that I will use any money I receive from you to create, and expand the horizons of what I'm able to do creatively. I have a lot of big ideas for the integration of visuals and lightshows (as well as emerging 3d and hologram technology), which I would love to be able to explore and maybe someday create with to share with everyone.
• But all that costs money, and it's not the type of thing that one person’s resources can generally accommodate. So here’s my idea. Let’s build it together.

• I want to begin something that I think can revolutionize what it means to be an independent artist in the age of the web. I want to build a giant network of artistic collaborators - a grass roots label and brand: Snailsnap. But not just another label and brand. A democratic label.

• I want to transform Snailsnap into an internet-based art label of the people. What that means is a label run by its members, all online, all seamlessly integrated with other large social media (and retailer) platforms. That means you pick which songs appear on the front page every day. You pick which songs make it onto regular Snailsnap mixtape releases.

• The structure of the site would be that it would have a central hub - a circuit of pages that represented the group as a whole. This would be the community forum, a place to meet, share sounds, ideas, visuals, words, to inspire, or to promote. Branching off the central hub would be each person's artist page. It would be a blank Wordpress (other than being configured to be connected with the central hub). This would allow artists to have complete and modular control over their presence and identity, which is something that is extremely important. At the same time, however, artists would be seamlessly connected with the community in a way that would allow them to manage their entire social media presence pertaining to music/art all in one place. I feel that artists shouldn't have to have to conform to some of the rigid features of  some of the popular music social media sites, but should still be able to reap the rewards of being part of a tight-knit community..
•  I’ll leave this idea here for now. But this is the direction I’m headed with my ideas.

• The primary core value of Snailsnap is this: 
    •  “Wanna see some quick change in your life? Seek out others who are helping others, and help them.""

• If you make any donation whatsoever ($1 minimum), you will receive a free copy of my forthcoming electronic album, ""Peer Amid Mind//Tear the World Down"", which is going to be released by the end of Sept 2015 (it's mostly done, just putting final touches on mastering and such). You will receive an email with a direct download link for the album and a sizable collection of my visual digital remixes that are intended to complement my music.
• I know this is a lot to read, but if you have made it this far, I thank you from the bottom of my heart. Let's talk.

Other Ways You Can Support me:

As I mentioned above, I don't expect everyone to give, and I don't want money to ever stop someone from hearing my music and sharing the creative passion and determination of spirit I have found within myself in the last few months and have really started to see in everyone around me. So, I want to provide a really easy way you can do me a huge favor that would mean the world to me without having to spend anything. ^_^
• Check out a small sample of my digital remix visuals: http://goldenbowlmusic.imgur.com/all/

I commit to you that I will use any money I receive from you to create, and expand the horizons of what I'm able to do creatively. I have a lot of big ideas for the integration of visuals and lightshows (as well as emerging 3d and hologram technology), which I would love to be able to explore and maybe someday create with to share with everyone.
But all that costs money, and it's not the type of thing that one person’s resources can generally accommodate. So here’s my idea. Let’s build it together.

I want to begin something that I think can revolutionize what it means to be an independent artist in the age of the web. I want to build a giant network of artistic collaborators - a grass roots label and brand: Snailsnap. But not just another label and brand. A democratic label.

I want to transform Snailsnap into an internet-based art label of the people. What that means is a label run by its members, all online, all seamlessly integrated with other large social media (and retailer) platforms. That means you pick which songs appear on the front page every day. You pick which songs make it onto regular Snailsnap mixtape releases.

The structure of the site would be that it would have a central hub - a circuit of pages that represented the group as a whole. This would be the community forum, a place to meet, share sounds, ideas, visuals, words, to inspire, or to promote. Branching off the central hub would be each person's artist page. It would be a blank Wordpress (other than being configured to be connected with the central hub). This would allow artists to have complete and modular control over their presence and identity, which is something that is extremely important. At the same time, however, artists would be seamlessly connected with the community in a way that would allow them to manage their entire social media presence pertaining to music/art all in one place. I feel that artists shouldn't have to have to conform to some of the rigid features of  some of the popular music social media sites, but should still be able to reap the rewards of being part of a tight-knit community..
I’ll leave this idea here for now. But this is the direction I’m headed with my ideas.
The primary core value of Snailsnap is this:  “Wanna see some quick change in your life? Seek out others who are helping others, and help them.""

If you make any donation whatsoever ($1 minimum), you will receive a free copy of my forthcoming electronic album, ""Peer Amid Mind//Tear the World Down"", which is going to be released by the end of Sept 2015 (it's mostly done, just putting final touches on mastering and such). You will receive an email with a direct download link for the album and a sizable collection of my visual digital remixes that are intended to complement my music.
I know this is a lot to read, but if you have made it this far, I thank you from the bottom of my heart. Let's talk.

Other Ways You Can Support me:As I mentioned above, I don't expect everyone to give, and I don't want money to ever stop someone from hearing my music and sharing the creative passion and determination of spirit I have found within myself in the last few months and have really started to see in everyone around me. So, I want to provide a really easy way you can do me a huge favor that would mean the world to me without having to spend anything. ^_^
Check out a small sample of my digital remix visuals: http://goldenbowlmusic.imgur.com/all/",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Johnny Davis and I am the producer and director of The 6, 7eventy, 8 Tribute Orchestra. I have been involved with music since I was seven years old and grew in up in a musical family. We all sang as children and were taught instruments in school and I learned the saxophone. I also loved listening to the total sounds of an orchestra or band and how they interacted and hence became a writer and arranger in my late teens. I have played professionally most of my adult life with my own bands and sometimes with other groups. Over the last 20 to 30 years, I have noticed much of the popular music that our youth are exposed to and directly targeted at, has become less and less musical and more negative. Much of pop music now is performed with recorded tracks with the performers speaking and not singing.

One of the goals of the orchestra production is to promote great pop songs with real singers and musicians playing the music. We are committed to only performing uplifting music and songs with positive and fun messages and at least half of the orchestra will be made up of younger musicians. Another goal is to expose our youth to the great sound of a string section in a pop setting, which you only normally get to hear in a symphony performance. There were many great arrangements using strings and horns beginning in the swing era and continuing on in the 60's and 70's. Then they slowly begin to decline with the use of synthesizers. Also, we are reintroducing the unique sound of vocal harmonies with our 6 vocalists, which has also been lost to a great degree.

I have worked on this project and goal for over 6 years and am now in the pre-production phase, which is to learn and put the show together with all of the singers and musicians. (31 people) This  is quite an undertaking and will take several months of rehearsals. Costs that are involved include rehearsal sound equipment rental, rehearsal room rental, music stands/lights, insurance, and special equipment for some of the orchestra positions. This includes a Yamaha CP300 for the piano position, a Nord Sateg 2 EX HP76 for the Synth 1 position, a Kurzweil PC3A7 for the Synth 2 position, and some additional percussion equipment. We use these special instruments to incorporate many of the new and contemporary sounds on top of the great traditional sounds of horns and strings to make the presentation more attractive to the younger generation. These costs have been researched and a cost and date will be listed on this site when they are purchased. This phase will cost approximately $30,000 to complete. Phase 2 will start at a later date and involve purchasing performance outfits and additional production assets.

While all of the musical and artistic work is completed along with the pre-production work, this project cannot be completed without funding and your support is greatly needed and appreciated. Thank you for your support.
b. Bond for equipment and room insurance.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

column1: From a total investment of under $8K, COPUS will have the potential to earn up to $30,000 in revenue - provided we reach our goal - sales of 2,000 CDs at live shows and online. Additional revenue will be garnered from song downloads and merchandise sales. These funds will enable the group to continue booking shows in the Bay Area as well as attract management able to book mini-tours to target cities: Chicago, Boston, Philadelphia, New Orleans and New York. A European tour will also be feasible. We currently have promoter contacts in London, Germany and France.

In the event COPUS does not raise $7,900 as anticipated, the funds raised will be used to create the sales funnel, order more CDs (quantity less than 2,000), and  decide whether to hire the publicist or college radio campaign promoter.

We thank you for your time and interest in COPUS.  Please remember that if you cannot contribute financially, you can always spread the word to your friends, family and contacts via social networking.

Our campaign ends in mid-December.  We would be happy to get your perk to you in time for Christmas, Hanukkah, and Kwanzaa if you desire.  If you would like your perk to arrive by a certain date, please indicate that on your perk order.  If you already have a copy of ""Aspects"", I'm sure there's someone you know who would be thrilled to receive one as well.  Thanks again!  Keep music &

* ""Aspects"" CD has been released to digital platforms including iTunes and Spotify.

“Aspects” is a COPUS CD that  includes 10 original compositions.  Through words and music this new CD explores the aspects of our lives – creatively, emotionally, physically, financially and spiritually.
“Aspects of you and me.  They are that which was, is, and evermore shall be!”

The CD is completed.  We were able to cover the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, paying musicians, manufacturing 100 CDs, and presenting a CD release party in historic North Beach.  Now we are seeking funds in order to:
* hire a promoter who would like to manage our college radio campaign - cost $2400.
* hire a publicist who would like to develop the 'buzz' for COPUS - both online and offline - cost $1200.
* manufacture 2,000 CDs for massive distribution - cost $2300.

* create an online sales funnel in the style of music marketing wizard John Oszajca of Music Marketing Manifesto.  The site CopusCD.com has already been reserved for this purpose and we are hiring someone to set up the sales funnel website to successfully market our brand to our target market internationally.
* Produce a music video of our award nominee track - ""Haves & Have Nots"".  Distribute the video via Youtube , Vimeo and other platforms such as cable television - cost $2000.

From a total investment of under $8K, COPUS will have the potential to earn up to $30,000 in revenue - provided we reach our goal - sales of 2,000 CDs at live shows and online. Additional revenue will be garnered from song downloads and merchandise sales. These funds will enable the group to continue booking shows in the Bay Area as well as attract management able to book mini-tours to target cities: Chicago, Boston, Philadelphia, New Orleans and New York. A European tour will also be feasible. We currently have promoter contacts in London, Germany and France.

In the event COPUS does not raise $7,900 as anticipated, the funds raised will be used to create the sales funnel, order more CDs (quantity less than 2,000), and  decide whether to hire the publicist or college radio campaign promoter.

We thank you for your time and interest in COPUS.  Please remember that if you cannot contribute financially, you can always spread the word to your friends, family and contacts via social networking.

Our campaign ends in mid-December.  We would be happy to get your perk to you in time for Christmas, Hanukkah, and Kwanzaa if you desire.  If you would like your perk to arrive by a certain date, please indicate that on your perk order.  If you already have a copy of ""Aspects"", I'm sure there's someone you know who would be thrilled to receive one as well.  Thanks again!  Keep music & poetry alive!",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

M'ont inspiré Pastora Pavon, Tomas Pavon, Manuel Torre, Mojama, et bien sûr Camarón, Morente, Pansequito, La Paquera, El Chocolate, la Familia Montoya et tant d'autre. column1: What do you get for your money?

You will get a very original CD. And I must admit that I don't have the money to produce it by my own. That's why I need your help. .. You will listen to some songs that I'm been polishing during some years. Some of them like a Fandango de Huelva dedicated to  Paco de Lucia havre already been performed with great response from the audience. Among the flamenco style you'll find  an Alegría, some Tangos , Taranto , Soleá por Bulería,  Soleá and a couple of bulerías. And some more of course.  Thanks for your time.


Et pour votre argent?

Mon nom est Thierry Boisdon. Je suis un chanteur de flamenco français vivant au Danemark depuis 1990. Je suis en train d'enregistrer un CD en compagnie de trois artistes flamenco renommés dans le milieu : Eugenio Iglesias, Torombo et Isidro Suarez. L'argent que je vais récolter financera les billets d'avion des sévillans, leurs cachets, le studio, le producteur (résidant à Helsinki), le logement et la nourriture ainsi que le cachets des autres musiciens qui contribueront au disque. Un projet ambitieux et coûteux - autour de 23.000 $.
I've been using quite a long time of my
life working and performing with flamenco singing. My inspiration comes from  Pastora Pavon, Tomas Pavon, Manuel Torre, Mojama, and of course Camarón,
Morente, Pansequito, La Paquera, El Chocolate la Familia Montoya  and so many others. But coming from a very different culture in
the west of France, having a very french voice,  I'm contributing with something very singular. Enough flamenco tho to get Eugenio, Torombo and Isidro envolved in
the project, which I feel very proud of. And you probably know how it is: if you compose some music, you want to share it. So this is my contribution to flamenco music.

J'ai dédié une grande partie de ma vie à étudier et chanter le flamenco. M'ont inspiré Pastora Pavon, Tomas Pavon, Manuel Torre, Mojama, et bien sûr Camarón, Morente, Pansequito, La Paquera, El Chocolate, la Familia Montoya et tant d'autre. Venant d'une toute autre culture (angevin) et possédant un timbre de voix français je contribue avec quelque chose de singulier. Suffisamment flamenco pour que les flamencos authentiques rencontrés au cours d'une tournée accepte de participer au projet. Voici donc ma contribution au flamenco , avec des compositions que je désire naturellement partager.
What do you get for your money?

You will get a very original CD. And I must admit that I don't have the money to produce it by my own. That's why I need your help. .. You will listen to some songs that I'm been polishing during some years. Some of them like a Fandango de Huelva dedicated to  Paco de Lucia havre already been performed with great response from the audience. Among the flamenco style you'll find  an Alegría, some Tangos , Taranto , Soleá por Bulería,  Soleá and a couple of bulerías. And some more of course.  Thanks for your time.Et pour votre argent?

Vous recevrez un CD très original. N'ayant pas les moyens de le produire moi même j'ai besoin d'aide. Vous pourrez écouter des ""chansons flamencas"" que j'ai polies pendant plusieurs années. Il y a par exemple un Fandango de Huelva dédié à Paco de Lucia qui plait beaucoup en concert. Il y aura une Alegría, des Tangos, Soleá por Bulerías, Soleá, des bulerias , un Taranto et davantage.

column3: >    FM Collective is Mike Lucero's indie music project featuring Mike collaborating with artists from famous Seattle bands including the Posies, R.E.M., Hey Marseilles, Cataldo, Fences, Heart, Creme Tangerine, Portugal the Man, Tennis Pro, Michael Kroll, Peter Benjamin, Hemlock Pop and Shaprece. FM Collective released their debut CD last fall and have played to hundreds of fans, with all of those efforts going to benefit MusiCares.  The song, ""The One That Matters"" is the first single off of the album and is a collaboration between Mike and Ken Stringfellow (The Posies, R.E.M., Big Star). This song (featured in the video above) explores love, war, and what goes through a soldier's mind in his final moments on the battlefield.

en juin 2014 avec le club des Knights de Neuchâtel, notre équipe compte 15
seule équipe de Flag Football Féminin en Suisse,nous
poussons la porte des tournois internationaux. A ce jour,  nous avons pris part
trois matches amicaux ainsi qu’à un tournoi officiel en France où ce sport est
très développé. La confrontation à un niveau bien supérieur au nôtre ne nous a
la quatrième place lors du tournoi Flag Amazone à Villepinte!

tant que membres de la sélection nationale, nous faisons preuve d'une motivation sans limite et redoublons d'efforts pour réussir notre challenge et gagner notre place aux Championnat d'Europe à Pinto,
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Notre équipe a besoin de fonds. L’aide du club des Knights de Neuchâtel est précieuse mais ne suffit pas car nous voyons haut et loin! En effet notre objectif de représenter la Suisse au Championnat d'Europe à Pinto en septembre implique des coûts importants.
Voilà pourquoi nous vous proposons de prendre part à cette aventure en financant notre équipe!!
Les maillots et inscription au championnat sont pris en charge par la fédération.
Les fonds que nous recherchons visent à couvrir :
1. La participation au championnat : transport Neuchâtel - Pinto, logement et repas sur place : environ 600.- CHF par personne, soit 10'800.- CHF pour l'équipe et coaching staff.

2. Le développement de notre équipe: acquisition de matériel d’entraînement, location de salles, éventuels équipements supplémentaires, transports lors des matchs à l'extérieur, etc.

En participant au financement vous pouvez recevoir en contrepartie des bracelets, photos, drapeaux, ballons et calendriers de notre équipe dédicacés ! En plus de pouvoir venir vous entrainer avec nous lors d'une initiation !
Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer avec de l'argent, pas de soucis faites passer le mot autour de vous ! Cela rendra notre sport plus connu et ne pourra que nous aider à grandir !

Notre équipe ne demande qu’à progresser et élargir ses objectifs. Pour atteindre ce but nous ne manquerons jamais d’effort et de volonté. Aujourd’hui nous comptons sur vous pour prendre part à cette aventure car ensemble nous irons plus loin.

This album features Spirit Renewing Indie Rock with a Great Positive Energy!

All original music written by Brenda Howard and features Brenda on Vocals, Background Vocals, Acoustic, Rock Style Flute, and Native American Flutes.

This music album also features the world renowned talents of Bobby Fisher on Guitar, Mandolin and Keys, Michael G. Ronstadt on Cello, Jeff McLemore on Bass and Brian Malone, Percussion.

Brenda Howard is a Carnegie Hall performer, recording artist, vocalist, songwriter and studio musician and has been featured in commercials and on other artists albums as well. Brenda has not only held principal positions on flute and piccolo in symphony orchestras but is also widely known for her rock~jazz~fusion~ freestyle flute performances and has performed countless featured artist concerts in the U.S. 

Recording a professional, broadcast ready, music CD, not only takes countless hours of writing and perfecting the songs, professional instruments and years of training,  but it also takes quite a bit of money to be able to pull the entire thing off. 

The funds raised for this album project will go toward:  copyright of songs, recording, studio time, engineering, mixing, travel, musicians, photography, design of CD covers, printing, pressing, packaging, distribution, advertising, website, web design, marketing, rehearsal time and a live CD release show after the entire process is complete to promote the release of the NEW ALBUM. 

There will be some great perks provided for all of the financial investors!

This ""Brenda Howard Album Project"" is planned to hit the recording studio on the first of the year of 2016.

It is people like you, the supporters of the independent artist, that make all of this possible.  You are directly investing in the release of a great music CD and furthering an independent artist's career!  Just a simple financial gesture can leave a profound mark on an individual music career, the music industry, and will be played by countless numbers of people till the end of time!   Thank you so very much!!!     www.BrendaHowardMusic.com

For the past 6 years I've been dedicated to write and produce songs in the Latin genre, while pitching to opportunities in the music industry.  Every day expectations and challenges grow higher: competition comes from all corners of the world and  more accessibility to creative minds and talented artists is rapidly occurring than ever.  During these years I have invested already thousands of dollars in pursuing success and promote my talent. I have recorded and produced complete albums and singles in very well recognized studios locally. In 2011 I won the Hollywood Music in Media Awards for the Latin category.  M
column5: >ore recently various of my songs have being selected for different licensing opportunities.  I can only say that I want more and I want to become a real professional to step up into the big league arena.  It is not an easy task and it requires a lot of determination and discipline, and yes it does require continuous investment.  Just recently I grabbed the attention of a very successful Latin music producer and manager with 25 years of experience in the industry.  He has endorsed me to a development program for selected songwriters and producers to work with his pool of artists and become part of his team.  For discreet reasons, p
column7: >lease send me a personal message and will tell you his name.
column11:
>It is an honor for me and a super challenge at the same time: is a multi song creation program (10-12 songs minimum) to finally elect 3 that will worked fully and professionally for one of artists' portfolio. It is a team effort and I'm required to invest only 1/3 of the total cost.  I'm reaching out for your support in funding this project to help develop to a professional level and boost my career in the music industry.  Thanks. 

","For the past 6 years I've been dedicated to write and produce songs in the Latin genre, while pitching to opportunities in the music industry.  Every day expectations and challenges grow higher: competition comes from all corners of the world and  more accessibility to creative minds and talented artists is rapidly occurring than ever.  During these years I have invested already thousands of dollars in pursuing success and promote my talent. I have recorded and produced complete albums and singles in very well recognized studios locally. In 2011 I won the Hollywood Music in Media Awards for the Latin category.  More recently various of my songs have being selected for different licensing opportunities.  I can only say that I want more and I want to become a real professional to step up into the big league arena.  It is not an easy task and it requires a lot of determination and discipline, and yes it does require continuous investment.  Just recently I grabbed the attention of a very successful Latin music producer and manager with 25 years of experience in the industry.  He has endorsed me to a development program for selected songwriters and producers to work with his pool of artists and become part of his team.  For discreet reasons, please send me a personal message and will tell you his name.  It is an honor for me and a super challenge at the same time: is a multi song creation program (10-12 songs minimum) to finally elect 3 that will worked fully and professionally for one of artists' portfolio. It is a team effort and I'm required to invest only 1/3 of the total cost.  I'm reaching out for your support in funding this project to help develop to a professional level and boost my career in the music industry.  Thanks.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: ""Converted garage into a soundproofed music studio, providing local musicians a cheaper alternative to record their material.""

Following a dispute with a neighbour a couple of years back over sound, I decided to make the decision of converting my garage into a studio, originally for my band. Unfortunately my home experienced a flood and it postponed the whole project by 9 months. Thankfully, when everything eventually returned to normal, I continued with the project, funding £1,000 so far in soundproofing and recording equipment. Its come a long way, but there is still the roof to be soundproofed, then plastering one of the walls where a projector will be installed. More instruments and electrical equipment will also need to be set up in order to complete the studio.
column2: >The project was inspired by various artists struggling with the current economic situation with them barely being able to afford recording costs which can prove to be pricy. Having my own independent label and studio as a producer would grant me the power to invite these artists over and record a lot cheaper with a professional quality. Music is my passion and I'd love to help inspire others to reach for theirs.

column1: Henry - Artist, Song Writer, Producer, Session Musician &

column2:
What You Get

Approximately £1,000 in funding will provide enough for the rest of the materials needed in this project. The roof is the last part of the soundproofing not finished yet and it has proven a high cost and won't get completed anytime soon without funding or help. As well as this, recording material is also essential. Microphones, amps, decks, instruments and other contributions are needed to make this project a success.

column1: With a donation or contribution to the project you'll be able to personally benefit from the project depending on what you would like from it.

Your impact will immensely contribute to the project and benefit it greatly. Whatever your contribution actually is whether big or small it not only helps with the essentials needed in a studio, but advertises its campaign also reaching out to local musicians and creative thinkers as well as across the globe.

The challenge is to ensure the garage is almost completely sound proofed which is extremely expensive. I'm trying to keep it as cost effective as possible because I can only earn so much a month as well as putting the money into this. I have spoken to the neighbour recently and have come to an agreement at the moment on times I can play sound. However it isn't enough to run the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Helping this project does't necessarily mean making a donation. You can also share and help spread the word. Contact me for any donations of equipment, soundproofing material or simply anyway you think you can help make it successful.
Converted garage into a soundproofed music studio, providing local musicians a cheaper alternative to record their material.""

Following a dispute with a neighbour a couple of years back over sound, I decided to make the decision of converting my garage into a studio, originally for my band. Unfortunately my home experienced a flood and it postponed the whole project by 9 months. Thankfully, when everything eventually returned to normal, I continued with the project, funding £1,000 so far in soundproofing and recording equipment. Its come a long way, but there is still the roof to be soundproofed, then plastering one of the walls where a projector will be installed. More instruments and electrical equipment will also need to be set up in order to complete the studio.  The project was inspired by various artists struggling with the current economic situation with them barely being able to afford recording costs which can prove to be pricy. Having my own independent label and studio as a producer would grant me the power to invite these artists over and record a lot cheaper with a professional quality. Music is my passion and I'd love to help inspire others to reach for theirs.
Henry - Artist, Song Writer, Producer, Session Musician & Entrepreneur.

What We Need & What You Get Approximately £1,000 in funding will provide enough for the rest of the materials needed in this project. The roof is the last part of the soundproofing not finished yet and it has proven a high cost and won't get completed anytime soon without funding or help. As well as this, recording material is also essential. Microphones, amps, decks, instruments and other contributions are needed to make this project a success.
With a donation or contribution to the project you'll be able to personally benefit from the project depending on what you would like from it.

Your impact will immensely contribute to the project and benefit it greatly. Whatever your contribution actually is whether big or small it not only helps with the essentials needed in a studio, but advertises its campaign also reaching out to local musicians and creative thinkers as well as across the globe. Risks & Challenges

The challenge is to ensure the garage is almost completely sound proofed which is extremely expensive. I'm trying to keep it as cost effective as possible because I can only earn so much a month as well as putting the money into this. I have spoken to the neighbour recently and have come to an agreement at the moment on times I can play sound. However it isn't enough to run the project.   Other Ways You Can Help Helping this project does't necessarily mean making a donation. You can also share and help spread the word. Contact me for any donations of equipment, soundproofing material or simply anyway you think you can help make it successful.

What is Monsters of Rap?

My name is Joe Weber, AKA Bzuka Joe, and I'm a Hip Hop producer out of Los Angeles.  A while ago I had an idea to make a rap album told from the voices of classic movie monsters.  I wanted to give a voice to these often misunderstood and villainized characters and see what they had to rap about.  With the help of my friends I was able to put out the album just in time for Halloween. 

Why Make a Music Video?

Listening to a song is fun.  Seeing a performance of the song is 1000x more interesting, especially when monsters are involved.

What will make this video look great is attention to detail.  In this case that means costumes, set design, make-up and lighting.  It wouldn't be a big deal if it was a small production, but since the video will take place at a monster party with lots of monsters, that means a lot of costumes and make-up.

You can donate towards our campaign! Any amount is a great amount. You have the chance to make this video special. Everything donated puts us closer to achieving our goal of making a dope monster party video.
In the meantime, check out soundcloud.com/monsters-of-rap to hear the tracks!

Who is Hooseki?

My name is Jared ""Hooseki"" Leckey. I am 19 years old and have been actively pursuing music professionally for over 5 years. I currently study Radio Broadcasting and Audio Production at the East Valley Institute of Technology in Mesa, Arizona. My passion is to write songs that help people get though tough times and undesired situations.

Recently I auditioned online via YouTube for TeamBackpack's CypherDraft and I have been asked to perform a live audition at Mission Underground Los Angeles (MULA). MULA is the event and venue that the auditions will take place.

Here is my audition video:

TeamBackpack is an online entertainment hub for the global underground/independent hip-hop music scene and is based in San Francisco, CA. TeamBackpack has showcased popular hip-hop artists such as Hopsin, Krizz Kailiko, Lecrae, as well as up-and-coming ""Heavy Hitters"" like Emoney, Jeff Turner, and Obiv.
Mission Underground will take place in Los Angeles, and if you wish to come see me audition, purchase tickets HERE  and use the code HIP-HOP4LIFE for 20% off.

You can be a part of promoting encouraging, clean lyrics and together help to inspire our hip-hop culture with heartfelt solutions to the very real and daily struggles we go through as young adults. You can help bring the message of courage and consistency to help people overcome inner conflicts and troubles in relationships.
You will be impacting new audiences as my music reaches ears and eyes that would not normally be exposed to my positive style and creativity.
The rappers, producers, singers, musicians, and internet personalities
that performed with me at Bravefest and I would be very grateful for the opportunity to help each other further
The total amount I need is $1075. Sounds like a lot, but let me break it down for you:

The $700 support would pay for my basic travel and modest food expenses so I can perform at Team Backpack and travel and stay throughout Southern California for 10 days to network with about a dozen like-minded talented artists.

The remaining $375 would pay for ordering the first set of CDs, cover art design and lyric videos for my debut EP, ""Black Jade"". It is my first formal release as an independent artist and I have been spending the past 9 month perfecting and polishing it.

For your $15 donation, you will receive an early download of my debut EP ""Black Jade"" a week before it drops on iTunes! (PLUS limited edition cover art exclusively for my supporters!)

For your $55 donations, you will receive the early download, limited edition cover art,  a special thank you Skype/FaceTime call, plus a shoutout to your twitter in my thank you video!

For you $100 donations, you will receive everything mentioned previously, plus a VIP ticket to my next concert!

For your $250 donation you will receive all of the above PLUS I will perform a private concert at your home for you, your family and friends. I will perform all my songs, released and unreleased, and I will perform a custom song I made just for you*! Only 3 of these are available.

    The Impact

    You will help me reach the staff, performers, and fans at the Team Backpack cypher with music and lyrics that will elevate the atmosphere and redirect the energy toward inspirational messages. 

    Being able to participate in a TeamBackpack cypher will challenge my creative limit as a lyricist and give me an opportunity to showcase my style as an artist for the positive future of hip-hop.

I will still travel to Los Angeles for the competition, however, I would need to forgo important career opportunities. Please rest assured that I am not asking for money for a vacation or a field trip to LA. This is strictly to reach destinations and eat modestly yet healthily for the purpose of building important networks and promoting the completion of high quality projects.

Other Ways You Can Help!

I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute, but there are still many ways you can help:

  • Tell your friends, family, cat, dog, goldfish, anyone who will listen
• Share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook...does anyone still use email?

• Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    • Thank you so much for your support! 


    *The custom song is not limited just to you, but friends, a family member, as a surprise gift, birthday present, special event or for a loved one. During the Skype/FaceTime call we will discus the topic and who the song is for.  I will produce, write, and record this song from scratch using your topic! If you want to be part of the writing process, you are more than welcome to be! :D

TeamBackpack has showcased popular hip-hop artists such as Hopsin, Krizz Kailiko, Lecrae, as well as up-and-coming ""Heavy Hitters"" like Emoney, Jeff Turner, and Obiv.
Mission Underground will take place in Los Angeles, and if you wish to come see me audition, purchase tickets HERE  and use the code HIP-HOP4LIFE for 20% off.
What You Gain & What You Give

You can be a part of promoting encouraging, clean lyrics and together help to inspire our hip-hop culture with heartfelt solutions to the very real and daily struggles we go through as young adults. You can help bring the message of courage and consistency to help people overcome inner conflicts and troubles in relationships.
You will be impacting new audiences as my music reaches ears and eyes that would not normally be exposed to my positive style and creativity.
The rappers, producers, singers, musicians, and internet personalities
that performed with me at Bravefest and I would be very grateful for the opportunity to help each other further
The total amount I need is $1075. Sounds like a lot, but let me break it down for you:

The $700 support would pay for my basic travel and modest food expenses so I can perform at Team Backpack and travel and stay throughout Southern California for 10 days to network with about a dozen like-minded talented artists.

The remaining $375 would pay for ordering the first set of CDs, cover art design and lyric videos for my debut EP, ""Black Jade"". It is my first formal release as an independent artist and I have been spending the past 9 month perfecting and polishing it.

For your $15 donation, you will receive an early download of my debut EP ""Black Jade"" a week before it drops on iTunes! (PLUS limited edition cover art exclusively for my supporters!)For your $55 donations, you will receive the early download, limited edition cover art,  a special thank you Skype/FaceTime call, plus a shoutout to your twitter in my thank you video! For you $100 donations, you will receive everything mentioned previously, plus a VIP ticket to my next concert!For your $250 donation you will receive all of the above PLUS I will perform a private concert at your home for you, your family and friends. I will perform all my songs, released and unreleased, and I will perform a custom song I made just for you*! Only 3 of these are available.    The ImpactYou will help me reach the staff, performers, and fans at the Team Backpack cypher with music and lyrics that will elevate the atmosphere and redirect the energy toward inspirational messages.  Being able to participate in a TeamBackpack cypher will challenge my creative limit as a lyricist and give me an opportunity to showcase my style as an artist for the positive future of hip-hop.
If We Don't Reach Our Goal...

I will still travel to Los Angeles for the competition, however, I would need to forgo important career opportunities. Please rest assured that I am not asking for money for a vacation or a field trip to LA. This is strictly to reach destinations and eat modestly yet healthily for the purpose of building important networks and promoting the completion of high quality projects.
Other Ways You Can Help! I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute, but there are still many ways you can help:  Tell your friends, family, cat, dog, goldfish, anyone who will listen
Share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook...does anyone still use email?

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!   Thank you so much for your support! *The custom song is not limited just to you, but friends, a family member, as a surprise gift, birthday present, special event or for a loved one. During the Skype/FaceTime call we will discus the topic and who the song is for.  I will produce, write, and record this song from scratch using your topic! If you want to be part of the writing process, you are more than welcome to be! :D",0.0,3,"1 Campaign

The ART IS life Tour is a reflection of true rawness, where an intense mode of uniqueness is expressed through music and spoken word.  This is not your regular scheduled poetry jam
column2:
this tour explores the mind of an artist. The purpose of this ARTIST tour is to embrace the importance of art, music, and spoken word and how it breaks barriers in the community. 

Meet Orville the Poet, Flowetry Man the #PoeticRockstar, ""I AM"" Mariah Ivey, Yusha Assad, and the Future Band in a true reflection of true rawness. Five ARTISTs, from different walks of life, coming together to give you a reflection of music. 

This tour is to spread love, truth, and peace through music. The tour will take place during the spring 2015 (March 20, 2015-June 20, 2015) and visit cities along the East Coast and Midwest. For more information about the tour please visit www.artislifetour.com!

- All shows will start 8pm

- The show will run 2 hours

- Each artist will get 27 min.

- We will have a guest artist open (10min slot, artist will change depending on the city)

- Each artist has merchandise and would be sold at the venues

- 150+ will be attending

Tour Cities:

Washington, DC

Silver Spring, MD

Richmond, VA

Baltimore, MD

Philadelphia, PA

New York City, NY

Charlotte, NC

Atlanta, GA

Chicago, IL

Detroit, MI

LET GET THIS STARTED:

It's time to take the big leap! With the blessings from  family, friends and fans, the Shawn Faler Band is ready to record their new album. Co-Produced by Dave McAfee(drummer) &
column2:
Dink Cook(Bass) for Toby Keith's Easy Money Band,  along with many other major tour musicians will puts this project in the best hands possible! The opportunity to share the music has been written by Shawn as well as some top songwriters in the music business will be the beginning to a fresh new start and an amazing journey!

FROM THE BEGINNING:

The country music industry has long been viewed as a strong range of talent that has evolved over the years into a more modern format: From newcomers to legends the talent has been diverse and has escalated to new heights when it comes to the talent and song material that has come out of Nashville over the last few decades. However many artists are influenced by a wide range of artists from Country, Christian, and Rock, and the industry has reflected the talent of these diverse individuals including Nashville Recording Artist Shawn Faler.
column4: >After high school and college, Shawn decided to put his dreams of being a country music recording artist on hold and joined the United States Navy. He dedicated 15 years of his life to his country where he became a highly-decorated 1st class Petty Officer as an Aircraft Director aboard some of the Navy's largest aircraft carriers. Shawn also for several years enjoyed another passion as a bull rider while for some time Shawn became a bull rider with the Northwest Rodeo Circuit and Military Pro Circuit. After several injuries, Shawn decided it was time to retire from the circuit and once again focus on his one true passion, his musical career.
column6: >After taking a break from music and serving his country, Shawn decided to move to Nashville with his wife Ginger in the summer of 2007 to focus more on his country music. Shawn was quickly picked up by AMI Records but found out how fast things in the music business can change. Through networking on the internet, Shawn came into contact with Jim Frazier of SoundStar Entertainment Group and Visionway Records Nashville. In January of 2009 Shawn set up a meeting with Jim Frazier, renowned recording producer-owner and CEO of Visionway Records Nashville. Jim had an instant connection with Shawn and immediately began to set the wheels in motion for his upcoming CD project. After beginning pre-production Shawn and Jim Frazier’s family became really close friends. In the summer of 2010 Visionway Records released Shawn’s debut Single and CD project titled ""Here I Am"": Which he dedicated to all the service men and women that he has proudly called brothers and sisters for many years. They are the true heroes that never hesitate when there country calls them to duty.
column8:
>SHARING THE STAGE:

The Shawn Faler Band have been very blessed. Since moving to Nashville Shawn and the band have shared the stage and opened for many of the great country music  artists To name a few of those band and Artist, they have included Rascal Flatts, Eric Church, Daryl Worley, David Ball, David Frizzell, T Graham Brown, Linda Davis, Restless Heart, Andy Griggs, Ty Herndon, Jamie O'Neal, Michael Twitty, Jonathan Frizzell, Amy Grant and Vince Gill just to name a few.

AFTER THE COMPLETION OF ALBUM:

Once the Shawn Faler Band has wrapped up the album, they are planning on releasing it to radio across the country and internationally. Their long term goal to come off this new album will be to shop it out to major record labels in hopes to get signed to a major record deal. 

With your help and support funding this project, we hope to accomplish the following:

1. This project will allow us to fully fund any and all recording sessions for the EP.

2. Full and complete recording, mastering and production of our EP from beginning to end!

3. Promotion campaign to National &
column9:
International broadcasting radio stations.

4. Shop our new album to major record labels for a major recording contract. 

Please join us as we take our first step to a fresh new start.


You can follow the Shawn Faler Band on Facebook, Twitter, and ReverbNation with the links below:

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/ShawnFalerBand
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/ShawnFalerBand 
ReverbNation: http://www.reverbnation.com/ShawnFalerBand

Since then, my professional and personal life has become much more complex in

to work on creating a new album, but I want to do it right.

will raise the bar significantly, containing all the aesthetic elements of the

Pearls Negras, one of the most exciting groups to emerge from Brazil have been invited to perform on dance stage of the largest music festival in the world, Glastonbury. They will be the only Brazilian band playing in the entire festival.

The group of teenage girls from the Vidigal Favela in Rio have become an internet sensation with their mixtapes being posted across the web by the likes of Rolling Stone, Dazed and Confused and Noisey. All this has come to the attention of the Glastonbury Festival organisers who have booked them to perform on the main dance stage in June 2015 alongside some of the world's biggest stars.
Watch the mini Pearls Negras documentary by Nowness magazine here:
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

The group are looking for help to cover the cost of their tour to Europe, which would be a once in a lifetime opportunity for them to bring their music to a wider audience at the world's largest music festival.
So far, they are booked to play in England, Spain, Slovakia and Sweden and we are looking for funding to cover transports and accommodation.
column10:
> 

We have a variety of exclusive Pearls Negras items to offer if you decide to help us make this dream come true!

Check out our exclusive t-shirts &
column11:
hats:


Thank you!

Who is North Coast Winds?

North Coast Winds, a professional woodwind quintet established in 2013 by graduates of the Cleveland Institute of Music, is quickly gaining a reputation for high quality, innovative performances, and engaging and inspiring educational and outreach programs! Just in the last year alone, we have:

  • Been selected as one of two finalists in the Yellow Springs Emerging Chamber Ensembles Competition
  • Performed several full concerts, appeared live on the radio and presented over 15 educational programs at area schools, libraries, and retirement communities
  • Founded our very own Chamber Music Camp, hosted by Notre Dame College, for flute, oboe, clarinet, bassoon and horn students in grades 6-12

We couldn't have gotten where we are without the amazing support of our friends and colleagues. But now we need to raise financial support as well.

We are trying to raise $3500 for need-based and merit scholarships to our camp!

The tuition for each camper is $400 and includes:

  • A week of intensive rehearsals and coachings on woodwind chamber pieces, culminating in a professionally recorded final performance.
  • Daily seminars on topics ranging from audience engagement to music business
  • All printed parts, camp t-shirt, pizza party and family reception and much more. The camper needs only to bring their instrument and we provide the rest!

The Impact

Cleveland, OH is an art-friendly city with a serious poverty problem.

  • Every single applicant to date has inquired about financial assistance.
  • Scholarship not only impacts the student, but the family, whose childcare financial burden will be eased during the camp week
  • Being a classical musician comes with its own set of financial barriers
column2: we don't want our camp to increase that burden on any interested family and your gift will help to make that possible.

column1: • Reaching our goal of $3500 will cover 8 full scholarships or 16 half scholarships!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We're sensitive to the financial stressors happening in so many lives - that is why we're raising these funds!

  • If a donation to the cause isn't possible at this time, PLEASE share this with your family and friends and help us get the word out!

Summary
This CD has been a long time coming! 20 years ago, I launched the first Litchfield Jazz Festival and built an archive of the fabulous performances that have happened there. We now have so many musical memories to share with you!  My festival creative team put their heads together and boy was it tough to select just a CD full of favorites from hundreds of fabulous performances.  But we did it and now we are asking for your support to produce the first Live From The Litchfield Jazz Festival –Celebrating 20 Years.

Who are we?
Litchfield Performing Arts' mission is to educate and inspire young people to be confident, creative, expressive individuals through challenging programs in jazz music and the performing arts and to share the passion and magic of the arts with the wider community.

LPA is celebrating thirty-four seasons of service through the arts this year. The centerpiece of these efforts is Litchfield Jazz Camp which has been changing lives for 19 years by awarding $100,000 in need-based scholarships each year.

The Campaign
Throughout the 20 years of the Jazz Festival, even from the early years, we had the best audio engineers and recording pros building our Jazz Fest archives with live takesd—from Dave Brubeck, to Eartha Kitt to Kenny Rankin and everyone in between. This benchmark anniversary seemed the perfect time to open our vault and get this music out to the public. Whether you’re hearing these performances for the first time or you have fond memories of having heard them live way back when—I think you’ll love this CD.

This campaign is designed to raise funds to cover the production of the CD.  Any profits we might make from the sale of the CD can then go straight to helping fund scholarships for students to attend Litchfield Jazz Camp

Supporting the Arts and future generations of musicians!
What better way to support the arts then by supporting both live and recorded music! While supporting the album you will help ensure future generations of jazz performers. It really is that simple. By hitting our goal, we will be able to direct 100% of all sales of the album to the LJC Scholarship fund.  

Where will the funding go?
The $6000 will help us achieve
Editing, Mixing and Mastering of the music
Graphic design and layout of the CD, Liner Notes
Mass duplication of Album and shipping
Online distribution and media outreach

Perk? Of course we got Perks!
So what does one get by supporting this project? I’m happy you asked. We have various levels each of which has it’s own rewards. You could simply get a digital copy of the album, get either lawn or Tent tickets to the jazz festival, posters, T-shirts and even backstage Festival passes  for this 20th Anniversary Event – August 7-9. Want to be behind the scenes hanging with greats like Matt Wilson or Anat Cohen? Here’s your chance. Visit the perks section for more details.

Songs include
1    “I Can’t Give You Anything But Love”  Eartha Kitt  (2005)
2   “Big Bad Basie”  Dave Brubeck and The Count Basie Orchestra (2001)
3.  “The Way You Look Tonight”  Kenny Rankin    (2002)
4.  “One Note Samba”  Trio de Paz  (2009)
5.  “Continuing”  Mario Pavone (2010)
6.  “Raga”  Matt Wilson (2011)
7.  “Crazy He Calls Me”  Helen Sung (2012)
8.  “Tre Veglia e Sonno​”  Gary Smulyan (2013)
9.  “Tormenta”  Jane Bunnett (2014)
10.“Mad Bop”  Luis Munoz (2005)
11.“Minor Swing”  Litchfield Jazz Orchestra (2014)

What if we don't real the full amount of our goal?
If we don’t reach our goal, all funds we do receive will go to the project in a priority fashion. Obviously, mixing and mastering is first, then duplication and shipping.

It's important to us, and it should be to you!
For the entire two decades of the festival I have sat for hours on end in the weeks following  with Owen Muir, now a physician and a long time audio engineer and my son (he still does free sessions for musicians who need help here ) in my living room-turned-recording studio. Owen mixed and I played critic, year after year.  The music was marvelous and his work was terrific.  And then I began to be plagued by how ungenerous it was to have all this stashed away where no one but a few could hear it. A couple of times I tried to get a CD project off the ground but as anyone knows who has tried to release a recording of music that “belongs” to others this is a big job.  There is research, licenses and more before a record can approach release.

This year I decided this absolutely had to happen, and it had to be now! So with the help of volunteers, especially Doug Munro and Albert Rivera, and Frank Alkyer of DownBeat Magazine, and of course Owen Muir, we are almost there.

With your help to pay for the final steps, my fervent wish to get music of Litchfield Live out to all its fans will become a reality and address the promise of our mission to  “share the passion and magic of the arts with the wider community.”  That’s you!

Sincerely,
dedicated to changing lives through the arts

","SummaryThis CD has been a long time coming! 20 years ago, I launched the first Litchfield Jazz Festival and built an archive of the fabulous performances that have happened there. We now have so many musical memories to share with you!  My festival creative team put their heads together and boy was it tough to select just a CD full of favorites from hundreds of fabulous performances.  But we did it and now we are asking for your support to produce the first Live From The Litchfield Jazz Festival –Celebrating 20 Years. Who are we?Litchfield Performing Arts' mission is to educate and inspire young people to be confident, creative, expressive individuals through challenging programs in jazz music and the performing arts and to share the passion and magic of the arts with the wider community.LPA is celebrating thirty-four seasons of service through the arts this year. The centerpiece of these efforts is Litchfield Jazz Camp which has been changing lives for 19 years by awarding $100,000 in need-based scholarships each year.The Campaign Throughout the 20 years of the Jazz Festival, even from the early years, we had the best audio engineers and recording pros building our Jazz Fest archives with live takesd—from Dave Brubeck, to Eartha Kitt to Kenny Rankin and everyone in between. This benchmark anniversary seemed the perfect time to open our vault and get this music out to the public. Whether you’re hearing these performances for the first time or you have fond memories of having heard them live way back when—I think you’ll love this CD. This campaign is designed to raise funds to cover the production of the CD.  Any profits we might make from the sale of the CD can then go straight to helping fund scholarships for students to attend Litchfield Jazz CampSupporting the Arts and future generations of musicians!What better way to support the arts then by supporting both live and recorded music! While supporting the album you will help ensure future generations of jazz performers. It really is that simple. By hitting our goal, we will be able to direct 100% of all sales of the album to the LJC Scholarship fund.  Where will the funding go?The $6000 will help us achieve Editing, Mixing and Mastering of the musicGraphic design and layout of the CD, Liner NotesMass duplication of Album and shippingOnline distribution and media outreachPerk? Of course we got Perks!So what does one get by supporting this project? I’m happy you asked. We have various levels each of which has it’s own rewards. You could simply get a digital copy of the album, get either lawn or Tent tickets to the jazz festival, posters, T-shirts and even backstage Festival passes  for this 20th Anniversary Event – August 7-9. Want to be behind the scenes hanging with greats like Matt Wilson or Anat Cohen? Here’s your chance. Visit the perks section for more details.Songs include1    “I Can’t Give You Anything But Love”  Eartha Kitt  (2005) 2   “Big Bad Basie”  Dave Brubeck and The Count Basie Orchestra (2001)3.  “The Way You Look Tonight”  Kenny Rankin    (2002)4.  “One Note Samba”  Trio de Paz  (2009)5.  “Continuing”  Mario Pavone (2010)6.  “Raga”  Matt Wilson (2011)7.  “Crazy He Calls Me”  Helen Sung (2012)8.  “Tre Veglia e Sonno​”  Gary Smulyan (2013)9.  “Tormenta”  Jane Bunnett (2014)10.“Mad Bop”  Luis Munoz (2005)11.“Minor Swing”  Litchfield Jazz Orchestra (2014)What if we don't real the full amount of our goal?If we don’t reach our goal, all funds we do receive will go to the project in a priority fashion. Obviously, mixing and mastering is first, then duplication and shipping. It's important to us, and it should be to you!For the entire two decades of the festival I have sat for hours on end in the weeks following  with Owen Muir, now a physician and a long time audio engineer and my son (he still does free sessions for musicians who need help here ) in my living room-turned-recording studio. Owen mixed and I played critic, year after year.  The music was marvelous and his work was terrific.  And then I began to be plagued by how ungenerous it was to have all this stashed away where no one but a few could hear it. A couple of times I tried to get a CD project off the ground but as anyone knows who has tried to release a recording of music that “belongs” to others this is a big job.  There is research, licenses and more before a record can approach release. This year I decided this absolutely had to happen, and it had to be now! So with the help of volunteers, especially Doug Munro and Albert Rivera, and Frank Alkyer of DownBeat Magazine, and of course Owen Muir, we are almost there.With your help to pay for the final steps, my fervent wish to get music of Litchfield Live out to all its fans will become a reality and address the promise of our mission to  “share the passion and magic of the arts with the wider community.”  That’s you!Sincerely,
dedicated to changing lives through the arts",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"
New Music-Theater

“The Vagabonds” is a new piece inspired by William Blake's prophetic writings and visionary illuminations.  It tells a story of two traveling street performers, a man (Kick) and a mute boy (Pano) who present a dancing side-show on a portable stage. The show features an ensemble of some of New York’s most exciting musicians, actors and dancers. We're raising funds to pay our performers.

The Music

The music has influences from Bartok, Stravinsky and Kurt Weill to Balkan folk music, and includes winds, strings and the Hungarian cimbalom.  Composer Andy Teirstein is known for his scores for choreographers including Donald Byrd, Stephen Petronio, Liz Lerman, Carolyn Dorfman, and many others. His music-theater works  (Winter Man, A Blessing on the Moon) have won awards from the American Academy of Arts and Letters, The National Endowment for the Arts, and the New York Foundation for the Arts. Choreography and visual direction is written into the score.

When?

Scenes from the piece will premiere at:

Theater at 14th Street, 344 E14th St.,  New York City
June 4th, at 7:30

The evening is a LABAlive program of LABA: A Laboratory of Jewish Culture, where Andy Teirstein is a current artist-fellow.  Each year LABA looks at a theme - this year it is TIME. June 4th features the work of three artist-fellows also including work by poet Ben Gantcher and performer/activist Shawn Shafner.

Who?

We have a stellar cast for the evening:
• Singers/Actors  - John McGrew (Apollo Run), Amelia Watkins (NYC Opera, BAM, Tanglewod), Erika Hennings (Encompass Opera), Timothy Thomas, (Into the Woods), and Joshua Peck.
Peck Allmond (Winds, Trumpet), Rob Middleton (Winds), Ina Paris (Violin), Emirhan Tunca (Cello), Diana Herold (Marimba) and AJ Merlino (Cimbalom).

The creative team also includes Shayna Strype (Assistant Director, Stage Manager) and Andrew Kaminski (Video Art). 


The Adventure

Blake wrote that we ""see all things through the narrow chinks of our cavern,"" meaning the five senses.  He wrote about the imagination as the ""world of eternity...into which we shall all go after the death of the vegetated body.""

We are creating, in ""The Vagabonds,"" a performance in which the distinctions between music, dance, and words dissolve. The piece embraces dance, theater, singing, instrumental depth, and video art.

Help us bring this vision to life.

WHO AM I?

My name is Dianna St. Hilaire.  I am a singer songwriter in Los Angeles who has been singing since I was 2 and writing on the piano since I was 6.  Music is the love of my life.   I have had a lot of success with my previous projects and this is now my 9th studio album.  

When I was 5, on my way to becoming the musician I am today.  

 

For those of you that know me, you know I take my music and my life very seriously.  It has been a constant struggle making it as an artist in LA.  I wouldn't change it for anything because, music will forever be a healing force in my life.  I have moved mountains and transformed my life over the last few years.  A few years ago I found myself in a dark depression that I thought I was going to be unable to escape from, but as with many times in the past, music has gotten me through.  Now I want to share that same healing power with everyone else.  Oparu is a new beginning full of hope.  

Over the last few years I've had my music on the Billboard Music charts, I was on the Grammy Ballot in 2012 &
column2:
2013,  I've toured the US, been in the music movie Black Room Doom where I worked with the incredible Kim Fowley.  He also worked with me on a new album in 2013, and now I have just started working with Grammy Award winning producer, Josh Stevens.   I would like this year to be the year that breaks the odds and really gets things moving, allowing me to share my music with the world.  


WHAT IS OPARU?

The definition of the word is Opal.  I chose it because it is my birthstone.  Oparu is a new, beautiful futuristic endeavor.  Oparu represents the rawness of human emotion.  I am a firm believer in love and compassion for others.  My purpose with Oparu is to share my life experiences with the world.  My musical purpose is to help others to overcome the greatest challenges in their lives and remind them that they are not alone.  It's a reminder that someone else has been, and is there, with you right now.  I want my music to help you to heal and to enjoy life's moments.  No journey is complete without struggle and hardship.  We all go through it and we all deal with it in different ways.  Through out history music has been the easiest communicator in hard times and in good times.  It gives us the ability to dream of the future where ever we find ourselves.  Please help me spread this beautiful music through out the masses and promote the healing and helping of all of us.  Below is a sneak peak of things to come,



What I will be able to do with this funding

I will be able to get my music produced by Josh Stevens a Grammy Award Winning producer (LMFAO, Jennifer Lopez, M&
column3:
M, John Mayer)

work at Studio City Sound

produce a new lyric music video for the first single.

create Vinyl Records and CD's 

I will also have a team to help me with

column1: I'm really excited to get the opportunity to start and create this new project.  I have put together an awesome list of perks for your donations including one of a kind Vinyl Test Pressings, CD's, Chord Charts and even a chance for you to fly out to Los Angeles and be on set during the video production.   Thank you so much for reading this and being part of my team.

Please take a minute and follow me on Twitter and Facebook.  Don't forget to pass this on to friends as you never know who may be able to help.

column5:
>HELLO! If you are reading this then you are considering donating to my Indiegogo Campaign! First of all, thank you so much for taking the time to visit my page. Let me start off with a backstory. Ever since I was little I wanted to be a singer. I received my first guitar around the age of 12 due to nagging for one. My Mother says she honestly didn’t think I’d pick it up, let alone learn how to play the thing! My Mother has been one of my biggest influences musically. I remember her singing all the time and it made me want to do the same as her. I was very interested in poetry and wrote poems before ever deciding to write a song. The first song I ever wrote was for a girl I had a HUGE, not so discreet, crush on. I never thought I could sing, but dog gone it, I was going to stand in the middle of that shabby gym basketball court on 8th grade day and sing these heartbroken tunes! I was SO nervous I just stared at the bottom row bleachers. I remember when I was finished there were girls CRYING!! The gym exploded into clapping and cheering and for the first time in my 13 years on this planet I knew, I had a purpose. Even so, my girl situation never changed with said person. BUT thankfully God had a purpose for her cold disposition and jerkish ways. She later became my best friend and the sweetest person ever. If not for this experience I would have most likely never written “songs”! Now that that is over let’s move on to the business!

 I would like to let you know where your money will be going! The 2,500 dollars that I am asking to be funded will go to the physical distribution, whether it be Indiecards (for online downloading) or CDs. My goal is to have a physical representation of the music I write to take to Labels or to distribute to you guys, THE FAAANS! I write, play and sing not only as an emotional outlet, but the music I write is meant to inspire and motivate people. Whether it kicks someone’s ego in the butt and helps them start THEIR career, or it speaks to the lonely child contemplating suicide, I have a calling and IT IS MUSIC!! I’m not where I need to be BUT I’m heading there and I won’t stop until I help other people overcome their fears and heartache with the melodies and lyrics I write. This 2,500 I am asking for is the literal start to my career. If I play a gig in Nashville, Dalton Georgia or Charlotte North Carolina, if I don’t have music to put in the hands of potential fans I will most likely be put out of mind and I will likely never see that person again. I could write a song that will one day change their world, but without your help I will be forgotten. Once my EP has been recorded and produced I will then Ship the listed packages based on the pledged amounts. Just to reiterate about my upcoming EP, it will consist of 5 original songs that I have hand selected based on the feedback of my existing fan support (the majority favorites). I can tell you if you do help fund my very first EP you will be proud that one day when I’m well known you helped the struggling artist of today one day become the positive influence of the future. Ya’ll are awesome! Thank you SO much and like always, Stay Beautiful!  

- Aubrey RodrigueZ
