Short Summary

Help us make this dream come true for someone else!

This surprise Indiegogo campaign is put on for David Porcheddu by his friends and family. We know how much David's music has blessed us, but now it's time to bless the rest of the world! Please partner with us as we surprise David with all the funds needed to make his first debut, full length worship record, which is scheduled to release at the end of 2015 (if funds are raised in time).
David has released a 3-song EP in the past, as well as a couple of singles. We are all ready for a full length album!
David is known at many churches in the Dallas area for his incredible worship music, as he has served as a worship director or has ministered at:

column2:
>He has also lead worship for various youth camps, home groups, house churches, and more.

If you are part of one of those churches or a friend of David's please help us spread the word and please consider giving a few bucks to make this dream a reality for him!

What We Need &
column3:
What You Get

We need to raise enough funds to pay for:

column1: Check out our perks to see what you get:
• Your choice of either a private worship night event with David Porcheddu
<li>OR a private 1960's band event with David &amp
If We Do Not Reach Our Goal

column3: >If we don't reach our desired goal, the funds raised will go toward the recording process only. We will, then, need to try another round of fundraising to pay for final mixing, mastering, and packaging of CD materials.

column1: David's worship has a way of taking people straight to the heart of the Father. Whether it's through tears or dancing, his music frees people to express themselves to Jesus in a single moment that is real, raw and heartfelt. His music has, no doubt, impacted hundreds of lives on a local level. Help us take that impact to hearts all over the world by funding this project!
Risk: Like Jeremy Shuck always says, ""You can't out-risk His faithfulness.""

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share this link! Email friends, help us get the word out! Sacrifice your Starbucks runs for the week and make a donation, even if it's just few dollahhhs! Holla!

OR a private 1960's band event with David & The Dimes (based on donation level)
If We Do Not Reach Our Goal

If we don't reach our desired goal, the funds raised will go toward the recording process only. We will, then, need to try another round of fundraising to pay for final mixing, mastering, and packaging of CD materials.

David's worship has a way of taking people straight to the heart of the Father. Whether it's through tears or dancing, his music frees people to express themselves to Jesus in a single moment that is real, raw and heartfelt. His music has, no doubt, impacted hundreds of lives on a local level. Help us take that impact to hearts all over the world by funding this project!
Risk: Like Jeremy Shuck always says, ""You can't out-risk His faithfulness.""

Other Ways You Can Help Share, share, share this link! Email friends, help us get the word out! Sacrifice your Starbucks runs for the week and make a donation, even if it's just few dollahhhs! Holla!",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hi everyone, my name is Julia Aljaz. I'm a singer/songwriter. I was born in Ljubljana, Slovenia but ended up in the states where I graduated from high school and got accepted to Berklee college of music on a scholarship. I took a year ""off"" before starting at Berklee because I wanted to raise enough money to cover the whole cost of tuition even with a scholarship that I'm extremely grateful I've received. I'm living in London at the moment and I just finished writing and carefully choosing my first EP that we're going to top up with 4 music videos that connect to one another and then release a short film at the end.

I'm very time limited. I got a lot of offers from labels and people interested but everyone wants to hear my EP first, I got the studio (EC1), got the right people and have my video team ready. We just need a little bit support from you guys.

column2: >What do we need and how can you help?

column1: I'm raising £7,750 for an EP and 4 music videos.

That means the rest of £5000 would go for 4 music videos that would connect to one another. By that I mean connecting all of the 4 videos with a story or concept that would make it interesting for viewers to watch.
To me, this is not about the money it's just sadly the way it is, the people that are working on my projects all work for free, the costs will go towards the equipment and place.

From the £5000 for the video shoot we'll also do some live recordings of gospel with me as a lead singer and will try to combine soul with pop which is a major part of my music - we also take requests on songs!
There is a few different ways of you getting involved:
1. BE INSPIRATIONAL AND SEE YOURSELF IN A VIDEO

If you invest anything, even £5 and feel artistic, you can send me a picture of you with an inspirational quote that you believe in with all your heart. For example mine is ""You can't be what you can""t see."" Take a picture of it or a short video of you and we'll put you in a video with one of my songs that will be dedicated to you guys.

If you are more of a drawer or you think you have an idea that could impact your projects send those over and I'll make sure I review all of them and give you some feedback, I'll share everything on my social media sites like Instagram, Facebook, Youtube..

You are more then welcome to join us on any of the projects, you can sing in the choir for the video's we're doing, you can be an assistant, or even an actor in some of my videos. It's all about working together. Just hit me up on my official page and I'll let you know about the dates.

column2:
>How will this EP+4 music videos change the industry

This EP will have a huge impact on an industry as a whole, it will connect soul and pop music and bring gospel back in the game. I want to take the soulful sound and bring it closer to pop and make it listenable for the masses.

column1: I will represent my project to Berklee college of music and possibly get more people involved, I got interest from Sony as well as BMG Chrysalis so we can make this thing massive.

column2:
>What are the risks? 

The biggest risk for us is time, we really need to raise this money now so we can start working in the studio. The project will be finished at the end of August so we are under a lot of time pressure.

column1: If you can't contribute money to the project NO WORRIES, you can always help us with sharing an inspirational quote or just contact me and share some ideas. If you live in London just hit me up and I'll bring you in on all of my projects. We always welcome new people, is really all about community. Let's give music some life.

Who am I and what is this music project? A bio and important information.
First of all! I've decided to make this project about music, illness awareness, and community. Please watch the video. I need your help to tour and prove that you can do anything!

My name is Parker Hatcher. I am a 25 Year old Transgender (Male), disabled (Lupus) musician who grew up in Winnipeg, MB. I have one studio album under my belt, but this time I decided to give my all to this new project. I'm doing this all myself. Every track, drums, guitar, bass, keys, vocals. I'm tracking all of it myself.
Despite living with lupus, I fully intend to tour this record. I want everyone to hear it. I believe this will be one of the greatest things I've ever done. I have something to prove. Being transgender, and being sick. I AM going to prove it. I need all the help I can get. 
I became very sick after the release of my last record. I never had a chance to tour it. I laid down and decided to die. But after a trip to Toronto to play a show for a friends documentary, I got back up. And said I have to do this. I have so much to give, I will NOT give up.
Life is short and It's even shorter if you give up, lay in bed, and do nothing. I've choses NOT to do that. I will FIGHT for the music. I will FIGHT my illness.
And most importantly I will show others that they can achieve their dreams

I want every corner of the earth to hear this record. I want this album to be my legacy. I want this to be larger than life. And I want the listeners to interpret these tracks in such a way that they can relate to it on every level possible. I am looking for investors, supporters, and independent music enthusiasts. Face it. I am the little guy. And the little guy gets swept under the rug. But my passion is big, my sound is bigger, and my ambition is unstoppable.

This is a 16 track music project I call ""Ward 3"". This is a journey into the human mind, madness, pain, anger, sadness, fear, love, and insanity. There are many extremes inside ones self. This is a concept album, and every single track will be an exploration into one or more of these extremes. I need help. I am barely getting by, and this album is going to make or break me.
Either way, when this record is finished recording, I will need to send it to get mastered, and print it. My goal is to print cds, and vinyl (EXPENSIVE) as well as shirts, posters, and all the merch the listeners will have. As well as limited edition vinyl versions of my first record. Please remember what goes around comes around. Karma is real. The little guy can have the biggest sound. And music heals.


What I need
I want this album to get out there as much as it can.

I emptied my accounts and put myself in debt to make this happen. 
Being a transgender musician, with a disability has had its difficulties, but there's no way I'm letting that stop me.
I'm looking for 25,000 dollars to fully fund my project. 

MY BREAKDOWN: 10,000 to pay off my equipment, 7,000 to print the cd and have it mastered professionally, and 8,000 to use for a Ward 3 tour this summer, that will help with mobility issues like installing a wheelchair ramp into a vehicle, and the rest will go to the LUPUS foundation as well as other LGBTQ organizations throughout Canada that need a little help. I want to give back to my community,

After I receive my funding I will have to:
PRINT the album on CD and Vinyl, as well as get international distribution.
I want to tour this album summer 2015. 
Pay for wheelchair/mobility extras I will need on the road.
I'll have to pay for professional mastering. 
I'm doing all of the recording myself but I am no mastering master. 
I want the best quality I can give you guys.

*I want to be an example for people who have given up on their dreams because of illness. I want to show people that you can do ANYTHING, as long as you want it bad enough, and have the passion!*

I'm going to be offering some AMAZING perks for donating.
I'll also be selling copies of my first record ""Fighting kids for swings"".

*You have the option to become an investor, which means you will get the money you've given back, with a signed contract. If you chose to fund this project completely you will have access to all of the copyrights. You can do that by choosing the helper perks, please contact me directly*

*I have to reach my goal! All of my donations that surpass my goal will go directly to the lupus foundation and other LGBTQ* organizations that I can help!*
The Impact, what this record means to me, and how I feel about being a musician.

This is not only a music project, I want it to be an inspirational story about one person, with obstacles, who went ahead and proved that anything is possible.

I have been in the studio, have written and recorded many tracks in the past. 
I've been playing music for 20 years.
I've been on stage many times. And that feeling, of the warm spotlight.. the crowd, I will cherish that always. And I will never give that up.
It's my life. It runs in my blood. It is me. 
This project means everything to me. And since the birth of it late 2014, I have been constantly fighting financial difficulties to get this to happen. 
BUT! I've had interviews, and am releasing my first single immediately. 
I have support, and love from friends and family. 
I now need YOU, to make my dream come true. I will always support the people in my life who need it, I will always put positivity and good Karma out into the world. And I will be playing music, writing, producing, until my last breath.

What will happen?

-
No matter what happens, this record will become a reality. 
I am set on raising this money and making this happen. 
I will not stop until it is finished. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this campaign as much as you want. Show your friends, family, everyone you know. 
We website is www.parkerhatcher.com
There you can subscribe to my mailing list for free mp3s and updates.
You can also donate by clicking the donate button on the front page.

I am Parker Hatcher. A transgender male, with lupus. I am strong. I am brave. I am passionate. 
I am music. 


-Parker 

Please stay tuned for more videos, updates, and music as this project progresses.

0,"

He Is Worship Album

Hello! My name is Joe Sneider and for the past year I have been creating a full length worship album. I recently got married to the love of my life (Kayla) and also graduated with my Bachelors in Professional Music from Berklee College of Music. I am currently the music director for a church just south of Boston and I love to worship.

Last year I was blessed with an opportunity to go on a national tour with christian artist Jonas Woods. While playing in several churches and venues each week, I felt inspiration to write an album focusing on Jesus, how awesome He is and how much He has done for us. With your help, we can provide new songs for congregations to praise King Jesus and express feelings towards God in a new way.

What Is Needed &
column2:
What You Get

This campaign is to fund everything I need to record and duplicate this album. In the past 6 months I have invested over $6000 in professional recording equipment to be able to record this album and future albums to the industry standard level. I have spent hundreds and hundreds of hours researching the most cost effective tools for recording and even more time writing and rewriting the songs.

column1: The first $2000 raised in this campaign will go directly to CD duplication and merchandise.
The next $2000 will be spent on christian session musicians used to record the album.
The last $8000 will go towards a preamp used to record drums, microphones and paying off some of the gear I have already purchased to get a head start.
After the completion of this album and campaign, I will be able to use this equipment to work with other worship leaders and pastors releasing new music for their congregations.
As a thank you for contributing to the album I am offering fun perks including receiving the album before the release date, a round of frisbee golf and recording an acoustic single in my studio.

Recording this worship album will have and already has had a great impact on my church and other churches that I have been able to shared it with. I have been part of over a dozen other albums for various artists but this will be the first album I have done that is all music I have written for people who love Jesus to sing to Him. I can't tell you how exciting it is to lead congregations in singing these songs. With your help I can share this music and these gifts with other congregations and help make the name of Jesus known and glorified.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways than just contributing financially to help out with this campaign and album.
If you are able, please share this campaign on your facebook, instagram, twitter ect. and tell the people you know.
You can also pray for my wife kayla and I. Pray that we put God before everything, that I maintain a healthy balance with my family and that we continue to trust God every step of every day.
Thanks for taking time out of your day to take a look at my campaign and God bless you.

column2: B singing group ""Somethin 4 The Fellas"" (S4TF) has achieved something that has been elusive to musicians for decades.  Make (very good) money as an independent (Indie) artist!

column1: They have done it without being insanely popular, without giving up ANY rights to their music and sync licensing, without a major publishing or distribution deal and without needing to sell a single unit of their music!  Sounds insane, right?  However, its 100% TRUE!

Now we want to make it possible to share the same opportunity to independent artists all over the world!  ...and it all begins with them owning their very own mobile app for musicians (including DJ's, Producers, Singers, etc).

The mobile app also comes with ""the formula"" for making money as an Indie, in the form of direct guidance from the individual responsible for the massive financial success of S4TF...Mr. Jay Davis (no, not the comedian).
""Somethin 4 The Fellas"" (S4TF) is a brand created by Jay Davis and four (4) very talented and motivated ladies:
• Shakara Weston - Singer/Songwriter, Visual Artist, Producer, Entrepreneur, Actress and Model

column2: >Janelle Thompson - Singer/Songwriter, Musician, Producer, Entrepreneur and Model

column1: • Kirbie Speights - Singer/Songwriter, Dancer/Choreographer, Entrepreneur, Actress and Model

column2: >Maria Flores - Entrepreneur, Procurement Specialist, Promoter and Model

column1: • Vernique Sibert - Singer/Songwriter, Musician, Actress and Model
• Sy'Mone O'quin - Singer, Actress, Dancer/Choreographer and Model
What they have done is groundbreaking!  ""Make Money As Indie Artists""!!!  (...and LOTS of it!)

""The fame may or may not come, but I love that I can do what I love for a living and not have to  be a starving artist in the process""

- Shakara Weston

""I LOVE to sing.  I want to create music until the day that I die.  I'm fortunate that I can do that and not have to worry about ""selling out"" or compromising my musical integrity just to chase a dollar.  I think at the end of the day, that is what all true artists aspire to be able to do.""

- Vernique Sibert
""I wasn't even really interested in singing professionally.  My first love is dancing
column2:
and I want to help underprivileged children, as well as continue to model.  But the singing career has been such a benefit to me financially that it facilitates all of my aspirations.  It's crazy because I see all of these other artists struggling because they don't really understand the BUSINESS of music.  My work on this project was to be of assistance to them.  Helping other artists do what we have done is what makes my soul warm and fuzzy inside.""

- Kirbie Speights

column1: Serial entrepreneur, Jay Davis, is a strategic consultant, the owner 13 different enterprises, including independent record label ""9th Ward Promotions and Production Company, LLC"".  He is the founder of ""S4TF"" and one of the mobile app developers in the #1 mobile app company for Small/Medium-sized Businesses (SMBs) in the world
column2: (www.smbmarketing.com) with over 100,000 mobile apps built worldwide!

column1: He has combined his experience and expertise in these and other areas to perpetuate the combined revenue of the members of S4TF from $0 to over $400k per year!  His vision is to make this opportunity a reality for any independent artists who are able to do one simple thing...BUILD and ENGAGE a fan base!

<blockquote>""It doesn't matter if you can sell your music!  It doesn't even matter if its any good by mainstream standards.  All that matters is that you have fans who like/love you (for whatever reason), and that you engage them (often) in the proper manner.  If you can do that, then you can make (very good) money doing exactly what you love to do.  Even MORE money than what you will make with a major record deal.  As an artist myself, I am insanely motivated to show independent artists EXACTLY how to do that
column2:
then empower them to go out and do it!""  

-  Jay Davis

What You Get

We don't want to just make mobile apps for musicians and teach them how to make money.  We want to make it affordable for ANY artists to be able to take advantage of the paradigm shift that will make Indies just as profitable as A-list artists!  It's not JUST about the mobile app.  It is about the business platform that comes along with it!  If you can build a fan-base then you WILL make money! (without having to ever sell your music).

column1: We've gotten off to a great start by being able to offer Android app development, publishing and data hosting for as low as $40 (one-time fee).  This means that you (EVEN IF YOU HAVE AN iPHONE) can engage and monetize all of your fans who have Android phones and tablets!  ...And we'll even help you do it!

Once you have your app, we can also facilitate upgrading to iOS for a publishing fee of $50 plus $39/month for maintenance and data hosting.  Eventually, what we would LIKE to be able to do is ALSO provide iOS publishing, maintenance and data hosting for a (very low) one-time fee as well!  No company has ever been able to pull this off, but we are committed to work toward doing just that.
In order to reach our goals we need:
<li>$$$ to pay for planners, developers and designers to create a new development and monetization process that allows us to build, host, publish and maintain apps on iOS, Android, Windows &amp
column2: HTML5 for ONE low development fee and $0 in monthly maintenance and hosting.  There has been a $300k investment to build the business model (from scratch) to where it currently stands.  It has yielded S4TF a collective net worth of $3.6 million over the past 3 years.

column1: • $$$ to build a website that features all of the artists mobile apps and is actively promoted to venues, record labels, publishers, distributors, radio stations, TV and movie executives, advertisers, etc. to assist artists in getting exposure, gigs and sponsorships/endorsements for independent artists using the S4TF business model.

• $$$ to create professional graphic templates for artists so they can just choose a design, customize to fit their image and upload to the platform.  All templates will be made available as completely unlocked PSD files with unrestricted customization rights at NO charge.  It is our intention that at least 30 brand new, unique templates will be made available each month.
","Campaign Summary R&B singing group ""Somethin 4 The Fellas"" (S4TF) has achieved something that has been elusive to musicians for decades.  Make (very good) money as an independent (Indie) artist!

They have done it without being insanely popular, without giving up ANY rights to their music and sync licensing, without a major publishing or distribution deal and without needing to sell a single unit of their music!  Sounds insane, right?  However, its 100% TRUE!

Now we want to make it possible to share the same opportunity to independent artists all over the world!  ...and it all begins with them owning their very own mobile app for musicians (including DJ's, Producers, Singers, etc).

The mobile app also comes with ""the formula"" for making money as an Indie, in the form of direct guidance from the individual responsible for the massive financial success of S4TF...Mr. Jay Davis (no, not the comedian).
Somethin 4 The Fellas"" (S4TF) is a brand created by Jay Davis and four (4) very talented and motivated ladies:
Shakara Weston - Singer/Songwriter, Visual Artist, Producer, Entrepreneur, Actress and Model
Janelle Thompson - Singer/Songwriter, Musician, Producer, Entrepreneur and Model
Kirbie Speights - Singer/Songwriter, Dancer/Choreographer, Entrepreneur, Actress and Model
Maria Flores - Entrepreneur, Procurement Specialist, Promoter and Model
Additional members of the brand include:
Vernique Sibert - Singer/Songwriter, Musician, Actress and Model
Sy'Mone O'quin - Singer, Actress, Dancer/Choreographer and Model
What they have done is groundbreaking!  ""Make Money As Indie Artists""!!!  (...and LOTS of it!)
The fame may or may not come, but I love that I can do what I love for a living and not have to  be a starving artist in the process"" - Shakara Weston

I LOVE to sing.  I want to create music until the day that I die.  I'm fortunate that I can do that and not have to worry about ""selling out"" or compromising my musical integrity just to chase a dollar.  I think at the end of the day, that is what all true artists aspire to be able to do."" - Vernique Sibert
I wasn't even really interested in singing professionally.  My first love is dancing
column2: and I want to help underprivileged children, as well as continue to model.  But the singing career has been such a benefit to me financially that it facilitates all of my aspirations.  It's crazy because I see all of these other artists struggling because they don't really understand the BUSINESS of music.  My work on this project was to be of assistance to them.  Helping other artists do what we have done is what makes my soul warm and fuzzy inside."" - Kirbie Speights

column1: Serial entrepreneur, Jay Davis, is a strategic consultant, the owner 13 different enterprises, including independent record label ""9th Ward Promotions and Production Company, LLC"".  He is the founder of ""S4TF"" and one of the mobile app developers in the #1 mobile app company for Small/Medium-sized Businesses (SMBs) in the world
column2: (www.smbmarketing.com) with over 100,000 mobile apps built worldwide!

column1: He has combined his experience and expertise in these and other areas to perpetuate the combined revenue of the members of S4TF from $0 to over $400k per year!  His vision is to make this opportunity a reality for any independent artists who are able to do one simple thing...BUILD and ENGAGE a fan base!

It doesn't matter if you can sell your music!  It doesn't even matter if its any good by mainstream standards.  All that matters is that you have fans who like/love you (for whatever reason), and that you engage them (often) in the proper manner.  If you can do that, then you can make (very good) money doing exactly what you love to do.  Even MORE money than what you will make with a major record deal.  As an artist myself, I am insanely motivated to show independent artists EXACTLY how to do that
column2: then empower them to go out and do it!""  -  Jay Davis

column1: What We Need & What You Get We don't want to just make mobile apps for musicians and teach them how to make money.  We want to make it affordable for ANY artists to be able to take advantage of the paradigm shift that will make Indies just as profitable as A-list artists!  It's not JUST about the mobile app.  It is about the business platform that comes along with it!  If you can build a fan-base then you WILL make money! (without having to ever sell your music).

We've gotten off to a great start by being able to offer Android app development, publishing and data hosting for as low as $40 (one-time fee).  This means that you (EVEN IF YOU HAVE AN iPHONE) can engage and monetize all of your fans who have Android phones and tablets!  ...And we'll even help you do it!

Once you have your app, we can also facilitate upgrading to iOS for a publishing fee of $50 plus $39/month for maintenance and data hosting.  Eventually, what we would LIKE to be able to do is ALSO provide iOS publishing, maintenance and data hosting for a (very low) one-time fee as well!  No company has ever been able to pull this off, but we are committed to work toward doing just that.
In order to reach our goals we need:

$$$ to pay for planners, developers and designers to create a new development and monetization process that allows us to build, host, publish and maintain apps on iOS, Android, Windows & HTML5 for ONE low development fee and $0 in monthly maintenance and hosting.  There has been a $300k investment to build the business model (from scratch) to where it currently stands.  It has yielded S4TF a collective net worth of $3.6 million over the past 3 years.

$$$ to build a website that features all of the artists mobile apps and is actively promoted to venues, record labels, publishers, distributors, radio stations, TV and movie executives, advertisers, etc. to assist artists in getting exposure, gigs and sponsorships/endorsements for independent artists using the S4TF business model.

$$$ to create professional graphic templates for artists so they can just choose a design, customize to fit their image and upload to the platform.  All templates will be made available as completely unlocked PSD files with unrestricted customization rights at NO charge.  It is our intention that at least 30 brand new, unique templates will be made available each month.",3.0,3,"2 Campaigns

Short Summary

  • My name is Jeff, and I'm a singer that produces Epic Songs on Youtube, I record all instruments and voices alone, and I focus on themes like RPG games and Epic Series.

This project is a dream that I've had all my life, to produce my album with a new story that will be my masterpiece.
  • If you believe in my dream then you will live this dream with me, and together we will make things happen!

• I created this project with a minimal sum of $25,000.00  that will be what is needed to record, and make the first copies, but I need more than this.  I need $50,000.00 to make the CD, release, produce official Music Videos, and to promote it on youtube and social sites.
If you listen to this song below, you will see the quality and what I can do alone, now imagine if I could pay for a professional studio... Unchain The Wolf - Original song
• If I don't reach the entire goal , I'll use the money to record this album, and I'll release only digital versions to raise more money and then release the CDs

column2:
Challenges
  • I know that I can't do it alone and that's why I'm here asking you to be part of this, and I promise that I'll make it count!

column1:
•  There's no risk , because even if i don't reach all the money I'll make this album... Of course I would like to raise all the money and release it in a great concert, but if the only thing i can do is record and press  the copies to send to you, I'm already happy! 

    • Other Ways You Can Help

• If you can't help with money, okay, I'll be happy to know that you shared this dream to your friends and social networks!

    • And that's all there is to it.

We are a non-profit women's music festival
dedicated to the advancement of women and girls of all ages in Business, Education, Music
Inspired by Lilith Fair and the National Women's Music Festival, the Northern California Women’s Music Festival was established in May
of 2014 in Modesto, California by like-minded women with similar goals and an
interest in increasing women in leadership positions within the Fine Arts and Business.
Our goal is to have a lasting impact for women and girls of all
ages by actively supporting the pursuit of leadership in business and the arts
including music, film, poetry, visual arts, dance, and more. Our festival sets the foundation for the building of a
community of women who support, nurture and care about the health, and wealth of
one another. This festival will be an annually occurring event.
Our campaign is designed to raise enough
to pay for the venue, performers, and to help women in the community. This includes the funding of three of our grant
opportunities available to women and girls of all ages in California. Our
funding is an integral part of bringing together high quality musicians,
artists, poets, comedians, and performers for this event. In addition to
being a major fundraiser, this event serves to raise awareness of women's challenges and achievements.
By bringing all of these women together we
1) An opportunity for networking with like-minded
women, both in Business and the Fine Arts.
2) A stage for women to share their gifts
and talents with a broader audience, both during the festival itself and in NCWMF events throughout the year.
representation of women in live sound, sound engineering and music.
4) An increased awareness of women's issues to inspire activism.
Through the festival, we are able to create workshops, donate
to organizations whose goal is to assist women, and provide grant opportunities
to women of all ages that can be offered throughout the year.
These workshops promote the health, well-being and advancement of all women of all ages throughout California.
creating a music festival are wide and varied. We have budgeted for and are in
need of $5,000 to sponsor the artists, performers, the venue fees, and
overhead of providing a high quality Women's Music Festival that will span one

In addition to our festival, we host concerts, workshops and gatherings throughout the year, which showcase women musicians, visual artists and allow women owned businesses a venue to be introduced to a larger audience. 

Any donations will go to fund the
festival, the grant opportunities for women of all ages, live sound workshops, and Haven Women's
Center, which provides services to women who have suffered from domestic
We offer many perks for donating to our

campaign. With a $25 donation, you get two tickets to any fundraising concert and prominent acknowledgement on our website. For a $50 donation you receive two tickets to any fundrasing concert and a limited edition t-shirt. The larger the donation, the more opportunities you will have to be a part of our festival. Bigger donors will have
mention in our program, their logo on our posters, live mention during the concert, Gold Tickets to this year's festival, entrance to workshops and more.
If we do not reach our goal, we will use any funding to
put on the festival, so your donation counts. The show will go on.
is a grassroots music festival run solely by volunteers who are dedicated to
helping to advance and build a safe community for all women and gender
non-conforming performers, artists, poets, comedians, and business
Our first festival was held on October
18th, 2014 at the Prospect Theater in Modesto, California. Our committee
continues to grow, and the support from the community for more women
representation in Business and Fine Arts has been overwhelming.
Our goal is to make an impact on the
community by providing a safe place for women to express themselves through all
The Prospect Theater was the perfect place to begin our
journey due to its intimate and beautiful theater seating 200 people.  At
the height of the evening, over 180 people in the community came out to support

us. 

This Year's Festival

This year we take our festival to the Fat Cat Music House &
column2: Lounge located on 11th Street in downtown Modesto, California which seats 600.

column1: We will also be closing down 11th Street in front of the Fat Cat, The Barkin' Dog Grill and Tresetti's World Cafe, where our festival will flow into the streets of downtown Modesto.  Headlining this year's festival is Legendary Rocker Lita Ford, Grammy Nominated  Tracy Bohnam, Legendary Folk/Blues/Jazz singer Barbara Dane, Comedienne Cameron Esposito, Glory Magaña, The DollyRots, Go Betty Go, Megan Slankard and 40 other performers on two outdoor stages and one staged inside The Barkin' Dog Grill. Please help

us make an impact on the community through our non-profit women's music festival.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can definitely help us to get the word out about our festival by sharing our campaign on your site, or telling your friends about our festival. We are grateful for your support and excited to see you at the festival. Visit us at www.northerncaliforniawomensmusicfestival.com for more information.

WHO WE ARE?

We are LP DUO -  piano duo

consisting of pianists Sonja Loncar and Andrija Pavlovic. For more than a decade we are experimented with the endless possibilities of performing on two pianos and analogue synths, while developing a new approach to contemporary classical music that combines classical elegance, jazz freedom, and rock ‘n’ roll power. We have performed more than 250 concerts in Europe and the United States, have won prizes at international competitions,  recorded and published several acclaimed CD’s and were listed as one of the top ten piano duos at Miami’s Dranoff International Two Piano Competition in 2008. 

In 2014. we had a debut concert in Carnegie Hall, New York.

Despite our name (which is taken from our surnames) we never made a real vinyl LP!

Kim Helweg is one of today most original composers who's music is a great mixture of jazz fusion (jazz rock),  blues, popular, contemporary and classical music.
WHY our vinyl recording project?
column5: >We are working on an exciting new project: a vinyl

column1: album with original compositions performed on analogue synthesizers - very rare and special instruments that are made during the years of 70s and 80s of the XX century.

column3: >Even before we established LP Duo, we were collecting these instruments but we usually
column4: > used it in different pop bands and projects but never performed music by other living composers! ON the other side, composer Kim Helweg was playing keyboards in jazz fusion band during 70s and it that time he made a piece that was never published. Finally, he found musicians that will perform his music on analogue synths and he finished the piece called ""Mechanical Destruction"" that we will record on this unique album! This piece is a real rock symphony!

column1: mission is to integrate the sounds of these beautiful instruments into the
worlds of modern crossover music. The music will be a perfect blend of musical
genres like the contemporary/classical with jazz fusion, the progressive rock and the popular
music. We strive for an extremely original approach and to our knowledge there
have not been other musicians performing on analogue synthesizers commissioned

work by a living contemporary composers.

WHAT ELSE WILL HAPPEN?
Helweg, we will record our transcriptions for synths that are the real classics of contemporary music – pieces by
famous composer Ligeti: Hungarian Rock and Continuum, originally written for

harpsichords, as well the piece ""Red"" by one of the leading American composer Marc Mellits (originally made for two marimbas!) and music by fresh and exciting Columbian composer Antonio Correa from Bogota. Their pieces are the great
mixture of minimal music and rock energy!
in a quantity of 500 pieces, because our aim is to
we have decided to give away copies of our CD album – LP DUO “Belgrade New Classics"", perfect blend of South European modern and crossover classics.

EURO will be granted with the vinyl LP signed by the artists involved.

But there are much more peaks, where you can get T-shirt or digital download recordings of the album before publishing and many, many more!

 Please take a look of all pearks we have!

THANK YOU FOR TAKING YOUR TIME.

This piece is a real rock symphony!

Hello dear friends, 

Happy new year 2015


2015 brings to me a big step in classical chamber music events as I am planning to make a promotional video.


I have the idea of making a video of two pieces that talk about water: Franz Liszt’s “les jeux d’eau a la ville d’Este” plus Ravel’s “Jeu d’eaux”. 


Music description and reflection: 

Franz Liszt: 

Les jeux d’eau a la Ville d’este:




“Sed aqua quam ego dabo ei, fiet in eo fons aquae salientis in vitam aeternam” (“But the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up into eternal life,” from the Gospel of John) 

Maurice Ravel: 

Jeu d’eaux:




“Dieu fluvial riant de l’eau qui le chatouille…” a quote from Henri de Régnier’s Cité des eaux, which in English editions is sometimes translated to “River god laughing as the water tickles him…”.




Chapter 8 from <
column5:
“kindness is past down from one person to another exactly the same way that water flows to every corner in the world, nurtures everything but never ask for anything return”, Though we have different religions, different languages, but human spirit is universal and truly beautiful.




How cultural exchange can benefit from these events:




I first entered in McGill to study science, but then I realized my heart was grounded in music so I made a bold decision to switch to piano performance. I think the material world is so imperfect, no matter how much longer we as humans try to extend our life span, we are always so imperfect as a species.




At the same time, I worked at Steinway &
column6: Sons, from my work experience, I learnt that the nouveau riche are buying the “status” of these western luxury products but they do not understand why these products are expensive. Supporting a charity, or an art organization, the highest form of luxury, was never a Chinese tradition either. However, despite the eastern and western difference on aesthetic taste, I believe ultimately the praise for classical music will remain the same, because art transcends the material world- its close to everyone’s life and as a learned experience its something that all people can understand and appreciate.
column11:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">



 How making an online video can help promoting event: 

In 2013 summer, I lived in Silicon Valley for three months. After meeting so many enthusiastic and passionate IT people, who told me they rarely get out of their house and just stay in front of their computer everyday, I realized the increasingly larger role of technology that might lead many to loneliness. 


People like you, me, and our families communicate and socialize more often online than in person (just like now, I am writing an email instead of talking to you in person). People go home, log on to YouTube social media platforms to enjoy stream music. Therefore, I want to catch the future and link classical music and the internet together. I belive this can be done, by making a music video promoting the events, in order to create a website like Groupmuse.com, in English, French and Chinese, which will bring musicians closer to mainstream audiences, bring Chinese community into the mainstream community, and bring classical music back into mainstream entertainment. 

I pledge for your support on this project. The producer said once the funding is secured then we can start to shoot as early as January.




Best,




Opus One Music

Short Summary

We are Valadares, a rock band from Seattle, Washington raising money for our 2015 endeavors to further our fan base, and spread our music and message to as many as possible.

We are raising money through this campaign to record our full length album at Robert Lang Studios, film our first music video in 4K, and tour the U.S. during the summer. During this 2015 year we hope to promote and surround ourselves with as much publicity as possible. We are hoping these steps will help us rise in recognition in 2015 and hope to reach more and more people that need music that is made for them. Through our music we hope to relate and bring hope to young and old audiences everywhere, creating more and more fans or 'Vala-dorks'. We want to create music for you and are giving you the opportunity to help us do that.

If we can achieve at minimum this goal, we will have a very good chance at getting out to a very wide audience during our summer tour, and having high quality products to offer everyone in return.

 What We Need &
column2:
What You Will Get
 At minimum, we will film the music video and record tracks for the full length album. We need to raise a lot of this goal to get the full length album mixed, mastered, and released. Meeting this goal will ensure us being able to tour, and exceeding it will create more touring opportunities and cover more promotional costs.
Donating will get you Valadares-based prizes that will be bigger and better the more you donate!   

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD. If you cannot donate money, no problem! Taking time to share us through social media and word of mouth can have a massive effect! Continue to share our pages, help promote our events, and we will do our part to create impactful music and come visit your town as we tour this coming summer.

Honey Groove is a festival that spotlights the talent of performing and
visual artists who are queer women of color, creating a new experience for
music and arts enthusiasts in the DC Metro Area. Queer women of color are
beautiful and talented beyond measure yet we are under-represented in
mainstream media and at large-scale festivals. Honey Groove's mission is to
create a unique experience that empowers queer creatives, engages the community,

and awakens the creativity within us all. 

You can support our mission by selecting a perk package (to the right) and purchasing an advance ticket today.

Honey Groove is a 21+ event

Whino - DC's Southwest Arts Club

The Honey Groove festival will feature entertainment on 2 floors and outdoors, a VIP reception, live performances, multiple DJs, vendors, food trucks, and live art.
Taste of Honey | Hot Cocoa - An Introduction

The team behind Honey Groove wanted to give DC's queer community a small taste of our plans for the inaugural festival in April 2015, so last October we had an artist showcase called Taste of Honey. Hosted by local comedian and chef, Curt Mariah, it featured live painting by Ginnie McKnight, poetry from Patience, and music from DH DaHitwryer, Christen B, and Danni Cassette. The event was well received, and the community let us know that they were excited for what Honey Groove would bring!

We have been met with great success very early and are grateful to our supporters. We were awarded a $1,000 grant from Diverse City Fund out of their belief in Honey Groove's mission and potential impact on DC's community overall. Taste of Honey was well received, and the event held to launch our crowdfunding campaign, Hot Cocoa, sold out one week in advance. The community has let us know that they are ready for Honey Groove. With your support, we will launch Honey Groove and create a large scale stage that celebrates queer artists of color in the District of Columbia.

We need support from the community to bring this festival to life! A space like Honey Groove that is purposed with supporting the queer community of color to this extent does not exist. We are filling a void and bringing a large scale festival to the District of Columbia to uplift our queer artists and engage art enthusiasts.
• Artist compensation (including travel and housing for those outside of the DMV)
Meet The Team: The Cocoa Couch Collective
Kyrisha Deschamps, local artivist, is an avid

supporter of the local and underground queer arts scene that exists in DC.  She has always believed that her career would impact others in positive ways. She strives to create spaces for queer women to enjoy all aspects of art and captivating experiences, which led to the creation of Honey Groove.
Lee Levingston Perine actively serves queer communities by creating unique experiences through Makers Lab (makerslabdc.co). The Lab’s events include Disfunktion, Get Funky, Popcorn &
column2: Queers and the Audre Lorde Birthday Celebration. She has also coordinated activities during DC Black Pride through freak OUT and has supported queer organizations such as the media outlet Elixher Magazine and Cereus Arts’ The Revival with strategic and event planning.

column1: Gomes founded Our LesbiFriends LLC, an organization committed to providing an
alternative safe space for women in the LGTBQ community to commune and
support one another. The events that she hosts meet regularly in DC and have
connected hundreds of women, many of which who say this is one
of the only spaces they feel comfortable socializing in.

T. Jonae Davis has an eclectic background in jazz, advocacy, and event management. She is pursuing a masters in arts management with focuses in marketing and creative placemaking while working for an arts consulting firm. Previously, she organized and planned events as the program director for the statewide LGBT advocacy organization, Equality Virginia. Her passion for music as a saxophonist and songwriter and her experiences advocating for the queer community drew her to Honey Groove.

Bringing our vision of Honey Groove to life is a huge undertaking. Considerable time and effort have been and continue to be channeled into making Honey Groove a successful community event for artists, art lovers, and those curious about art.

If we don't hit our $10,000 goal, we will not be able to launch a 5 star festival, invite artists that aren't local, or sustain ourselves for production into 2015 and beyond.
There Are Many Ways To Support Honey Groove
You can help support Honey Groove by doing one or all of the following:
• Share this campaign with your network and anyone that loves art.
• Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram - keep in touch!
• Share your favorite queer artist with us! Let us know what artists you want to see at the festival.

** Tickets and perk packages and transferrable, but are not refundable.

column5: >The Shambhala Global Music Project - named after a mystical, magical kingdom hidden somewhere in Inner Asia - is the brainchild of Rajesh Ranjan Singh and David Nathan, two Landmark graduates who worked together in 2014 when Rajesh created a successful fundraising event for Nordoff Robbins (a music therapy charity dedicated to transforming the lives of vulnerable children and adults) at which David sang.

column4: >A number of excellent Western and South Asian musicians played and performed at the fundraising event and David saw the vision of what would be possible if all this musical energy was brought together to collaborate and create new music. He shared his vision with Rajesh who was having a similar vision at the same time...

column1: Rajesh is a musician and a leader who pioneered the breakthrough of rock music in India from the underground to the mainstream through his record label - Throatlatch Records. An acknowledged music historian and author, David has recorded three CDs as a vocalist and song stylist with a number of special U.S. musical guests.

OUR VISION FOR THE PROJECT...
The Shambhala Global Music Project is the start of this great vision of providing a platform for musicians from different genres to come together, explore, collaborate and produce music for the world that could never be produced in any other way. This will not only unite musicians in the creation of something unique but also plant the seeds for ONE WORLD, where the world lives as one!

","Short Summary

column1: HOW THE SHAMBHALA GLOBAL MUSIC PROJECT GOT CREATED...The Shambhala Global Music Project - named after a mystical, magical kingdom hidden somewhere in Inner Asia - is the brainchild of Rajesh Ranjan Singh and David Nathan, two Landmark graduates who worked together in 2014 when Rajesh created a successful fundraising event for Nordoff Robbins (a music therapy charity dedicated to transforming the lives of vulnerable children and adults) at which David sang.

A number of excellent Western and South Asian musicians played and performed at the fundraising event and David saw the vision of what would be possible if all this musical energy was brought together to collaborate and create new music. He shared his vision with Rajesh who was having a similar vision at the same time...

Rajesh is a musician and a leader who pioneered the breakthrough of rock music in India from the underground to the mainstream through his record label - Throatlatch Records. An acknowledged music historian and author, David has recorded three CDs as a vocalist and song stylist with a number of special U.S. musical guests.

Our great musical team is  inspired about creating a recording of eight songs and a performance. A portion of proceeds from the entire Shambhala Project will go towards two charity organisations:  Nordoff Robbins (transforming lives of vulnerable children and adults using music therapy) and the world-renowned Save The Children.

OUR VISION FOR THE PROJECT...The Shambhala Global Music Project is the start of this great vision of providing a platform for musicians from different genres to come together, explore, collaborate and produce music for the world that could never be produced in any other way. This will not only unite musicians in the creation of something unique but also plant the seeds for ONE WORLD, where the world lives as one!WHY WE ARE ASKING FOR YOUR SUPPORT.......so we can raise the funds to do the recording of six-eight songs within the next month followed by a live performance of the new music within the next two months
column2: our budget includes studio fees for recording, mixing and mastering
column4: and production of a limited number of CDs for sale online and at performances.ONCE REACH OUR GOAL......we can complete recording, The Shambhala Global Music Project will be 'live' and tracks available digitally for worldwide distribution (on iTunes and Amazon)......we can create a limited number of CDs to sell at our launch performance...WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL CREATE.....it will ultimately lead to us having this fusion of music by musicians and singers from different cultures available everywhere, in the process raising funds for two very worthwhile causes...

column1: WHAT TO DO NEXT... ...please contribute whatever amount you can - there are some great perks!  And most important for all of us, please spread the word!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column3: />                      Who are we?

column1:
Hi!
 I am Steph Brown and I am Della Lupa - an independent Brighton based artist. The project launched in June 2013  when I released debut EP 'Of the She Wolf' produced by Jag Jago (Maccabees). However the ideas for Della Lupa began to develop well before the launch. 'Of the She Wolf' is Della Lupa translated from Italian to English and the work was meant to reference my own cultural heritage of Italian, Vietnamese and English. It was during my Philosophy degree at Sussex University that I became fascinated with the merging of multiple ideas and cultures, looking to find a personal balance between many influences and ways of seeing through a project that at the same time exemplified strong female leadership in music. This inspiration  became the backbone to Della Lupa's style, sound and direction!

'Of the She Wolf' was funded off my own blood sweat, tears and shift work.  After post production and printing there were no funds left for a PR campaign to push the EP into press. Regardless the debut had relative success! Off the back of the release DL was asked to tour, playing 13 shows over two weeks in some of Ireland's best underground venues. DL also enjoyed playing some of London's best alternative venues inc. Ronnie Scotts Jazz club! fast gaining a reputation for high quality performance Della Lupa recorded a clockwork Owl session that had over 3600 YT hits without any external promotion!

the performance focused year of 2014 I was approached by photographer Beth Steddon. Initially looking for a model for her own photographic work, the project spiraled into a collaboration whereby, so inspired, I wrote and stylized the upcoming single 'Storm Of Swallows' based on Steddon's own concept in the photographs. This launched a new level of Della Lupa's ambition to 'merge ideas and perspectives' whereby the most essential part of the musical work has a strong relationship to it's visual counterpart and collaborators and so does it's promotion. *Storm of Swallows Launches on March 5th @One Church, Brighton - all proceedings go towards our target. Tickets available from www.wegottickets.com* Join:  https://www.facebook.com/events/1574104159471033
I am an independent artist

There's a real kick about creating projects were so many other artists are involved and I get to promote them through DL. It really strengthens my relationship and that of others in the creative community that I heavily rely on and I want to continue in this manner. I am able to make decisions
column2: not just about where to  take the music, but what it will mean and what it will support

column1: it is understandable that the question I got asked the most
you guys been signed or are you planning/trying to get signed?"".  This road is tough. Initially, you have very
limited access to exposure, you spend an incredible amount of time on your work to make it great, but you
have no time because you need to earn money to live. In order to get that exposure
column2: for the tools, and the employment of people -  you need a lot of money you don't

column1: have. In this climate where music is free or incredibly cheap you make hardly any money off of your tracks and venues don't readily pay new bands for
shows so at first it is incredibly difficult to fund and promote yourselves.

You can Help DL by pre-ordering a work which hasn't yet been made and donating to this Campaign. By doing this you are investing your confidence in Della Lupa and believing in what we will achieve.

We need £2500 to produce a high production 4 track EP with Mercury nominated Producer Jag Jago  (Maccabees). If your wondering what I mean by 'High Production' I'm talking about top notch quality from the collaborating with producers, musicians, film makers and artists involved in it's creation who have the experience, skills and contacts to make the kind of EP that a label would market for an upcoming band.

£2500 that we are trying to raise will go towards the studio time, production, mixing, mastering and session musicians. Its a lot of money but there is a lot to pay for! This only covers one half of the money needed to then make the accompanying high production videos, get the EP out into print, fund a PR campaign to get some exposure by the press  and that is at a discount.

A high quality EP means DL moves  forward!

Short-term, your donation and the making of this high production EP will enable us to show our ability to make high quality work- in music, art and film independently from a record label.  As an independent artist what matters most is the quality of work - your audience finds out about you and follows you mainly through word of mouth not through mass publicity so the work has got to be good! An EP of high standard will help us obtain a presence in press leading to  better support shows, better paid shows and even tour further afield in Europe (we aim to tour Germany by next year!
What will you get in return?
We have gifts, 'perks' for donations as little as £3 to as large as £300!
Please look to the right of this page where you can find the listing of all exciting Della Lupa material on offer!

For the larger donations we've chosen rewards shaped around different interests - packages for 'The Music Collector' the 'The Art Lover' and 'The Fashionista' 'The Vintage Wearer' and 'the Merch Stasher'. These are all the exclusive aspects of Della Lupa that you can take home with you and help us carry on developing by doing so! The little bits help towards our goal also so we've got rewards for the smaller donations, to name a few - The Storm of Swallows single exclusive to this #HelpMeMakeMusic Campaign, a pre-order of the new EP and a set of all Della Lupa releases. Below are some of the photos relating to our exclusive perks!
Other ways you can get involved...
help DL to  promote this #HelpMeMakeMusic campaign.

Every Thursday from the 12/02/15  DL  will be release a new piece of material via our social media sites to generate awareness and reward our followers. You can 'like' or 'share' our releases and content about our campaign via our social media sites! You can also simply tell you friends about it!
if you see the below sticker image around
Brighton, photograph, post to social media site of your choice with the
hashtag #HelpMeMakeMusic and we will give you a free download at the end
of the campaign! The best photograph wins a copy of the new EP and 2
tickets to the EP launch in Brighton!

For taking the time to read this and support our campaign!
special thanks to: Kevin Minney, Holly Whitehouse, Daniel Hansen, Bensalem Mitchell,Peter Maccourt, Daisy Hopson, Luka Koch, Beth Steddon, and everyone involved in the releases and press for this campaign!
                                                                       DL

My name is Asa. I'm a Bristol-based musician and have been producing and performing under my first name and alias for about 8
years now. I work tirelessly on my music and it means everything to me. While I’ve

worked alongside a host of great producers and musicians over the years, I am ready to take the next step to do what I've always dreamed of by assembling a band, recording an album, and building a studio so that I can continue to record and release music all the time!
This will be my debut album, the result of

all my work to date. It will be a realisation of my ongoing growth into the realm of live instrumentation - an area I began to explore from early on. Live instrumentation has been most prominent in my music so far in collaborations with KOAN Sound on our Sanctuary EP and my recent Heartbeats EP.

So, why support me? The full-length album is a format towards which I’ve been striving (with plenty of encouragement from the fans!) for quite some time now. However, as an artist whose solo musical output mostly is forced to negotiate the tricky terrain of being just outside club DJ-set compatibility, I have often encountered difficulty finding a truly hospitable context for that aspect of my 'sound'.
Who's on my team? My two talented bandmates (Chalky &
column2: James) are part of the production, as well as quite a few other talented friends, both musically and otherwise. I’ve already started writing and recording music with live performance in mind, and Chalky, James, and I have already started to rehearse. The first batch of demos are already sounding really solid (as can be heard in the video above!) and I have a strong sense of direction for the album. I think the results will be truly unique – not to mention, long-lasting. I would like to take this opportunity to allow <b>Chalky &amp

column1: This is not an undertaking I have assumed lightly. Frankly, I am a bit camera shy, and don't like to make my music about me, because it isn't - it's about the music and how it makes people feel. However, with the continued and overwhelming amount of encouragement I’ve received from friends &

column1: Crucially, this new live platform will broaden the reach of my music … and through this album I hope to allow my listeners to be a part of an intimate, real-life audience. This album, and the live shows, mark the beginning of a transformation of my life’s work into an experience at last reconciled with the music I have been making. Over the years I have consistently challenged myself without ever compromising quality. And not only is this a landmark undertaking in my musical career, but it also marks a huge shift in the way I might go on to establish a sustainable way of writing and performing my music from here on out… but I can't do it without your help.

I'm so excited to be able to develop this album into what it should be with the proper equipment. I'm even more excited and motivated by your support, which allows me to do what I love AND continue to create music. Please donate if you can, but even a share goes a long way - I really think you'll love the new tunes (and other rewards!), and so much more if they're done right! Our goal is to have the album completed and on it's way to you by the end of Summer/start of Autumn 2015.

Also, anyone who contributes to the campaign will be  able to download a bunch of new music that I think you will all be very interested in at the end of the campaign as a thank you... (*cough* Burial remixes + some other unreleased stuff *cough cough*).
Any contribution and support, whether a donation or just a share, is greatly appreciated. I can't wait to share what we're creating with you all, and couldn't even dream of doing it without you!
","My name is Asa. I'm a Bristol-based musician and have been producing and performing under my first name and alias for about 8
years now. I work tirelessly on my music and it means everything to me. While I’ve

worked alongside a host of great producers and musicians over the years, I am ready to take the next step to do what I've always dreamed of by assembling a band, recording an album, and building a studio so that I can continue to record and release music all the time!
This will be my debut album, the result of

all my work to date. It will be a realisation of my ongoing growth into the realm of live instrumentation - an area I began to explore from early on. Live instrumentation has been most prominent in my music so far in collaborations with KOAN Sound on our Sanctuary EP and my recent Heartbeats EP.

So, why support me? The full-length album is a format towards which I’ve been striving (with plenty of encouragement from the fans!) for quite some time now. However, as an artist whose solo musical output mostly is forced to negotiate the tricky terrain of being just outside club DJ-set compatibility, I have often encountered difficulty finding a truly hospitable context for that aspect of my 'sound'.

Who's on my team? My two talented bandmates (Chalky & James) are part of the production, as well as quite a few other talented friends, both musically and otherwise. I’ve already started writing and recording music with live performance in mind, and Chalky, James, and I have already started to rehearse. The first batch of demos are already sounding really solid (as can be heard in the video above!) and I have a strong sense of direction for the album. I think the results will be truly unique – not to mention, long-lasting. I would like to take this opportunity to allow Chalky & James to introduce themselves...

This is not an undertaking I have assumed lightly. Frankly, I am a bit camera shy, and don't like to make my music about me, because it isn't - it's about the music and how it makes people feel. However, with the continued and overwhelming amount of encouragement I’ve received from friends & fans everywhere, it clearly is the right time to offer a bit more insight into my music and get myself out there to tour with a band.

The work with the band has progressed my music at an astonishing rate, and I'm truly grateful to everyone who has taken the time to offer words of encouragement and support over the years, which has brought me to the point I am now where I can properly build this project. I’m confident that the album material is the best music I’ve worked on to date, and am so excited to share it with you all!

For me, moving forward out from the studio and onto the live stage, there are certain technical limitations that I can no longer overcome with software engineering. Equipment for recording and performance is the majority of what funds from the campaign will be used for.
This means that all money I
raise from this campaign carries serious longevity and all contributions go towards ensuring
an infrastructure and sustainable future for my music... That's where you come in!

To be able to create the album I've been composing and to fund a live band tour, we need to buy a bit more gear - and I want to give the people who help me do it first access to the fruits of our labour. We sat down & worked out every single cost & expenditure needed to enable us to realise my vision. To tell you a bit more about where the money is going, we expect:

If you're interested, stay tuned for campaign updates about the gear we'll be purchasing and more reward opportunities. If we exceed our target the surplus funds will be used to press and distribute higher quantities of the physical-copies of the album and ultimately, raise the bar of the whole project and it's promotional campaign. I will also do my best to run competitions during the campaign & introduce extra perks if the demand calls for it.

Crucially, this new live platform will broaden the reach of my music … and through this album I hope to allow my listeners to be a part of an intimate, real-life audience. This album, and the live shows, mark the beginning of a transformation of my life’s work into an experience at last reconciled with the music I have been making. Over the years I have consistently challenged myself without ever compromising quality. And not only is this a landmark undertaking in my musical career, but it also marks a huge shift in the way I might go on to establish a sustainable way of writing and performing my music from here on out… but I can't do it without your help.

I'm so excited to be able to develop this album into what it should be with the proper equipment. I'm even more excited and motivated by your support, which allows me to do what I love AND continue to create music. Please donate if you can, but even a share goes a long way - I really think you'll love the new tunes (and other rewards!), and so much more if they're done right! Our goal is to have the album completed and on it's way to you by the end of Summer/start of Autumn 2015.
Perks range from as little as a £1 donation, to as much as visiting Bristol to spend studio time with me as I know my knowledge and insight of music production

Any contribution and support, whether a donation or just a share, is greatly appreciated. I can't wait to share what we're creating with you all, and couldn't even dream of doing it without you!",6.0,1,"1 Campaign

From a young age I was always writing. Filling journals and diaries with so many thoughts. Forever an internal processor. I can remember as early as 2nd grade wanting to be an author when I grew up.  I’d spend my youth-filled days writing poetry and short-stories. I’m sure growing up in the Alaska bush helped by lending itself to a wilderness of imagination and adventure! Music was always an outlet for me. Having parents who both sang, a dad who played guitar and a mom who played piano, definitely worked in my favor! I was always so fond of storytelling but never thought in a million years I'd use music to tell my OWN story! At 16, I was given my first guitar for Christmas. That's where my love for songwriting began. And where I found my voice. Who would’ve thought this natural outlet as a kid would become my life’s passion?!

In 2013, I released my debut album, Fairer Days. Honestly, I had no idea what I was doing but golly, I went after it! All I knew was I wanted to give back. I didn't just want my music to pay the bills but help others and make a difference. So we partnered with The Ameena Project, a volunteer-run, non-profit in Kenya, and over the last several years, we've been able to provide 1,000 meals for children in need... AMAZING!!!

WOW - did the response and feedback take me by surprise!!! I was so new to recording and producing that it ended up being a pretty long, drawn out process... as I didn’t have all my songs written beforehand and had never played my songs with a band before.  Being my very first project, I am still SO PROUD of how it turned out! As I’ve traveled throughout the Pacific Northwest sharing my songs,  it continues to amaze me the people who take to my music!

Over the last 4 years I’ve been writing new songs and am FINALLY at a place where I’m ready to share them with the world! The masses have spoken and it’s time to give the people what they want! Y'all have been so patient and gracious with me!!! I have no idea how some of you still show up after all these years to hear the same old songs...BLESS YOU DEAR SOULS!!!  I've fought the inner critic more times than I'd like to admit in this whole process and THANKFULLY, I've come out on top! I've had the Triple Threat at my heels....Discouragement, Doubt and Disappointment, yet STILL, I persisted. IT'S TRULY A TESTAMENT!!!

For this new album, I'm doing things completely different! We're paying one flat price, for one night, for one finished project! THAT'S RIGHT!!! We are going through a recording company called Resurgent Sound, based out of Redding, CA, who will come to us here in Vancouver and do the whole album recording LIVE!!!! That's mixing &
column2: mastering included. SAY WHAT?!?!? YEPPPPP. I love the idea of not spending an arm and a leg on recording cost and still keeping ownership of all my music!
*Just like Fairer Days, with every album sold, this new record will partner with a non-profit organization and contribute a percentage to meeting the needs of others*

column1: When I look back at what Fairer Days did, not only for me but for so many people, I can't help but have the same hope with this new album!!! With so many parts of our world suffering from lack and injustice, my prayer is that this project will spread an even wider net of provision and help make a difference.

Songwriting has been so therapeutic for me. It's helped put language to both the woes and the joys of my heart. In every season. I don't know any other way to process. Music is so powerful. And if I'm so deeply impacted by other artist's song-stories, I have to believe there are people out there who will resonate with mine. The goal with my music is that the listener would experience hope. That they wouldn't feel alone. And that it would give permission to those whose creativity has laid dormant or untapped. If I can do it, YOU CAN DO IT!!!!

I've never done crowdfunding before so it's definitely a risk! BUT you never know until you try, eh? What I love about this opportunity is that each contributor has a part in making this project come to life! I'm a firm believer that we're always BETTER TOGETHER, so why not reach out to those who believe in you to help you see a dream realized?! I didn't get here on my own and definitely wouldn't want to be here, alone, without people to sing to :) I have faith in what I'm doing and where I'm heading and am simply trusting the process - scary and all!!!!

My band and I have already spent months throughout the year in rehearsal, getting all my songs fleshed out and perfected, layering each instrument. Pre-production is the hardest part, in my opinion, so we're working our tails off to have this album in SHIP SHOP SHAPE come time to record! Which speaking of... we are planning to record in JANUARY 2018!!!!!!! EEEKKK!! That's crazy sooooon, SOOOOO I'm really livin' on a prayer right now! Half the amount of recording cost is due upon signing of the contract...so automatically up front we need $2,500. Meh....that's nothin' right?!?  WE CAN DO THIS!
• If you're already in it to win it and want to contribute, THANK YOUUUU!! Just scroll over the Campaign Perks and pick whichever one you fancy by simply clicking, ""back it"".
• If you can't give financially at this time, don't sweat it :) By just sharing this Campaign on your social network sites and spreading the word is SUPER HELPFUL!!!
• If you've made it this far and are still reading....GOD LOVES YOU...and so do I :) :) :) Seriously though, I can't say THANK YOU enough for your generous and kind support.
ARE YOU READY TO MAKE AN AMAZING RECORD TOGETHER???? I SURE AM!!!

From a young age I was always writing. Filling journals and diaries with so many thoughts. Forever an internal processor. I can remember as early as 2nd grade wanting to be an author when I grew up.  I’d spend my youth-filled days writing poetry and short-stories. I’m sure growing up in the Alaska bush helped by lending itself to a wilderness of imagination and adventure! Music was always an outlet for me. Having parents who both sang, a dad who played guitar and a mom who played piano, definitely worked in my favor! I was always so fond of storytelling but never thought in a million years I'd use music to tell my OWN story! At 16, I was given my first guitar for Christmas. That's where my love for songwriting began. And where I found my voice. Who would’ve thought this natural outlet as a kid would become my life’s passion?!

In 2013, I released my debut album, Fairer Days. Honestly, I had no idea what I was doing but golly, I went after it! All I knew was I wanted to give back. I didn't just want my music to pay the bills but help others and make a difference. So we partnered with The Ameena Project, a volunteer-run, non-profit in Kenya, and over the last several years, we've been able to provide 1,000 meals for children in need... AMAZING!!!

WOW - did the response and feedback take me by surprise!!! I was so new to recording and producing that it ended up being a pretty long, drawn out process... as I didn’t have all my songs written beforehand and had never played my songs with a band before.  Being my very first project, I am still SO PROUD of how it turned out! As I’ve traveled throughout the Pacific Northwest sharing my songs,  it continues to amaze me the people who take to my music!

Over the last 4 years I’ve been writing new songs and am FINALLY at a place where I’m ready to share them with the world! The masses have spoken and it’s time to give the people what they want! Y'all have been so patient and gracious with me!!! I have no idea how some of you still show up after all these years to hear the same old songs...BLESS YOU DEAR SOULS!!!  I've fought the inner critic more times than I'd like to admit in this whole process and THANKFULLY, I've come out on top! I've had the Triple Threat at my heels....Discouragement, Doubt and Disappointment, yet STILL, I persisted. IT'S TRULY A TESTAMENT!!!

For this new album, I'm doing things completely different! We're paying one flat price, for one night, for one finished project! THAT'S RIGHT!!! We are going through a recording company called Resurgent Sound, based out of Redding, CA, who will come to us here in Vancouver and do the whole album recording LIVE!!!! That's mixing & mastering included. SAY WHAT?!?!? YEPPPPP. I love the idea of not spending an arm and a leg on recording cost and still keeping ownership of all my music!
This is how it breaks down:
Give Back -->  *Just like Fairer Days, with every album sold, this new record will partner with a non-profit organization and contribute a percentage to meeting the needs of others*

Γεια σας! Είμαστε η Αλcmene και η Marie-Anne K. Καταρχάς, θα θέλαμε να σας ευχαριστήσουμε που παρακολουθείτε τη μουσική μας καμπάνια και που υποστηρίζετε την προσπάθεία μας να υλοποιήσουμε το πρώτο σολο άλμπουμ της Αλcmene. O δίσκος μας εμπεριέχει κομμάτια διαφορετικού είδους όπως ποπ, ροκ και ηλεκτρονικά, τα οποία έχει συνθέσει η Marie-Anne K.

Λόγω της ελληνικής δημοσιονομικής κρίσης και της περιορισμένης τοπικής μουσικής αγοράς, δε μπορέσαμε να ολοκληρώσουμε το άλμπουμ με δικούς μας πόρους. Παρόλο που δεν έχουμε ενταχθεί ακόμα σε καμία δισκογραφική εταιρεία, γνωρίζουμε εξ αρχής πως καμία εταιρεία δε δύναται να καλύψει όλα τα έξοδα μας. Είμαστε απόλυτα επικεντρωμένες και δοσμένες στο σκοπό μας και παρά τις αμέτρητες δυσκολίες που μπορεί να αντιμετωπίζουμε, δε θα σταματήσουμε ποτέ να δημιουργούμε και να ζούμε γι' αυτό που αγαπάμε: τη ΜΟΥΣΙΚΗ.
<div>Αν και φαντάζει αδύνατο για εκείνη να ενταχθεί σε ένα είδος μουσικής λόγω των πολλών της επιρροών, η <span style=""background-color: initial

column3: >Post/Alternative Rock και Trip Hop ύφος με στοιχεία της Gospel και της Blues μουσικής. Στο σύνολό της παρουσιάζεται ως μία ποπ καλλιτέχνης, η οποία αγαπά να παντρεύει την αντήχηση με τους σκοτεινούς, ""βρώμικους"" ήχους που παράγει το συνθεσάιζερ.
column4: >Η μεγαλύτερη της εμμονή δεν είναι άλλη από τους 80s ηλεκτρονικούς ήχους.
column5: >Ως αποτέλεσμα, το άλμπουμ θα αποτελέσει ένα πολυσυλλεκτικό κράμα πηγών και ήχων. Τα κομμάτια στοχεύουν στη δημιουργία ενός ξεχωριστού, προσωπικού είδους, το οποίο θα αποτελείται από φωνητικές αρμονίες και σκοτεινά ηχοτοπία.
