column1: Ρίξτε μία ματιά στην τελευταία instrumental διασκευή του, την οποία κυκλοφόρησε μέσω της Candyrat Records:
Μάθετε περισσότερα για τον Chris Mike εδώ:

Ως αποτέλεσμα, η ιδέα μιας διαδικτυακής μουσικής καμπάνιας φαντάζει ιδανική για εμάς, καθώς μας δίνεται η δυνατότητα να συμπεριλάβουμε εσάς ως συμπαραγωγούς στη μουσική μας. Συνεπώς, σε περίπτωση που σας αρέσει το εγχείρημά μας, μπορείτε να μας βοηθήσετε να μαζέψουμε το ποσό που χρειαζόμαστε, ώστε να ηχογραφήσουμε, να μιξάρουμε και να ολοκληρώσουμε την παραγωγή του δίσκου σε ένα πλήρως εξοπλισμένο στούντιο ηχογραφήσεων. Επιπλέον, χρειαζόμαστε περαιτέρω πόρους για την εκτύπωση, την προώθηση, αλλά και τη διανομή του δίσκου. Ακόμα κι αν δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά στην καμπάνια μας, μπορείτε να μας διαφημίσετε στις δικές σας πλατφόρμες κοινωνικής δικτύωσης.
Σας υποσχόμαστε πως θα σας κρατάμε ενήμερους για την πορεία της καμπάνιας μας, καθώς και για την ανανέωση των διαφόρων προνομίων που προσφέρουμε μέσω της πλατφόρμας του Indiegogo!
Θα θέλαμε να σας ευχαριστήσουμε για μία ακόμα φορά για τη βοήθεια και για την καλή σας διάθεση μέσα από τα βάθη της καρδιά μας!
Ο στόχος μας είναι να μαζέψουμε €6.400 ώστε να ολοκληρώσουμε
Ανάλογα με το ποσό που επενδύετε στην καμπάνια μας, εμείς
σας ανταποδίδουμε με κάποιες από τις προσφορές μας. Μπορείτε να λάβετε ένα cd

προσωπικά υπογεγγραμμένο από εμάς, να σας συμπεριλάβουμε ως συμπαραγωγούς του έργου μας ή μπορείτε να απολαύσετε μία live ακουστική μας εμφάνιση. Επιπλέον, μπορούμε να συνθέσουμε και να ερμηνεύσουμε ένα
κομμάτι αποκλειστικά για εσάς, ενώ ταυτόχρονα μπορούμε να σας προσφέρουμε πολλές άλλες προσφορές.
Σημειώνεται ότι ακόμα κι αν δεν φτάσουμε το στόχο μας, τα
έσοδα από την καμπάνια θα μοιραστούν βάση προτεραιοτήτων.

Hi guys! We are Aλcmene and
Marie-Anne K. Firstly, we would like to thank you for checking out our campaign
and for supporting our attempt to make Aλcmene’s debut solo album come true.
Our project contains several pop, rock, electronic songs, written and produced
A little something about the Album….
In order to listen to some of the pre-productions of our album please follow the link below:
Aλcmene's Debut Album Pre- Productions Samples

Marie-Anne K, in spite of being influenced by many genres, she cannot really restrict herself into one musical style. She combines Electronic, Post/Alternative Rock, Trip Hop with Gospel and Blues elements. She is considered to be a pop artist that loves to create dark atmospheres with distorted and synths sounds along with reverb effects. Her biggest obsession is ...the 80s electronic sounds. Therefore, the album will be a versatile mix of tracks that combine all of the above elements. The songs will create a unique genre, full of vocal harmonies and dark soundscapes.

The co-production of Aλcmene's album will be held by Chris Mike, who will also perform the guitar parts for this upcoming album. Chris Mike (https://www.facebook.com/chrismikepage) is a Candyrat Records and JamTrackCentral artist.
Check out his latest cover instrumental song through Candyrat Records:
Find out more about Chris Mike here:
Due to the Greek financial crisis
and the limited local music industry, we were not able to finish the album by
ourselves. Even though we haven't collaborated with any music label yet, we know for a
fact that it would be rather difficult to cover all of our expenses that way. We
are utterly passionate for what we do and despite the numerous difficulties, we
will never stop creating what we love: MUSIC.
As a result, a crowdfunding campaign
seems to be the ideal choice for us, as we are thrilled to consider you as co-producers of our music. Therefore, if you like our music, you can help
us raise funds in order to record, mix and master the album in a professional
recording studio with high-quality equipment. Then, we need to promote it and release it. But even
if you are not able to contribute, you can still help us by sharing our
campaign on your social media accounts.
We promise to keep you posted
with regular updates and new perks!
Thank you again for your help and
for us from the bottom of our hearts!
What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise €6.400 to complete our project.
Some of the perks for donations will include private
acoustic concerts, personalized signed copies of the album, shout outs in the
printed record, original songs and cover videos just for you!
If we don't reach our goal, the funds will be divided
accordingly, cutting out certain areas such as marketing perks.
If you can't afford any of the perks, don't worry.
You can still help us out by spreading the word about the campaign. There's
definitely a way for everybody to help, if they are so inclined! For instance,
you can use the share tools that Indiegogo provides to spread the word across
We are really glad that you took the time to check out our
Stay tuned either on our Indiegogo or Facebook page and
learn more about our campaign and our updated perks!

Γεια σας! Είμαστε η Αλcmene και η Marie-Anne K. Καταρχάς, θα θέλαμε να σας ευχαριστήσουμε που παρακολουθείτε τη μουσική μας καμπάνια και που υποστηρίζετε την προσπάθεία μας να υλοποιήσουμε το πρώτο σολο άλμπουμ της Αλcmene. O δίσκος μας εμπεριέχει κομμάτια διαφορετικού είδους όπως ποπ, ροκ και ηλεκτρονικά, τα οποία έχει συνθέσει η Marie-Anne K.

Λόγω της ελληνικής δημοσιονομικής κρίσης και της περιορισμένης τοπικής μουσικής αγοράς, δε μπορέσαμε να ολοκληρώσουμε το άλμπουμ με δικούς μας πόρους. Παρόλο που δεν έχουμε ενταχθεί ακόμα σε καμία δισκογραφική εταιρεία, γνωρίζουμε εξ αρχής πως καμία εταιρεία δε δύναται να καλύψει όλα τα έξοδα μας. Είμαστε απόλυτα επικεντρωμένες και δοσμένες στο σκοπό μας και παρά τις αμέτρητες δυσκολίες που μπορεί να αντιμετωπίζουμε, δε θα σταματήσουμε ποτέ να δημιουργούμε και να ζούμε γι' αυτό που αγαπάμε: τη ΜΟΥΣΙΚΗ.

Αν και φαντάζει αδύνατο για εκείνη να ενταχθεί σε ένα είδος μουσικής λόγω των πολλών της επιρροών, η Marie-Anne K καταφέρνει να συνδυάσει το Ηλεκτρονικό, Post/Alternative Rock και Trip Hop ύφος με στοιχεία της Gospel και της Blues μουσικής. Στο σύνολό της παρουσιάζεται ως μία ποπ καλλιτέχνης, η οποία αγαπά να παντρεύει την αντήχηση με τους σκοτεινούς, ""βρώμικους"" ήχους που παράγει το συνθεσάιζερ. Η μεγαλύτερη της εμμονή δεν είναι άλλη από τους 80s ηλεκτρονικούς ήχους. Ως αποτέλεσμα, το άλμπουμ θα αποτελέσει ένα πολυσυλλεκτικό κράμα πηγών και ήχων. Τα κομμάτια στοχεύουν στη δημιουργία ενός ξεχωριστού, προσωπικού είδους, το οποίο θα αποτελείται από φωνητικές αρμονίες και σκοτεινά ηχοτοπία.

Η συμπαραγωγή του άλμπουμ της Aλcmene θα πραγματοποιηθεί από τον Chris Mike, ο οποίος θα επιμεληθεί και τα κιθαριστικά μέρη του δίσκου. Ο Chris Mike (https://www.facebook.com/chrismikepage) είναι καλλιτέχνης της Candyrat Records και της JamTrackCentral.
Ρίξτε μία ματιά στην τελευταία instrumental διασκευή του, την οποία κυκλοφόρησε μέσω της Candyrat Records:
Μάθετε περισσότερα για τον Chris Mike εδώ:

Ως αποτέλεσμα, η ιδέα μιας διαδικτυακής μουσικής καμπάνιας φαντάζει ιδανική για εμάς, καθώς μας δίνεται η δυνατότητα να συμπεριλάβουμε εσάς ως συμπαραγωγούς στη μουσική μας. Συνεπώς, σε περίπτωση που σας αρέσει το εγχείρημά μας, μπορείτε να μας βοηθήσετε να μαζέψουμε το ποσό που χρειαζόμαστε, ώστε να ηχογραφήσουμε, να μιξάρουμε και να ολοκληρώσουμε την παραγωγή του δίσκου σε ένα πλήρως εξοπλισμένο στούντιο ηχογραφήσεων. Επιπλέον, χρειαζόμαστε περαιτέρω πόρους για την εκτύπωση, την προώθηση, αλλά και τη διανομή του δίσκου. Ακόμα κι αν δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά στην καμπάνια μας, μπορείτε να μας διαφημίσετε στις δικές σας πλατφόρμες κοινωνικής δικτύωσης.

If you don't think so, that's fine.  If you haven't heard it,  LISTEN TO IT.  It's 4 minutes long for crying out loud.
It's already done.  You probably just heard it.  If you didn't, go listen to it.
If it's already done, why do you need any money from me?

I'm trying to get enough to invest in recording an upcoming EP with 4-5 songs, and also have a little extra to spend on promoting the single.  I invested over $1500 on recording and mastering the single.  Three more songs will probably run around $3500.  It would be nice to have some partnership with that.

On November 5, it'll be up on iTunes, Spotify and Apple Music, plus some other retail and streaming sites.  I'd like to be able to spend a little to promote the song through social media and other advertising.  It takes a lot for a lonely little song to break through the rank and file of Spotify, which has over 30 million songs.  Around 4 million have never been played once.

• This song is done, finished, finito.  You'll never hear a better version of it from me.  If you've heard it already, you can take that bit of bliss and go, I'm glad to have shared my heart with you.  If you think it's pretty awesome, help me get the word out by sharing it or by investing in it and future work.  I've got a whole album written that you might like to hear.

• I've got t-shirts coming and CD copies (with a B-side), maybe vinyl if enough of you are interested.  You can also invest in the upcoming EP and album.  Maybe this will go viral and out of control and I won't have to do another campaign to fund those.  Wouldn't that be nice?
• Either way, you can have the single of this song, because as I mentioned, it's finished.  Done.

Probably not.  But who knows?  Maybe people will take relationships and/or mental illness more seriously because of your contribution.  At least lots more people will have this song stuck in their head, and I for one think that's a good thing.
But I don't have any money! How can I help?
First off, if you're over 16 you can probably get a job.  If not, you can beg your parents for money, or dig in their couch cushions for change.  Otherwise you can:
• Share my Facebook vids and witty posts.
• Like the YouTube video and post lovely comments.

• Buy a goat for a village through WorldVision.  That's probably way more beneficial to the world that supporting my music, but that's $75, and if you can't afford my single, there's no way that's in your budget.

And that's it!

Hey friends!

I'm so glad you're here as I start the journey of my newest studio album, LionHeart. The last 3 years have been filled with struggle but also great hope as I've begun to find my voice and be courageous to go after the things God has called me to, a true LionHeart (one who is incredibly courageous and brave.)

Part of owning my call, is acknowledging that I am called to write songs that will impact a generation for the Gospel and to do that requires me to be bold &
column2:
courageous and step out in ways that seem intimidating. I love the beautiful gospel story! My life has been radically impacted by King Jesus as He brought me out of the kingdom of darkness into His glorious Kingdom of light. Because of my story, I believe these songs carry a grace to awaken radicals and release courage to those who feel weak.

I believe that we are entering a very strategic season in the body of Christ where God is releasing an unprecedented passion and raising a revolutionary company to take the Kingdom by force (in love). I am believing for this album to do three things:

column1: Unity - The songs on this album focus on the centrality of Christ and His Kingdom reign over all things. It is a clear call to follow Him and lay down all that stands in the way of radical love.

Awakening - This album sounds a clear call to the season that we are currently living in and challenges us to arise and shine the light of Christ to those around us. The hope is for a fresh revelation of Jesus to be revealed to all who hear these songs and for freedom to come to those in chains.

Impartation - Because of the journey I've been on the last 3 years, I believe this album carries an impartation for boldness and courage to overcome fear and intimidation and begin to release your own voice and sound into the world that surrounds us.
With your help, all proceeds will go directly to fund the recording &
<li>studio time with my friend Andre at Estudio Dove in Brazil (tracking, mixing &amp
• round trip tickets to Brazil ($1500) (because of the conversion rate from Brazil to the U.S. it's cheaper to travel to Brazil than book studio time here in the States)
• percentage Indiegogo will take from the funds given

I ask that you join me on this endeavor and to be a clarion call to the revolution at hand. You are ESSENTIAL to this project. Will you join me, with your own unique voice, in giving the voiceless a song.

If you can't help financially, please consider sharing the link. Exposure is key in having a successful campaign.

Grupa glazbenika i pjesnika, sjajnih instrumentalista i ljudi od riječi. Jezgru grupe Zefir čine:

Enes Kišević, svjetski poznati pjesnik, autor tridesetak zbirki poezije, kojemu su pjesme prevođene na dvadesetak jezika, poznati glumac, ali i aktivan borac za mir i razumijevanje među ljudima. Poezija Enesa Kiševića prevođena je na tridesetak jezika u svijetu.

Ismet Kurtović, autor mnogih pjesama grupe Drugi način, gitarist, vokal, flautist, aranžer, te voditelj poznatih zborova Arabeske i Bulbuli. Pjesme Ismeta Kurtovića iz nekadašnje grupe Drugi način sušaju se i danas diljem svijeta.
Sead Alić, tekstopisac dijela pjesama grupe Zefir, vokal,  prateća gitara, ali (kao doktor znanosti) i moderator na nastupima Zefira.
Safiudin Alimoski, vrsni glazbenik i poznavatelj makedonske, hrvatske i bosanske glazbene tradicije (vokal, gitara, orgulje, kaval, udaraljke...)

MISIJA grupe ZEFIR – Pokazati ljepotu i vrijednost  pjevanja živih i bolnih tema (koje nam iz života oduzima industrija zabave), te na taj način sudjelovati u vraćanju Istine, Tolerancije i Riječi u poeziju, glazbu i ljudski razgovor.

VIZIJA grupe ZEFIR – Uključujući u grupu sve one koji svladaju kompozicije koje se izvode, a koji se pronađu u nastojanjima projekta – ZEFIR želi razvijati razumijevanje među ljudima različitih (vjerskih, političkih, svjetonazorskih, kulturnih, civilizacijskih…) opredjeljenja.
Projekt obuhvaća dovršavanje CD-a grupe Zefir. Troškovi produkcije preostalih 8 pjesama u profesionalnom glazbenom studiju iznose do 5.500 dolara.
• Trošak uključuje: snimanje i obrada pjesama u profesionalnom studiju, miksanje finalnog proizdvoda, sudjelovanje gostojućih glazbenika...
• Iznos koji se prikuplja namijenjen je izdavanju kompletnog CD-a s 12 pjesama. Ukoliko se ne skupi potpun iznos, sredstva će se uložiti u izdavanje CD-a s manjim brojem pjesama  - mini CD.
Pjesme grupe Zefir namjenjene su ponajviše Bosni i Hercegovini raseljenoj po cijeloj svijetu.
• Dosadašnja iskustva pokazuju da publika koja prati aktivnosti Zefira razmije koliko je važno nastaviti i razvijati takav projekt.
• Grupa Zefir prvenstveno proizvodi nekomercijalnu glazbu koja teži doprijeti do ljudi sklonih poeziji, uglazljenoj pjesničkoj riječi.
• Nekomercijalan projekt u svojoj srži zahtjeva potrebu za dodatnim načinima financiranja.
Grupa Zefir zajedno je do sada snimila nekoliko pjesama i videa, koje su dostupne na platformama poput YouTube.
Grupa Zefir otvorena je za suradnju - gostovanja u institucijama, centrima regije i Europskih zemalja želja su ove grupe te se svi zainteresirani pozivaju da kontaktiraju članove grupe.
• Svaki Zefirov nastup spoj je poezije i glazbe, primjer atmosfere može se vidjeti na gostovanjima u Zagrebu.
• Pozivamo Vas da pogledate pjesme grupe Zefir.
• Projekt Zefira je i Vaš projekt - podijelite našu priču!

Dosadašnja iskustva pokazuju da publika koja prati aktivnosti Zefira razmije koliko je važno nastaviti i razvijati takav projekt.
Grupa Zefir prvenstveno proizvodi nekomercijalnu glazbu koja teži doprijeti do ljudi sklonih poeziji, uglazljenoj pjesničkoj riječi.
Nekomercijalan projekt u svojoj srži zahtjeva potrebu za dodatnim načinima financiranja.
Grupa Zefir zajedno je do sada snimila nekoliko pjesama i videa, koje su dostupne na platformama poput YouTube.
Drugi načini kako se možete uključiti!
Grupa Zefir otvorena je za suradnju - gostovanja u institucijama, centrima regije i Europskih zemalja želja su ove grupe te se svi zainteresirani pozivaju da kontaktiraju članove grupe.
Svaki Zefirov nastup spoj je poezije i glazbe, primjer atmosfere može se vidjeti na gostovanjima u Zagrebu.
Pozivamo Vas da pogledate pjesme grupe Zefir.
Projekt Zefira je i Vaš projekt - podijelite našu priču!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

The 7th Sanguis et Cinis has been recorded in 2005.
Produced by former Atrocity drummer Martin Schmidt, also responsible for a large part of the production of the last official Sanguis et Cinis release ""TH1RTE3N"".
The band split up in 2007 and the album remained unreleased.
The studio still has the master tapes and to be able to get them we have to pay the remaining 3000€ we owe them since 2005.
We get a lot of requests from fans, so here it is. Your chance to make it happen.

Although we are primarily a corporate and function band, in the past few years we have been taking our show into theatres to give our fans and followers a chance to come and see us live.  At the same time, we have appeared at several Bond fan events such as the On The Tracks Of 007 event at the Pinewood Hotel in 2015.

We regularly get messages and emails from all around the World from people who would like to see us in their country, but due to the costs involved, we are unable to take our show to many of the places requested - including the US for example.
We are bringing in some top industry experts to bring this idea to fruition - including a sound engineer who worked on the last 3 James Bond soundtracks.

We need the funding to cover the costs of the project.  To produce the highest professional output we can, the costs are large.

We also want to make sure the stream and product is guaranteed.

What is going to come from this project:

The show will be available as a stream for just over 24 hours from 1900 28th November to 2359 29th November 2016.  You will be able to start watching the stream (from the start of the show) at any point in that period.

In addition, available in January 2017 will be a DVD and CDs of the show.  The DVDs will contain all the individual tracks performed, but not the compere spots and not the James Bond Radio presentation - for these you will need to watch the live show.
We have a variety of perks available, including access to the stream (you will need to pay to get an access code), copies of the DVD/CD and other great options too.

To guarantee the streams (to ensure a good connection), and make sure our fans around the World can see the show, we are uploading and streaming the show for just over 24 hours after the show.  No matter where you are in the World, you will be able to begin the show and watch it as live, within that period.

We very much want to give the feel of the live show - which is why we are only offering it in this method in this time period, after that, an edited down DVD will be available.
We Have All The Time In The World

The Man With The Golden Gun

The story of Monk Restrung starts in 2004 when I began playing in Ben Riley's Monk Legacy Septet. It was a dream come true to play the music of Thelonious Monk with one of his greatest drummers! Trumpeter and musical director, Don Sickler arranged the classic tunes Ben played with Monk for four horns with guitar, bass and drums and painstakingly reproduced the distinctive harmonies, comping and solos of the master pianist without piano. This was documented on Memories of T (Concord Records 2006). Later I recorded Grown Folks Music (Sunnyside Records 2012) with Ben and Wayne Escoffery, the tenor player in the Legacy Septet. 

The heavily orchestrated and specific arrangements were challenging. Playing with Ben was always inspiring but I was scripted more than not and craved the freedom of the trio. As Will Friedwald wrote in the New York Sun, “Even though guitarist Freddie Bryant is also a prominent part of the band, Mr. Sickler resisted the temptation to let the guitar take the place of the piano. Mr. Bryant plays with an appropriately Monkish percussiveness, but he supplies horn-like, single-note-lines, rather than comping chords like a pianist.”

I found I was increasingly intrigued by the possibilities of Monk on the guitar and began to experiment with my working trio of Greg Ryan (bass) and Willard Dyson (drums) who had been the core of my Kaleidoscope group. Our style went from straight-ahead/swing to Brazilian, Latin and African influenced jazz as documented on Live at Smoke (Fresh Sound/World Jazz  2000).  

Stu Deutsch, a devoted guitar fan turned producer, bartered with an engineer for studio time and I came armed with my rhythm section and my trio of guitars: electric/jazz, nylon/classical and a 12-string!!! With the success of that session came more guitar-centered musings and Romero, Pete and Howard came in to record duos with me. This added Pete's swinging arch-top, Romero's Brazilian nylon and Howard's deep jazz 7-string guitars...Thus, Monk Restrung was conceived and recorded in 2005...

Money was then spent to edit, mix and master but the result was not where I wanted it at the time and the project fell by the wayside with no funds for completion. Fast forward 11 years and with the help of generous donations of a new mix and mastering we're on the way. But even with the music completed, the costs of production (including artist agreements from our original hand-shake contracts) threaten to create ongoing debt for years to come. 

I've decided to release it now because many factors are lining up: as we approach Monk's 100th anniversary many familiar with the project have said it is an important and unique addition to the huge body of Monk-inspired repertory. Whether this is the case or not, I do know it represents a critical and undocumented aspect of my career which, in some circles, has been viewed as geared towards Brazilian/Latin styles rather than rooted in the traditional American jazz that molded me as a jazz player. 

More importantly I have the opportunity of a CD release gig at one of the premier jazz clubs in New York City with ALL of the amazing players who graced this project! On Monday, November 28th we will gather at Dizzy's/Jazz at Lincoln Center, celebrating the new CD but also dedicating the evening to Ben Riley whom we hope will be in attendance!

Here's the dedication of the CD: 
THIS CD IS DEDICATED TO BEN RILEY WHO HAS BEEN AN INSPIRATION FOR ME IN LEARNING MONK’S MUSIC. HIS SENSE OF SWING IS INGRAINED IN MY SOUL AND I WILL ALWAYS DEEPLY APPRECIATE HIS MENTORSHIP AND FRIENDSHIP.

Your support is an important and valued part of this project.  We can't do it without you! I hope you'll read further for more details and PERKS for your donation.

THANK YOU!
Freddie B.

All the music is recorded, edited, mixed and mastered. Check out the video above for some sound excerpts and studio pics of us 'back in the day!' But now we have the last hill to climb.

Here it is in plain terms:

EXPENSES:
$3500 – musician fees 
$3581 – CD production 2000 units (4 side color digipack, 8 page booklet, Pro-distribution)
$2451.88 – Publishing (12 Thelonious Monk songs) 
$1800 – CD graphic design (already discounted from $2500-3000)

$11, 332.88 – TOTAL

We're asking for $10,000 and we have already spent a lot over the years in production. This will not recover the full budget but we guarantee that all proceeds will go directly to the costs that have to be paid in this short 33 days until the release and celebration at Dizzy's.

The benefits of your donation will range from a simple digital transfer of the music or signed CDs to private music lessons, tai chi classes, house/benefit concerts, admission to the CD release at Dizzy's and Executive Producer credit with listing on the CD! 

Please check out the detailed list on this page and continue to come back as we will be adding perks periodically. 

To all my fans and friends who contributed to my 2012 CD Live Grooves...Epic Tales (HipNotic Records) I hope you realize that your effort was critical in my only previous crowd funding success. Your help enabled my first CD in a 12 year period and I hope you are still enjoying the music that will live on forever thanks to you! This Monk project would have come in the middle of that 12 year recording drought. My last CD was Dreamscape: Solo, Duo, Trio (GJKSounds 2014). I hope this new/vintage project will fill in the gaps and propel my creative efforts for the future.
I know financial times are difficult all around and I truly value your time and am honored if you've read this far! If you cannot contribute but want to support PLEASE help us
column3:
'> get the word out and make some INTERNET NOISE about this campaign - or tell someone in person! You can use the Indiegogo share tools and copy/paste/share any Facebook/Twitter or LinkedIn posts.

THANKS AGAIN! 
Freddie
PS...and don't forget to VOTE!

column2: >My name is Michael Conrad and I am an advocate for truth. My love for writing started early after winning a state-wide poetry contest in the second grade regarding modern day environmental issues. I continued to write throughout my teenage years into my adult life and discovered music as a medium for my message.

column1: This song and this campaign means so much to me because not only does it explore today's hot button issues, but it sends a message to those who hold the key to change. We are all responsible for our own future, this song cleverly titled ""Progress"" reveals that our species still has a long way to go.

Your contribution will help me take this song to a new level on a visual platform. Not only will you be helping me but you will be helping discover additional talent working on this video that also share similar dreams of doing what they love. And to help others fulfill that means everything to me. Please join me and lets share that experience.
• With a budget of $6500, we've been able to plan for all costs that go with filming, editing and distributing this music video..
• Our perks will be ranging from a special social media thanks all the way up to a chance of being on set in my music video.
• Should we fail in reaching our goal, all the funds raised will still be used on this project, so please do not hesitate to donate, every bit helps!

column2:
>You will be helping me make a huge milestone in my music career, helping to create work for up and coming talent ,cast ,crew and contributing to a meaningful message that needs to spread all over the world!

• One of the challenges will be time management and staying within budget. We have an itemized list and set times so going over budget is on me

Since coming together in the spring of 2015 in Bozeman, Montana, Kickboxer has been rising on an upward swell of creative energy. Past experiences and lasting revelations form the stylistic basis for the melodic, yet dynamic sound that the trio generates. Drawing upon influences such as Modest Mouse, blink-182, Truckfighters, and Surfer Blood, the band effortlessly blends raw emotion with powerful metaphor. Becoming a conduit for melodies of euphoric understanding as well as frustrated confusion, Kickboxer's music is reverberating off the slopes of their mountain hometown and catching the ears of enlightened listeners universally.

Deviant Septet is raising funds to complete their first ever CD recording, the music of Igor Stravinsky and Esa-Pekka Salonen.  Based on the ensemble Stravinsky created for his masterwork, ""The Soldier's Tale"", Deviant Septet has commissioned over 36 new works since its inception in 2011, and performed all-across the United States.  Deviant Septet is unique among the world's new music collectives, as it is the only ensemble consisting solely of this instrumentation.

Deviant Septet has been hailed as “exciting” (New York Times), a “stylish new ensemble” (New York Magazine), “superb” (Washington Post), “exceedingly fun”, “led by new music veterans” (Time Out New York), “lively and accomplished” (Classical TV: The Drift), and “boisterously entertaining” (Lucid Culture).  WNYC called it “a brand new ensemble with a high concept... made up of top classical and avant garde musicians”, and ran a feature on its debut concert in May 2011.

column2:
What You Get

The challenge is raising enough money to make it a reality.  We're trying to raise $12,000 in this campaign to finance the CD.  The cost for producing this album is a little higher than many CD projects.  For this project, in addition to normal album costs like:

column1: the two works also include royalty, rental, and mechanical license fees in order for us to record them (to the tune of $6,000).
The good news is, since we are a 501 (c)(3) not-for-profit corporation, all of your donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE!!!!!!!
Additionally, we have some really awesome gifts for our donors:
• For just $6.66 every member of Deviant Septet will give you an awesome high-five the next time you attend one of our concerts!
• For $10 you get a digital download of the album, and an invite to the album release party!
• For $25 you get a digital download, a physical copy of the CD, as well as a customized mix CD of Deviant Septet's favorite recordings of Stravinsky pieces.

• $50 gets you a custom Deviant Septet tote bag, filled with all the goodies mentioned before (except the digital download, because that would be a weird thing of which to have a physical manifestation, although you do still get that too)!
• For $100, you get the tote, the two CD's, the digital download, AND 4 complimentary tickets to a Deviant Septet show in your area!
• $250 gets you everything mentioned, plus you can attend a Deviant Septet rehearsal as our special guest.  Come see the way a contemporary classical chamber music group really operates!
• For $1,000, as if everything mentioned before wasn't enough, a member of Deviant Septet will give you a private music lesson on your instrument!  WHAT?  Yup!  You'll be a rockstar in NO time!
• For $5,000 you get the whole shebang, plus members of Deviant Septet will give you and your friends a private house concert!  Chamber music, in your chamber!
• For $10,000 you can have a cameo in our next production of l'Histoire in your area!  Come be a part of the action!  Always wanted to play the Princess?  Now's your chance!
• For $50,000 we'll sacrifice a goat in your name.
• For $100,000 we'll let you have one night alone with the goat, no questions asked...........
• For $666,666.66 you get possession of one Deviant Septet member's soul for 1 full week!  Imagine the possibilities!
• For a cool $1,000,000, you get everything mentioned before, and we will totally mention you on Twitter, bro.

If we don't fully reach our goal, we'll use the money to fund as much of the project as we can.  We'll beg, borrow, and steal the rest, because we feel so passionately about sharing this music with the world, that there's no way we aren't making this album!  If we end up raising more funds than we need, the excess will be used to help finance our second album, on New Amsterdam Records, Sleeping Giant's Histories (music by Andrew Norman, Timo Andres, Christopher Cerrone, Ted Hearne, Jacob Cooper, and Robert Honstein) a 2012 co-commission with Carnegie Hall.

How Your Funds Help

If you know Deviant Septet, you know it's a group of the country's foremost contemporary classical music interpreters.  If you don't know Deviant, check us OUT! This album represents both the inspiration for our ensemble, and one of the largest works to date written for this instrumentation.  This ain't your grandma's l'Histoire either.  Deviant Septet narrates, and acts all the parts of drama.  Our recording will be more like a radio play than a concert, and like nothing you've ever heard before.  All that, and THEN we rock out on Esa-Pekka's raucous Catch and Release!  We'll use the CD to help presenters all over the world get excited about our music, and help us share Deviant's mission with more people than ever before!  Imagine hearing an album you supported playing on your local classical music station this time next year!  Imagine attending a Deviant Septet concert in your area, because a local concert presenter became excited listening to the unique blend of instruments only Deviant can provide!

The Challenges of Art in the 21st Century

We all know that the music industry is changing.  Artists no longer get rich off of their album sales.  Record labels no longer pay for the costs associated with recording albums.  Instead, the albums serve like a press release, to get audiences to attend artists' shows.  Deviant Septet knows that in order to stand out in a crowded field, we need more than just excellence and artistry.  We need YOUR help.  Together we can make a KILLER album that listeners at home, on the internet, and presenters all over the world will absolutely LOVE!

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help!  Spread the word about our campaign on Facebook and Twitter.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.  Tell you friends, coworkers, loved ones, enemies and frenemies.  Tell you neighbor's cousin.  Tweet at a billionaire and ask if they'll join in!
We can't wait to share this album with the world, and we are so excited for your help in making it a reality!

Deviant Septet is raising funds to complete their first ever CD recording, the music of Igor Stravinsky and Esa-Pekka Salonen.  Based on the ensemble Stravinsky created for his masterwork, ""The Soldier's Tale"", Deviant Septet has commissioned over 36 new works since its inception in 2011, and performed all-across the United States.  Deviant Septet is unique among the world's new music collectives, as it is the only ensemble consisting solely of this instrumentation.

Deviant Septet has been hailed as “exciting” (New York Times), a “stylish new ensemble” (New York Magazine), “superb” (Washington Post), “exceedingly fun”, “led by new music veterans” (Time Out New York), “lively and accomplished” (Classical TV: The Drift), and “boisterously entertaining” (Lucid Culture).  WNYC called it “a brand new ensemble with a high concept... made up of top classical and avant garde musicians”, and ran a feature on its debut concert in May 2011.

What We Need & What You Get The challenge is raising enough money to make it a reality.  We're trying to raise $12,000 in this campaign to finance the CD.  The cost for producing this album is a little higher than many CD projects.  For this project, in addition to normal album costs like:
the two works also include royalty, rental, and mechanical license fees in order for us to record them (to the tune of $6,000).
The good news is, since we are a 501 (c)(3) not-for-profit corporation, all of your donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE!!!!!!!
Additionally, we have some really awesome gifts for our donors:
For just $6.66 every member of Deviant Septet will give you an awesome high-five the next time you attend one of our concerts!
For $10 you get a digital download of the album, and an invite to the album release party!
For $25 you get a digital download, a physical copy of the CD, as well as a customized mix CD of Deviant Septet's favorite recordings of Stravinsky pieces.

$50 gets you a custom Deviant Septet tote bag, filled with all the goodies mentioned before (except the digital download, because that would be a weird thing of which to have a physical manifestation, although you do still get that too)!
For $100, you get the tote, the two CD's, the digital download, AND 4 complimentary tickets to a Deviant Septet show in your area!
$250 gets you everything mentioned, plus you can attend a Deviant Septet rehearsal as our special guest.  Come see the way a contemporary classical chamber music group really operates!
For $1,000, as if everything mentioned before wasn't enough, a member of Deviant Septet will give you a private music lesson on your instrument!  WHAT?  Yup!  You'll be a rockstar in NO time!
For $5,000 you get the whole shebang, plus members of Deviant Septet will give you and your friends a private house concert!  Chamber music, in your chamber!
For $10,000 you can have a cameo in our next production of l'Histoire in your area!  Come be a part of the action!  Always wanted to play the Princess?  Now's your chance!
For $50,000 we'll sacrifice a goat in your name.
For $100,000 we'll let you have one night alone with the goat, no questions asked...........
For $666,666.66 you get possession of one Deviant Septet member's soul for 1 full week!  Imagine the possibilities!
For a cool $1,000,000, you get everything mentioned before, and we will totally mention you on Twitter, bro.

If we don't fully reach our goal, we'll use the money to fund as much of the project as we can.  We'll beg, borrow, and steal the rest, because we feel so passionately about sharing this music with the world, that there's no way we aren't making this album!  If we end up raising more funds than we need, the excess will be used to help finance our second album, on New Amsterdam Records, Sleeping Giant's Histories (music by Andrew Norman, Timo Andres, Christopher Cerrone, Ted Hearne, Jacob Cooper, and Robert Honstein) a 2012 co-commission with Carnegie Hall.   How Your Funds Help If you know Deviant Septet, you know it's a group of the country's foremost contemporary classical music interpreters.  If you don't know Deviant, check us OUT! This album represents both the inspiration for our ensemble, and one of the largest works to date written for this instrumentation.  This ain't your grandma's l'Histoire either.  Deviant Septet narrates, and acts all the parts of drama.  Our recording will be more like a radio play than a concert, and like nothing you've ever heard before.  All that, and THEN we rock out on Esa-Pekka's raucous Catch and Release!  We'll use the CD to help presenters all over the world get excited about our music, and help us share Deviant's mission with more people than ever before!  Imagine hearing an album you supported playing on your local classical music station this time next year!  Imagine attending a Deviant Septet concert in your area, because a local concert presenter became excited listening to the unique blend of instruments only Deviant can provide!   The Challenges of Art in the 21st Century We all know that the music industry is changing.  Artists no longer get rich off of their album sales.  Record labels no longer pay for the costs associated with recording albums.  Instead, the albums serve like a press release, to get audiences to attend artists' shows.  Deviant Septet knows that in order to stand out in a crowded field, we need more than just excellence and artistry.  We need YOUR help.  Together we can make a KILLER album that listeners at home, on the internet, and presenters all over the world will absolutely LOVE!   Other Ways to Help Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help!  Spread the word about our campaign on Facebook and Twitter.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.  Tell you friends, coworkers, loved ones, enemies and frenemies.  Tell you neighbor's cousin.  Tweet at a billionaire and ask if they'll join in!
We can't wait to share this album with the world, and we are so excited for your help in making it a reality!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

I am an artist, entrepreneur and father that goes by the MC moniker of Zion I.  I have been independently creating albums for the last 16 years in the underground Hip Hop and indie scenes.  Early on in my career, I found it easier to be signed to a label.  But, as I grew with my art, it became apparent that an indie label was the way to  go, and so I started Mind Over Matter Records, as a way to continue releasing music with full freedom and creative control.

I am starting with Indiegogo as a way to fund my new album “The Labyrinth”.  This is my first crowdsourcing campaign, and I am excited about the ability to connect more intimately with listeners who have been with me since the beginning of my musical journey. In the past, I have depended on label or distributor advances to fund my projects.  Yet, this time around, my distributor would not advance me enough capital to actually get the album off the ground.  I felt stressed about the idea of coming straight out of my pocket for the investment with no safety net.  As you can imagine a campaign to create, manufacture, market and promote an album can skyrocket quickly.  Then, I began having conversations with my friends who had done crowd funded projects successfully, and the clouds started to part in my mind.  This was not a hurdle but actually a blessing in disguise.
By coming directly to you, those who truly feel the music, I would be strengthening my bond with those who allowed me to achieve my success in the first place.  Times have definitely changed in the space of Hip Hop, but I will not stop my mission to bring you feel good music that takes into account our spiritual and emotional well being as listeners.  Thank you for support over all these years, and for helping me to live my dream!

Those who support will help me to mix and master this album, using the incredible talents of Jason Moss (who has worked on every Zion I album by the way).  It will also create merchandise: tees, hats, jackets, vinyl, and cd’s.
One of my main goals is to really bring you great video content to match the music.  Your support will allow me to tap the innovative film talent that lurks in the Bay Area, and present my sonic ideas on a higher level visually.  Finally, you will enable me to hire my trusted publicist (Ballin PR), my radio promoter (Co-Sign) and make sure that this album has a chance to cut across the wide expanse of white noise that constantly radiates from the music industry.
Even if I don’t reach my full goal, any support that you give me will still go towards these goals!
The Labyrinth is my vision of the healing energy that music in general, and Hip Hop specifically can have in the world.  I know that most people don’t think of our culture that way, but I do.

Creating this album helped me to deal with the loss of my father late last year.  Without the ability to write out my feelings and channel them, I’m not sure where I would be right now.  This music can truly transform lives for the better.  I am the perfect example of it.

In addition to losing my father, my partner in the group Amp Live also left last year. Many of you old school listeners will recall your first time seeing us on stage.  However, things change and people grow, and I had to evolve into being able to handle the whole weight when he decided to move on.  It hasn’t been easy.  But, I have discovered a stronger force and presence within myself from being challenged to carry on by myself.  I have always written my lyrics, nothing will change in that way.  However, for production, I had to scour thru countless producers and zip files to connect with the handful of young talent that you will hear on the record.  I am very proud of what these producers were able to do for the sound of the Labyrinth.

I’ve been running my own label since Zion I’s 2nd album “Deep Water Slang” which dropped in 2003.  Since then, it’s been imperative to me to control and operate my own company so that the music is delivered in a genuine and sincere way.  With so many changes in technology, the sustainability of a career in music has changed dramatically.  Records do not sell like they once did, because of streaming practices.  Everyone has to tour extensively these days in order to make a living.  This is difficult for me now, for as a father of three, I crave to be home with my young ones, guiding their lives with loving intent.  This is honestly the hardest part about being an artist, leaving my family.  It is my hope that I can find a balance with this crowdsourcing format so that I can continue to give you my heart, blood, sweat and tears thru my music.

Thank you for taking the time to even consider getting involved.  This is a very personal moment for me, and I would ask that even if you can’t participate monetarily that you spread the good word if you have ever felt a Zion I track before.

_____________________________________________________________

What is Welcome 2 My House?

 

In a day and age of repetitive radio playlists, fewer music labels and clubs,  Welcome 2 my House, is a live streamed  music  show  created by 2 time Emmy award winner Katreese Barnes(www.katreese.com) and currently filmed in her living room. It's designed to be  another vehicle to feature  today’s classic music artists  in all genres. Some of the artists already featured are Tony Terry, October London, Valerie Simpson, Victoria Canal, Peter Collins &
column2:
Will Gittens(http://welcome2myhouse.co)

 

 

The Welcome 2 My House Mission

 

One of the goals of ""Welcome 2 My House"" is to surprise someone  with their favorite artist singing their favorite song in ""their""  living room. We will be searching for people who have recently  faced a  life challenge and could use  a memorable uplifting moment with the healing power of music. Each artist will be backed up by Katreese and her band, ChamberFusic, a string quartet, piano, bass and percussions.
In today's fast  growing social media , Welcome 2 My House, is also going to be a spotlight for up and coming talent as well as established artists we haven't seen in a while. A place to give more recognition to the songwriters, their songs and emphasize the need for audiences to purchase (not just stream) their work.

 

 

What Your Donation Will Do

 

Your donations will help pay for musicians, engineers, tech directors, camera operators,  improved equipment, production costs and promotion for 10 new episodes.

 

More and more musical artists are finding it’s difficult to launch or support their projects in this digital age. Your support helps support a show that is dedicated to find the best of today’s original music writers from all genres.  Our motto is “We’re Gonna Keep the Music Alive, One Living Room At A Time”.

column1: If you can't donate to our campaign, please consider sharing it via email, facebook, twitter or any of the other social media outlets.

This album is part of a dream come true, now manifesting with a LOT of amazing help. It’s the culmination of a process that began in late 2014, when I got very clear in my intention of taking songwriting and performing, my greatest joy, from the periphery to the center of my life. Very shortly thereafter, things you might call “miracles” began to occur, opening a way forward. Earlier this year, through a mutual friend, I met Bil Vorndick, an uber-talented, Grammy-winning producer who has been guiding and mentoring me, and who heard enough in my songs to continue that process.

Now we are moving forward with this, my third album – and a truly unique opportunity to give these songs the kind of quality production and exposure they deserve, and which I could not provide on my own. In today’s dramatically changing market, however, that still generally means a self-funded project. My partner and I are working hard and pulling together what we can, but a sizeable margin remains between what we HAVE and what we NEED to see this through to completion, and we need your help to close that gap. Every last dime contributed will be applied toward paying these fabulous musicians, the studio, the mixing and mastering, graphics, CD duplication and so on.

In exchange for your support, at whatever level feels comfortable, there are assorted “goodies” – from pictures to signed CD’s and other cool stuff. The timelines for delivery dates on these offerings are approximate, based on an estimated date of completion. But each and every pledge will be honored as close to the dates given as is humanly possible.

Those of you who know me also know I’m a passionate advocate for social and environmental causes. One of my goals has always been to integrate the ideas that I care deeply about into my music in a way that can inspire positive change - not by preaching or judging but by celebrating the things we value and creating a world that works for everyone. If you believe, as I do, that music can be a vehicle not only for cool stories, good times and hip grooves but for inspiration and real social change, please help me in creating and manifesting that vision in a bigger way, in a way that can serve more people and the greater good.
Thanks for taking the time to check out my campaign. Now let’s go make some GREAT MUSIC!!

column2: >Existant depuis 4 ans, la chorale Saint-Albert permet à des enfants qui aiment chanter de développer leur talent et de se produire devant un public. Accessible à tous les budgets, cette activité développe l'estime personnel, l'esprit d'équipe et la discipline d'enfants qui, pour certains, ne pourraient la développer au sein d'une activité plus coûteuse.
column3: >De l'Impérial au Centre Vidéotron en passant par différentes salles ou les jeunes ont chantés dans le cadre de fêtes de Noël ou de fins d'années, les petits chanteurs et les petites chanteuses de la chorale Saint-Albert ont vécu différentes expériences à ce jour. Voilà qu'une occasion unique et grandiose leurs est offerte, chanter au Centre Bell en compagnie de milliers d'autres choristes et sous la supervision de Grégory Charles et Marc Hervieux!
column4: >Cette merveilleuse chance est le fruit du travail acharné des jeunes et de la fondatrice de la chorale, Renée Claude Hébert, qui ne compte pas les heures afin d'offrir aux enfants différentes occasions comme celle-ci.
column5: >En tant que maman d'une petite fille à qui la chorale fait un bien immense, il me fait extrêmement plaisir de soutenir les efforts des jeunes et de Renée-Claude en récoltant des fonds en ligne afin que le transport de Québec à Montréal se fasse le plus simplement et joyeusement possible.
column6: >La journée sera formidable, mais aussi longue et éreintante, bénéficiez d'un transport en autobus faciliterait la vie de tous et toutes et ferait en sorte que nos souvenirs seront sans taches et magnifiques. Nous avons jusqu'au 15 novembre pour trouver les fonds nécessaires!
column7: >Nous souhaitons amasser 1000$, mais advenant le cas ou nous récolterions davantage, l'argent servirait à permettre aux parents qui ne peuvent pas se payer de billets de venir assister au spectacle et à nous permettre d'autres projets du genre.
column8: >N'hésitez pas à parler de notre beau projet, à nous soutenir de toutes les façons possibles et à encourager ces jeunes dans la réalisation de leur rêve pour certains, d'un chouette projet pour d'autres.
column9: >À SES ENFANTS, IL FAUT DONNER DES RACINES ET DES AILES, AIDEZ NOUS À EN DONNER AUX PETITS CHANTEURS ET AUX PETITES CHANTEUSES DE LA CHORALE SAINT-ALBERT.
column10:
>MERCI!!!

 

 

","Existant depuis 4 ans, la chorale Saint-Albert permet à des enfants qui aiment chanter de développer leur talent et de se produire devant un public. Accessible à tous les budgets, cette activité développe l'estime personnel, l'esprit d'équipe et la discipline d'enfants qui, pour certains, ne pourraient la développer au sein d'une activité plus coûteuse. De l'Impérial au Centre Vidéotron en passant par différentes salles ou les jeunes ont chantés dans le cadre de fêtes de Noël ou de fins d'années, les petits chanteurs et les petites chanteuses de la chorale Saint-Albert ont vécu différentes expériences à ce jour. Voilà qu'une occasion unique et grandiose leurs est offerte, chanter au Centre Bell en compagnie de milliers d'autres choristes et sous la supervision de Grégory Charles et Marc Hervieux!Cette merveilleuse chance est le fruit du travail acharné des jeunes et de la fondatrice de la chorale, Renée Claude Hébert, qui ne compte pas les heures afin d'offrir aux enfants différentes occasions comme celle-ci.En tant que maman d'une petite fille à qui la chorale fait un bien immense, il me fait extrêmement plaisir de soutenir les efforts des jeunes et de Renée-Claude en récoltant des fonds en ligne afin que le transport de Québec à Montréal se fasse le plus simplement et joyeusement possible.  La journée sera formidable, mais aussi longue et éreintante, bénéficiez d'un transport en autobus faciliterait la vie de tous et toutes et ferait en sorte que nos souvenirs seront sans taches et magnifiques. Nous avons jusqu'au 15 novembre pour trouver les fonds nécessaires!Nous souhaitons amasser 1000$, mais advenant le cas ou nous récolterions davantage, l'argent servirait à permettre aux parents qui ne peuvent pas se payer de billets de venir assister au spectacle et à nous permettre d'autres projets du genre.N'hésitez pas à parler de notre beau projet, à nous soutenir de toutes les façons possibles et à encourager ces jeunes dans la réalisation de leur rêve pour certains, d'un chouette projet pour d'autres.  À SES ENFANTS, IL FAUT DONNER DES RACINES ET DES AILES, AIDEZ NOUS À EN DONNER AUX PETITS CHANTEURS ET AUX PETITES CHANTEUSES DE LA CHORALE SAINT-ALBERT.MERCI!!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: We are ARTESYN, a metalcore band out of Mesa, AZ! We love music and what we do, it's our number one passion. We have been together now for just over a year.
Our band members include Wyatt Nelson - vocalist, Luis Peralta - guitar, Sean Donnelly - drums, Keith Morgan - guitar, Wyatt Irvin - Bass.

We just played our debut show October 2, 2015 and it was amazing! we had great turnout (around 100 fans) just for our set. We played at battle of the bands for Knotfest. As a direct result of this show we scored a record label deal with, ""From the depths Entertainment"" as well as a sponsorship from, ""Coldcock Whiskey""! (see sponsorship photo).

Above all we are down to earth, hard working young men who just need a little help reaching our goals! All funds will go towards a great running van that we can tour with, even if we do not reach our goal, anything will help tremendously. Thanks for checking us out! Rock on!

Radio Galaksy -the story

Radio Galaksy is originated around the idea of creating instrumental music that could easily be in a movie. Somewhere in between Bill Frisell and Pink Floyd. 

Plus something else.

That's the reason composer, producer and drummer Søren Jensen (DK) decided to contact Bill Frisell's bass player Viktor Krauss (US), to see if an album was realistic. And so it evolved. 

With the unique sound from Aske Jacoby's (DK) delicate, spacious and wild guitar playing and Christoffer Jespersen's (DK) tasty and playful keyboard scores, the core of the band is built.
column3:
>How you can help us achieve our goal

Your contribution WILL matter a great deal: all tracks are recorded and the mixes are almost done. But we still need your help to master the album and to press the vinyls.
column4: >The amount we are aiming for is $1500, and every donation will hit its target.
column5: >This music has to come out and meet its audience. It's taken two years to come this far.
column7: >Many other contributions have been a great help along the way.
column8: >Thomas Strate: co-producer, mixer and recording engineer at Dusty Goat Studio
column10:
>Marcus Toft: recording engineer

Lis Wessberg: trombone

Jakob Dahn and Sara Broberg: vocals

Camilla Bannebjerre Nielsen: cover artwork

Also please check out www.radiogalaksy.com


","Radio Galaksy -the story Radio Galaksy is originated around the idea of creating instrumental music that could easily be in a movie. Somewhere in between Bill Frisell and Pink Floyd. Plus something else.That's the reason composer, producer and drummer Søren Jensen (DK) decided to contact Bill Frisell's bass player Viktor Krauss (US), to see if an album was realistic. And so it evolved. With the unique sound from Aske Jacoby's (DK) delicate, spacious and wild guitar playing and Christoffer Jespersen's (DK) tasty and playful keyboard scores, the core of the band is built.How you can help us achieve our goalYour contribution WILL matter a great deal: all tracks are recorded and the mixes are almost done. But we still need your help to master the album and to press the vinyls. The amount we are aiming for is $1500, and every donation will hit its target.This music has to come out and meet its audience. It's taken two years to come this far.Thanks:Many other contributions have been a great help along the way.Thomas Strate: co-producer, mixer and recording engineer at Dusty Goat StudioTeis Frandsen: masteringMarcus Toft: recording engineerLis Wessberg: tromboneJakob Dahn and Sara Broberg: vocalsCamilla Bannebjerre Nielsen: cover artworkAlso please check out www.radiogalaksy.com",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1:
When: SUNDAY APRIL 3rd 2016
Location: Hovea Falls, John Forrest National Park
Dress Code: Viking/Warrior
Weapons: Essential. Larp and Authentic (Armourer on site!)
Background - Why We Are Doing This/Why Now

We have always had a killer stage show - (not to say the best sound as we are often quite drunk when we play) but we like to put on a viking war feast. We know we are in Australia and we give zero fucks about that fact - we love Norse Mythology and we love the sounds that conjures up in our imagination. We like our shows to look and feel like a battle, or a triumph or a passage to Valhalla - and we'd like our video clips to feel the same.

Our 'Thunder' guitarist -Simon works in the film/TV industry and has been experimenting with new technology - 360 Video.  It is quite new however YouTube and Facebook have implemented the ability to play it and we want to give it a go.
We've looked around and haven't really seen anything like this in this space so we'd like strike hard and fast and make something new and interesting.

We'd like our viking horde to be a part of the show so we've cooked up this idea. The following is a summary of our idea and if you like what you hear, or would like any of our 'Perk Rewards' even if you cannot be here in person please engage with the campaign - or if not - just give it a share!  Every little bit will help.

Short Summary

We are currently working on a new album and would like to create a brand new type of music video with your help.  We are a viking metal band so we like big battles and fancy dress! Oh, and weapons.. we love weapons so naturally we would like to have a grand scale battle and film it all to our new track entitled 'Gleipnir'  

  • We are Wrath of Fenrir - a viking metal band from Perth, Western Australia.
• We are fully aware of how ridiculous that is.
• WE WANT YOU. To grow a beard where possible and gather your weapons to charge into battle on our 360 battlefield to the tune of some sweet sweet war tunes.
• Campaign rewards are available to all fans - if you can't make it we can send the Perk to you - please select the international version of your desired Perk!

We feel like this video will be first of it's kind so make sure you get involved and donate/claim rewards at any tier - it all helps!

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Why we are launching a funding campaign:

  • When we were kids Iron Maiden always had the best goddamn shit - best shirts, best stages, best merch... tea cups to computer games and all in between. In addition to the Viking music we like to play we want to bring all that cool shit in as part of the Wrath of Fenrir experience.
  • As a reward for helping us fund this rather ambitious plan we have a bunch of cool stuff at multiple financial levels - for the fan that wants to give a little something, right up to the fan that want's to give (and in turn, receive) a lot.

column1: • We're working on making the packages real bang for your buck! So have a look at our one offs.

The Budget

We are using the budget purely on the equipment needed to film the clip such as the 360 Camera, essential bits like a generator, smoke machines etc. and to feed and water the horde on the day:

  • Your contribution will help us fund the track, but also help reward everyone involved in this project with a better final product.
• We vikings have a saying 'A rising tide lifts all ships'  - we have the skills necessary  to make this dream a reality and have a blast with our fans in the process.
• We want to make cool shit to give to our fans - these funds and pre-orders help make that possible!

We are a solid team and by working together we are sure we can achieve this goal. With all cutting edge technologies we are sure there will be hurdles. By working together in a solution oriented way we would like to foresee and adjust the ship to overcome this.

  • We have never done this before.
• Let's give it a damn good go.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and like and share this campaign - hopefully it lands in front of as many people that would love this as possible!
• Share via Indiegogo, Facebook etc. and encourage people to get in touch!!

CHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGE!!!!


* Please note - we are raising in US dollars to enable users to use
credit cards, Apple Pay and Direct Deposit - these options are not

available on Indiegogo in AUD's -seriously! Google it! =D*

Short Summary

Thanks for taking the time to read about this project! Zonnis is Victoria's hottest and hardest-working musical duo, and they're bringing you a new album. ""Rise of the Sheep"" is an eleven-song collection of original music that will tickle your ears and stimulate your soul. Inspired by their travels and musical exploits over the past few years, ""Rise of the Sheep"" is a healthy mix of Canadian folk, roots and rock, sprinkled with a light dusting of musical theater and off-beat humor, and bound together with a message of peace, love and good times. Produced by award-winning producer and musician Barry Mathers and featuring a great line-up of guest musicians, ""Rise of the Sheep"" is set to launch Zonnis into the next phase of their exciting and ever-expanding musical careers. Let that party start!

Recording and album is expensive! From studio time to mixing to session musicians, the costs can add up quickly. While the entire cost of the album will total around $7000, as well as a publicity budget of $3500, we are setting a realistic goal of $3000 to help supplement the cost. This will include recording, mixing, mastering and physical production.

Folks who choose to support our cause will know that they are helping us to follow our dreams and bring our music to the world. Some of the perks that we are offering include autographed advance copies of our album, private performances at a venue of your choosing, as well as our one and only touring van!

For the last couple years, Zonnis has been steadily breaking into the Western Canadian music scene, including various festival appearances and live performances on community radio stations. It has become obvious to us that we are getting the attention we need, and it's time to give the fans a fantastic record that they can take home with them.

As manager and publicist of his previous musical projects, Adam Zonnis has successfully charted his music on many college and community stations, as well as receiving regular rotation on Victoria's The Zone 91.3. With his experience combined with Andrea's flair for branding and design, this album is sure the bring Zonnis to the forefront of the Canadian roots music scene.

Other Ways You Can Help

Throw a house concert! We tour regularly, and have found that house concerts are one of our preferred venues in which to perform. Nothing beats the relaxed, intimate environment of a good friend's living room, and we have found that it's a way to bring our music to small towns that may not have access to a suitable venue.

Short Summary

As many of you know Heart Avail has worked very hard to make a name for themselves.From concerts, to radio interviews to local band support and charity events, Heart Avail has been there.  This year we teamed up with Kim K. Jones and her team to further our musical career. Greg Hanson and Aleisha Simpson have been accepted to play an acoustic set at the concert series in Park City, Utah during the Sundance Film Festival. This is the first of many opportunities open to us and we are ready to take the next step on our musical journey. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

With all good things comes a demand for funds. In order to reach the next level we need your help! We would like to get in the studio to release a 3 song EP as well as get our newest song Broken Fairytale on national radio before we head to Sundance. We will also be creating special shirts to bring with us and need funds for travel. But this can be easy, I promise and it wont hurt your pocket book. If each of our 5600 fans donated at least one dollar we will reach our goal! We are also offering some cool gifts including our first official studio release cd as well as sponsorship opportunities!

column1:
The Impact

We rely solely on our fans to build our reputation! We would love to be heard on the radio and be able to say each and every one of you contributed to making this happen! We also have an opportunity to tour with a major band which means we can put our town on the map.We will be putting each sponsor on the back of our shirts at Sundance so your logo will be seen by over 46,000 people. The impact of your help is huge, and we thank you in advance!

column2:
Challenges

Our biggest challenge right now is trying to get out of Spokane and get our music heard globally. At this level the price is high but we believe the pay off will be well worth it. Giving up one latte for a day can go a long way in helping us reach our goal!

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant donate that's totally ok! We understand that funds are tight and you may want to support us but just cant put forth the funds. All we ask is that you help promote our campaign and show your support! If you know someone who may love us, pass this campain along, share our website, or just give us a thumbs up that you believe in us!

Summary

We are Aire Alistair (pronounced air alice-stair) - an alt-pop-indie-rock band from Cincinnati made up of three musicians who love their craft.  For those of you who know either Brent, Nate, or Abbie you're probably well aware of our affinity for music and you might have heard us talk about our newest musical adventure.  Combined we've been making music for a long time and Aire Alistair blends the sensibilities of Brent's melodic writing and production work with Nate's solid drumming and Abbie's unique violin sound.  Brent's been writing songs for this album for a year and a half and we're currently working very hard on rebranding, rehearsing, and recording.  This is where you come in!

We not only need your help but we want to bring you along for the journey of remixing, and re-recording some parts on a full length album that we'll release in January of 2016.  We've given away 13 songs over the course of a year or so to you lovely people and now we're boiling those tracks down to the top 10 to breathe some new life in and add some general professional polish.  Then we'll replicate them on CD and do a celebratory album release concert at the Southgate House Revival in Newport, KY on January 22th of 2016.  Even though that seems far away, we actually need your help right now.

You are essential to making this record happen!  Aire Alistair needs more than just fans, we need some passionate friends, family, and fans to create momentum and carry this unique music into the new year.  The songs are already written (you've probably heard them on the free EPs) and are being arranged and we've loved sharing the demo-quality tunes with you this past year but it's time to make something a bit more epic and we want you to join us on the journey.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We need about $2,500 for this Indiegogo campaign.  You'll get some phenomenal perks to join us in the process too that you can see outlined in the ""Perks"" section on the right.  We've tried to consider both budget-aware and overly-beneficent giving.  We'd love for many of you to look at this as a wonderful way to pre-order the full-length CD.  If you can do more - awesome!  We need several generous people to go above and beyond.  We're doing this record on a shoestring budget compared to even other independent bands who'll spend 40-50k on one album.  Keep in mind our costs aren't even factoring in a full knowledge of perks like T-shirts, stickers, etc. We're not even budgeting for much in the area of marketing or advertising to launch.
column5:
>The Impact

In a world of digital streaming and online guerilla marketing it's important that we go ""old-school"" by making a physical CD.  By making a tangible album it gives you - the fans and family - who want a tactile experience something to literally hold on to.  It will also give Aire Alistair something to differentiate us from other bands when we give albums out to industry people in ""high places"".  Nothing can replicate the feeling of an actual CD in your hand with compelling artwork and imagery to go along with it.  (We would go even more ""old-school"" with a vinyl pressing too if we could.)

Inviting all of you to a massive album release party will be such a great way to celebrate the music and our friendship and bring these songs into a live, high-energy environment.  This will give us the opportunity to play more live concert dates in 2016. 

Risks &
column6:
Challenges

Without additional funds we'll keep moving forward with the vision of Aire Alistair but it'll be significantly harder.  The challenge is this - this should happen now because the timing is right, the band is in place, the songs are written, and the stars are aligned.

column1: • Despite decent songwriting and arranging, without professionally mixed and mastered songs we won't be taken seriously outside of family and friends when trying to gain a broader audience.
• If we don't have music ready for streaming, or licensing it's more difficult to get song placements for TV and film.

• If we don't raise the amount of money we're asking for we will press on!  We'll probably eliminate some of the marketing and brand building costs and rely heavily on word-of-mouth and friend to friend sharing and build our brand slowly over the next year.  This will be especially difficult but we'll press through.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Here are some ways you can dive in and be part of the Aire Alistair family...
• Listen to what we've already done online and get excited.  www.airealistair.com
• Follow us on FB, Twitter, and Instagram - like, share, and repost.
• Make some noise about our campaign by sharing a link to this Indiegogo page by using the super simple Indiegogo share tools listed above.
• The digital world on social streams can be a bit sterile.  Tell friends about us in person and maybe even share with us face-to-face that you're excited for this project.
Let's do this together.  Thanks everybody! - Brent, Nate, &
column2:
Abbie - ""Aire Alistair""

Photography by &
column3:
designed in partnership with our friends at Fieldhouse Collective

P.S.  Check out this latest ""Field Sessions"" video by our friends at Fieldhouse Collective.  They've been huge advocates and a big help in dreaming up our Indiegogo campaign and adding some phenomenal content.

column7: >Hi my name is Danny Green, my musical project is called Laish. I have loved writing songs and recording them since I first picked up a guitar at the age of 13.

column1: When I moved to Brighton in 2007, I settled on 'Laish', this strange exotic word, pronounced ""lie-shh"", that means 'The tribe of Dan', a name that would signify my music from now on.

As Laish I have released two albums which were very kindly received by reviewers and my supporters. I love to travel and share my songs and connect with rooms of people. I have played shows in places like Germany, Italy, Switzerland, India and Israel.  In the UK I have toured endlessly both solo and with a full band and performed in some of the most prestigious venues, including The Roundhouse, Barbican, Union Chapel and Kings Place and at some incredible festivals like End of The Road and Cambridge Folk.

I feel very lucky to have got this far. I have done it off my own steam with no management or label backing. But in order to finish this new batch of recordings and get them released, there are many costs to consider.

Studio Costs. I have written my best songs so far and I want them to be presented as high quality and exciting recordings that you will love. I am recording at Watchtower Studios in North London with an excellent producer, Dave Gerard, who I love working with.
Promotion. To release the music properly and to grow my existing fan base, I will need the support of a press and radio campaign.
Music Videos. I have made some awesome music videos which you're going to see very soon.
Manufacture. I plan to press gorgeous-looking cds and for the first time, vinyl.
A lot of this work has already been done, but at this point I could do with some assistance to get it completed.
I have finished four new tracks which you can receive before anyone else by supporting, and you will get the album once it is ready.

column4: >Song for Everything EP featuring four new songs as a download
>An album of 14 cover songs recorded by Laish since 2008.

column7: > access to my updates which will be exclusive blogs, vlogs, live takes of songs, demo tracks, and a first look at my new music videos.

column1: There are many exciting perks which you can see on your right.

I love drawing and I had the idea of making hand drawn cd covers while on tour in Italy, sketching on plain white cardboard sleeves pictures of faces, animals, shapes and pretty much anything. You can request what you would like me to draw. Here's some previous examples. I can't wait to do these for you!
I need a minimum of £10000 to complete the album and have it released with a press campaign.  The more money I can raise, the more I can invest in promoting the release.
Recording and mixing at Watchtower Studios of 14 songs, £2500
Vinyl manufacture x 300,

Reaching this goal means that all of this work can happen at a professional level. 

The Impact

I feel this is the best album I have made.  I think you're going to love it.  The songs are honest, heartfelt and the best out of a huge crop written over the last three years. The production is clear, crisp and satisfying and I have found the best musicians to work with. The recording is so far going amazingly well and I feel this is the album that can help propel my career to the stage of being able to tour the UK with a full band, achieving prominent festival performances and attracting the attention of industry cheerleaders like top level mangers and record labels.
21 April, Sebright Arms, London - Laish EP launch, full band headline show - tickets
Here is my cast who are helping this project come to light:
Danny Green - songs, guitars, vocals, production, project manager
Ruth Pickett - Indiegogo and music video production
James Ockelford at Refold Design - cd and vinyl template
Ollie McCormack at Top Button Digital - press agent
Huge thanks to the many people who have helped with their ears, eyes and giving feedback. Special mention to Rory Dickenson, Hal Branson and the family Green.

It all helps!

Contributions both large and small will help make this project happen. Word of mouth can be the most effective tool so any help with spreading with word is much appreciated.  Talk about it, social media it.  Use the indiegogo share tools.
Hi my name is Danny Green, my musical project is called Laish. I have loved writing songs and recording them since I first picked up a guitar at the age of 13.
When I moved to Brighton in 2007, I settled on 'Laish', this strange exotic word, pronounced ""lie-shh"", that means 'The tribe of Dan', a name that would signify my music from now on.

As Laish I have released two albums which were very kindly received by reviewers and my supporters. I love to travel and share my songs and connect with rooms of people. I have played shows in places like Germany, Italy, Switzerland, India and Israel.  In the UK I have toured endlessly both solo and with a full band and performed in some of the most prestigious venues, including The Roundhouse, Barbican, Union Chapel and Kings Place and at some incredible festivals like End of The Road and Cambridge Folk.

I feel very lucky to have got this far. I have done it off my own steam with no management or label backing. But in order to finish this new batch of recordings and get them released, there are many costs to consider.

Studio Costs. I have written my best songs so far and I want them to be presented as high quality and exciting recordings that you will love. I am recording at Watchtower Studios in North London with an excellent producer, Dave Gerard, who I love working with.
Promotion. To release the music properly and to grow my existing fan base, I will need the support of a press and radio campaign.
Music Videos. I have made some awesome music videos which you're going to see very soon.
Manufacture. I plan to press gorgeous-looking cds and for the first time, vinyl.
A lot of this work has already been done, but at this point I could do with some assistance to get it completed.
I have finished four new tracks which you can receive before anyone else by supporting, and you will get the album once it is ready.
By supporting you will get straightaway:
Song for Everything EP featuring four new songs as a download
An album of 14 cover songs recorded by Laish since 2008.
Plus you access to my updates which will be exclusive blogs, vlogs, live takes of songs, demo tracks, and a first look at my new music videos.
There are many exciting perks which you can see on your right.

I love drawing and I had the idea of making hand drawn cd covers while on tour in Italy, sketching on plain white cardboard sleeves pictures of faces, animals, shapes and pretty much anything. You can request what you would like me to draw. Here's some previous examples. I can't wait to do these for you!
I need a minimum of £10000 to complete the album and have it released with a press campaign.  The more money I can raise, the more I can invest in promoting the release.
Recording and mixing at Watchtower Studios of 14 songs, £2500
Digital press campaign over two periods, £2400
Reaching this goal means that all of this work can happen at a professional level.    The Impact

I feel this is the best album I have made.  I think you're going to love it.  The songs are honest, heartfelt and the best out of a huge crop written over the last three years. The production is clear, crisp and satisfying and I have found the best musicians to work with. The recording is so far going amazingly well and I feel this is the album that can help propel my career to the stage of being able to tour the UK with a full band, achieving prominent festival performances and attracting the attention of industry cheerleaders like top level mangers and record labels.
