My name is Benjamin Cressall. I've been playing music for over 10 years. And in the more recent years I've been working on writing songs. Not just for the sake or writing songs, but to write songs that are personal and have meaning to me. And also that really love to play. So thats why I've decided to make this small album.
Love is something everyone experiences. Whether its between a man and women, between a family and also friends. But it's also something that has caused pain, bitterness, hurt and even hate.
So this is a collection of songs that are exactly that, stories of hurt, longing, redemption, hope, and of course love.

column2: >If you asked me a couple months or even years ago if I wanted to record some of my music my answer would've been yes. The reason I've decided to actually take the leap and record my songs now is for a couple reasons.

column1: It's a pretty simple answer. I've been playing music for over 10 years now. Studied with Berklee College of Music. I love what music does, how it moves people and inspires people. I don't know what my life would be like without music.

I love a good challenge. It stretches me and is a place where I can grow. I have to open and vulnerable, which isn't always easy. But you get to see some pretty amazing things come from those challenges and nobody wants to regret never taking the chance.

Really, why not? What difference does it make. Recording and EP is and will most likely never be a cheap thing to do. Especially if you are like me and are really picky about how you like things to sound and will never be satisfied if you trying doing it by yourself. So I am doing it now, because why not?

Below is the budget I made to see how much I would need to raise to make this EP become a reality. I've also decided to include the prices for the CD Release Show. Because I would love for all my supporters to be able to come out and hear/see what they helped create.

If my goal isn't reached my funds first and foremost will be to pay for the recording and for the musicians because without them I won't have anything to give people. After that it will go to indiegogo fees, getting everyone their rewards and the shipping costs of different items.

The Impact

I'll be honest I'm not a rich man. I'm a missionary/non-profit worker. So I don't get paid. I live off the support of people like you. Friends and Family. This album isn't going to be something I'll be able to live off of for sure. But my hope is that it will help me enjoy the smaller things in life. Also that who ever listens to the album will be able to enjoy the moments they have while listening to it.

I also hope that the stories and messages of the songs are ones that people can relate to. Ones that can help them through hard times, or, enjoy the good times. So if my songs can have an impact. I want people to be able to hear them.

column2:
Challenges

There will probably be some challenges I can see running into in the making of this album would be time. The fact that the studio is located in a really big house, with lots of people in it, with students in classes during the day and babies sleeping in the evening. Being loud isn't always allowed/appropriate.

column1: As I've been talking with my friend who is helping produce the EP. We are talking about doing some of the recording else where. Allowing us to record some of the loud instruments when we want and for however long we need to.
If you aren't able to help out financially. I understand. If you still want  to contribute in another way. Sharing via social media is always a huge help. Just let your friends know about it.
If you have ideas or questions about how you can help out feel free to contact me via e-mail or through social media.

I would be very, very grateful!
","Short Summary

My name is Benjamin Cressall. I've been playing music for over 10 years. And in the more recent years I've been working on writing songs. Not just for the sake or writing songs, but to write songs that are personal and have meaning to me. And also that really love to play. So thats why I've decided to make this small album.
Love is something everyone experiences. Whether its between a man and women, between a family and also friends. But it's also something that has caused pain, bitterness, hurt and even hate.
So this is a collection of songs that are exactly that, stories of hurt, longing, redemption, hope, and of course love.

If you asked me a couple months or even years ago if I wanted to record some of my music my answer would've been yes. The reason I've decided to actually take the leap and record my songs now is for a couple reasons.

It's a pretty simple answer. I've been playing music for over 10 years now. Studied with Berklee College of Music. I love what music does, how it moves people and inspires people. I don't know what my life would be like without music.

I love a good challenge. It stretches me and is a place where I can grow. I have to open and vulnerable, which isn't always easy. But you get to see some pretty amazing things come from those challenges and nobody wants to regret never taking the chance.

Really, why not? What difference does it make. Recording and EP is and will most likely never be a cheap thing to do. Especially if you are like me and are really picky about how you like things to sound and will never be satisfied if you trying doing it by yourself. So I am doing it now, because why not?
What I Need & What You Get

Below is the budget I made to see how much I would need to raise to make this EP become a reality. I've also decided to include the prices for the CD Release Show. Because I would love for all my supporters to be able to come out and hear/see what they helped create.

If my goal isn't reached my funds first and foremost will be to pay for the recording and for the musicians because without them I won't have anything to give people. After that it will go to indiegogo fees, getting everyone their rewards and the shipping costs of different items.

The Impact I'll be honest I'm not a rich man. I'm a missionary/non-profit worker. So I don't get paid. I live off the support of people like you. Friends and Family. This album isn't going to be something I'll be able to live off of for sure. But my hope is that it will help me enjoy the smaller things in life. Also that who ever listens to the album will be able to enjoy the moments they have while listening to it.

I also hope that the stories and messages of the songs are ones that people can relate to. Ones that can help them through hard times, or, enjoy the good times. So if my songs can have an impact. I want people to be able to hear them.

Risks & Challenges There will probably be some challenges I can see running into in the making of this album would be time. The fact that the studio is located in a really big house, with lots of people in it, with students in classes during the day and babies sleeping in the evening. Being loud isn't always allowed/appropriate.

As I've been talking with my friend who is helping produce the EP. We are talking about doing some of the recording else where. Allowing us to record some of the loud instruments when we want and for however long we need to.
If you aren't able to help out financially. I understand. If you still want  to contribute in another way. Sharing via social media is always a huge help. Just let your friends know about it.
If you have ideas or questions about how you can help out feel free to contact me via e-mail or through social media.
I would be very, very grateful!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

WHY I NEED YOU NOW!

I'm Billy Lord... I'm sort of a ""Rocky"" story for the unemployed... I lost my job and my ""American Dream"" in 2009, and found my true calling, a year later, in music. A relative newcomer to writing, singing and playing, I set out on a motorcycle with a guitar strapped to my back, and played my way across the country, writing songs for an album, funded by a 2013 Indiegogo campaign, that was released in May 2015.

 

That album, National Anthem, sparked a powder keg of a year in 2015. The single, Steal the Evening Sky broke into the Top 40 on the Country Charts (New Music Weekly) and spent four consecutive weeks at #1 on The Iceman's Top 40 New Country Artist Chart. The album has been selected for Grammy nomination consideration in three categories. And, buzz from the album has secured headlining shows across the country as well as opening slots for several major headlining acts to be announced soon.

In July, I was hand selected as one of the flagship artists for Nashville's Smokeshow Entertainment. With Smokeshow's recording, booking and marketing reach, I made the decision to move to Nashville and jump head first into the deep waters of the Nashville music scene. An incredible group of musicians, all from the RI, Massachusetts area, have committed to take this leap with me, and we are prepared to work hard on developing the songs for the new album and becoming the best live band in Nashville, and then the country.

With two stadium shows already booked and two demos for the new album already done, there is buzz throughout the industry  that a breakthrough is imminent. We just need one big push to get us across the finish line... That's where you, the believers since day one, come in to help one last time. Let's lift off. To the moon and back...

WHAT WE NEED... WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO

- The Album!!! With 18 songs already written for the new album, one of Nashville's most respected producers booked, studio time booked on Music Row and the nation's best session musicians who have played on all the top hit  country albums released over the past few years booked, I need the money to make this album my breakthrough album . This is an expense where we absolutely cannot cut costs as we have in the past, where we've made good recordings, but not amazing recordings... the kind that will get us the radio play we need to support our touring efforts and take us to the top. We estimate studio costs at a minimum of $20,000 and likely more,so let's shoot to exceed our goal! $20,000

THE IMPACT

 The impact of your donation is ENORMOUS. I believe... and so do those in the know..., that your donation can make a dream come true. Priceless. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

 I've known the odds since day one, just four short years ago. And I've been able to beat the odds time and again. And, I have deeper faith than ever. This is the greatest of odds yet, but with your support, this band and I have the one chance we need. No matter what, we won't let you down!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Of all people, I know times are tough. If you can't afford to donate, please pass our campaign on to someone who may. Share it on your social media and by word of mouth. And, thank you all for believing since day one and riding along!

Ladyfest Atlanta showcases music, comedy, visual art, film, workshops, and other activities facilitated by local folks! In addition to highlighting all of the amazing talent in our city, our goal is to precipitate critical and needed dialogue around the intersections of sexism, racism and classism in the arts communities of Atlanta.

column2:
>
We are actively seeking to change the landscape of the Atlanta art scene to be more inclusive and more representative. While many women’s festivals fail to address the politics that make these spaces necessary in the first place, Ladyfest Atlanta seeks to create an outwardly feminist and leftist space where political dialogue and activism are just as important as art and music.

>
This year will be bigger, better and more accessible. Ladyfest Atlanta 2015 was

column1: a jam-packed three days of performances, workshops, talks, and more. This year we want to spread all
that good stuff out over 6 days. The goal is to put together a week of radical events, amplifying our message.

Hey, where exactly is my money going?

We're raising funds for:

- Paying the artists!!!
- Promotional materials/printing,
- Ladyfest merch (check out those sweet perks!)
- Venue/rental fees

Ladyfest Atlanta is always FREE and open to the public. Additionally, all donations raised during the festival will go directly to a (TBA) local organization! Funds raised in 2015 were donated to SNaP Co.

<div>Ladyfest Atlanta intends to precipitate critical dialogue around gender-centered oppression especially as it relates to the arts and other cultural institutions. Additionally, it facilitates access to larger local platforms, helps sustain relationships between the artists and the
community, and encourages introductions and relationships between artists. For example, last year we noticed that
many of the folks who played at Ladyfest who had never even been to Mammal, Eyedrum or the Big House on
Ponce worked with those venues again and played with other folks they’d never played with before in the

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help!

  • Spread the word! Let the people in your life know about our campaign and why it matters to you.

• Submit to be a Ladyfest 2016 artist at LadyfestAtlanta.com!
  • Join the team and volunteer with us! Find out more here.

Ladyfest Atlanta showcases music, comedy, visual art, film, workshops, and other activities facilitated by local folks! In addition to highlighting all of the amazing talent in our city, our goal is to precipitate critical and needed dialogue around the intersections of sexism, racism and classism in the arts communities of Atlanta.

We are actively seeking to change the landscape of the Atlanta art scene to be more inclusive and more representative. While many women’s festivals fail to address the politics that make these spaces necessary in the first place, Ladyfest Atlanta seeks to create an outwardly feminist and leftist space where political dialogue and activism are just as important as art and music.

I am excited to announce that I have a Demo/EP on the Go!

It's called *drumroll* The Hand Cut Emerald Demo.  This Demo is the next big step in my music career. This is my chance to really show the world what I am capable of.... I just need financial assistance to get there.  (If you would like to hear a sneak peek of one of the tracks from this Demo/EP here is the link: ""Make It Out"" Live Reveal).

column3: >Here is the deal, y'all.  Let me tell you where all the green is going!

column1:
• $400 will go towards post production.
  • $200 will go towards manufacturing and distribution.

• $400 will be used for new performance equipment.

    • So what kind of Demo/EP will this be and why do you care?

    • This Demo/EP is an exploration of Jazz, Pop, and RnB genres. It is mostly beat and groove driven. I wanted a debut record in this wondrous land of opportunity (Toronto Area) to be very accessible to many ears... that and I can't help myself when a good beat drops.

• Music has always been an important vocation for me, and I intend to build a career out on honest and thought provoking music. I want to inspire positive change in the world. I want to empower people with my story of overcoming fear, anxiety and depression. I also want to demonstrate strength can be found with honest reflection. Facing our scars in the past can lead to freedom. That and of course throwing in some token love songs. *slaps knee**wheezes*
  • When you donate money you are not only funding a musical project, but you are supporting my startup as an artist in the music industry. I take my live performances very seriously and to upgrade some of my equipment would give me a better platform to use my abilities to accomplish my goals.

""Rob, I don't have any money!? How else can I Help?!""

If you don't have money... I get it.Trust me. If you would still like to help you can do the following:
• Buy the Demo/EP when it comes out
• Write me a letter saying.. YOU CAN DO THIS... thats always nice.
","I am excited to announce that I have a Demo/EP on the Go!

It's called *drumroll* The Hand Cut Emerald Demo.  This Demo is the next big step in my music career. This is my chance to really show the world what I am capable of.... I just need financial assistance to get there.  (If you would like to hear a sneak peek of one of the tracks from this Demo/EP here is the link: ""Make It Out"" Live Reveal).
Here is the deal, y'all.  Let me tell you where all the green is going!
$400 will go towards post production. $200 will go towards manufacturing and distribution.

$400 will be used for new performance equipment.    So what kind of Demo/EP will this be and why do you care?  This Demo/EP is an exploration of Jazz, Pop, and RnB genres. It is mostly beat and groove driven. I wanted a debut record in this wondrous land of opportunity (Toronto Area) to be very accessible to many ears... that and I can't help myself when a good beat drops.

Music has always been an important vocation for me, and I intend to build a career out on honest and thought provoking music. I want to inspire positive change in the world. I want to empower people with my story of overcoming fear, anxiety and depression. I also want to demonstrate strength can be found with honest reflection. Facing our scars in the past can lead to freedom. That and of course throwing in some token love songs. *slaps knee**wheezes* When you donate money you are not only funding a musical project, but you are supporting my startup as an artist in the music industry. I take my live performances very seriously and to upgrade some of my equipment would give me a better platform to use my abilities to accomplish my goals.
""Rob, I don't have any money!? How else can I Help?!"" If you don't have money... I get it.Trust me. If you would still like to help you can do the following:
Buy the Demo/EP when it comes out
Send up a prayer for me
Write me a letter saying.. YOU CAN DO THIS... thats always nice.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Edinburgh University Footlights

Founded in 1989, Edinburgh University Footlights is a student-run musical theatre group that aims to annually present the largest scale production of the University's theatrical calendar. Over the years, Footlights has gone from strength to strength, with The Edinburgh Evening News dubbing the society ""one of the most respected theatre groups in Britain"" and recently forming an incredible Showchoir. 

Footlights aims to give its every member as professional an experience as possible while providing an accessible and affordable performance for the student body as well as the Edinburgh community at large. Each academic year, the Showchoir perform at a variety of events within and out with the University, and also produce a showcase of only the highest quality. 

The EU Showchoir are an exceptional group of performers who work on a variety of music styles throughout the year. Combining musical prowess with the opportunity for dance and movement provides more possibilities for those who just can't contain their craving for musical theatre and performance.

Every year the choir, production team and committee put in a huge amount of effort fundraising, hosting events, doing bakesales and singing Christmas Carols all over Edinburgh. Putting on an incredible show means paying for a venue and making sure everyone is heard and lit up! The money we raise here will be going directly towards the cost of the Showchoir perfomance and making sure that we continue to wow audiences across the city.
We hugely appreciate the help that friends, family and musical lovers offer and whether you can donate or not we look forwards to seeing you in March at the performance!

If you're interested in supporting us as a business we also have a wide range of sponsorship options available and would love to chat to you. You can get in touch with us at sponsorship@edfootlights.com

column2: >Annie Grunwald (known by most of her fans as ""Annie Shred"") has wowed millions of viewers on Youtube with her guitar playing &amp
column3: compositions, via her original songs, songs with her band Formless, as well as countless product demonstrations for her endorsement companies: Seymour Duncan, Ibanez, Dunlop etc. She has been recognized by Guitar World Magazine, and many news outlets, for her unique playing style and has graced the cover of Mexico's ""Heavy Riff Magazine"". She has also shared the stage with guitar legends like Michael Angelo Batio, and Vinnie Moore and is a fixture at various NAMM performances. She is a star on the rise.

column2: >* Her new EP ""The Shamanic"" has been in the works for a while now and she wants her fans to hear it. This campaign is important to get the music out there to as many people as possible.

column1: * This funding from Annie's fans via Indiegogo, will cover the cost of recording and will help to promote the music and Annie as much as possible.
* We have a lot of exciting perks to share with YOU, the contributors to this campaign, including some awesome limited edition Annie T-shirts, one on one guitar lessons and guitar picks.
* We hope to at least reach the modest goal of 3,500, BUT If at all possible we'd like to reach 5,000, as this was a very laborious project.

• Electronic music with, metal influence and heavy rhythmic guitars. Custom instruments were made by Annie by sampling various instruments including her voice, guitar, toy dulcimers, mandolin etc to create playable synths in Ableton Live.
<li>Collaboration with Remi from the band ""The Algorithm"", he mixed &amp
column2: mastered the EP and also had some creative input on arrangement and finesse of the music. Remi sampled melodies Annie wrote to create a portion of the track on the record.

column1: • The EP is inspired by Annie's dreams and spiritual experiences and how she made sense of them.

If you can't contribute, please help us to get the word out and make some noise about ""The Shamanic"". Sharing the campaign on your Facebook wall, Twitter page, word of mouth, etc etc...Will go a long way to helping us do as well as possible with our efforts.
* Please use the Indiegogo share tools as it will help us to build points with the Indiegogo platform.

","Annie Grunwald (known by most of her fans as ""Annie Shred"") has wowed millions of viewers on Youtube with her guitar playing & compositions, via her original songs, songs with her band Formless, as well as countless product demonstrations for her endorsement companies: Seymour Duncan, Ibanez, Dunlop etc. She has been recognized by Guitar World Magazine, and many news outlets, for her unique playing style and has graced the cover of Mexico's ""Heavy Riff Magazine"". She has also shared the stage with guitar legends like Michael Angelo Batio, and Vinnie Moore and is a fixture at various NAMM performances. She is a star on the rise.
* Her new EP ""The Shamanic"" has been in the works for a while now and she wants her fans to hear it. This campaign is important to get the music out there to as many people as possible.
* This funding from Annie's fans via Indiegogo, will cover the cost of recording and will help to promote the music and Annie as much as possible.
* We have a lot of exciting perks to share with YOU, the contributors to this campaign, including some awesome limited edition Annie T-shirts, one on one guitar lessons and guitar picks.
* We hope to at least reach the modest goal of 3,500, BUT If at all possible we'd like to reach 5,000, as this was a very laborious project.

Electronic music with, metal influence and heavy rhythmic guitars. Custom instruments were made by Annie by sampling various instruments including her voice, guitar, toy dulcimers, mandolin etc to create playable synths in Ableton Live.

Collaboration with Remi from the band ""The Algorithm"", he mixed & mastered the EP and also had some creative input on arrangement and finesse of the music. Remi sampled melodies Annie wrote to create a portion of the track on the record.
The EP is inspired by Annie's dreams and spiritual experiences and how she made sense of them.

If you can't contribute, please help us to get the word out and make some noise about ""The Shamanic"". Sharing the campaign on your Facebook wall, Twitter page, word of mouth, etc etc...Will go a long way to helping us do as well as possible with our efforts.
* Please use the Indiegogo share tools as it will help us to build points with the Indiegogo platform.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column8: >Hi! My name is Noelle Smith, and I'm a 16-year-old singer/songwriter from North Carolina. I've been singing since before I could talk.  In 2009 though, I was given my first guitar and then my journey really began. Over the years I’ve been in contests (winning some), playing at fairs, festivals, schools, on the street and of course in some of my own gigs. I even won a contest that let me record a CD back in 2012. You've seen me on YouTube with over 100 videos that I've posted over the last 6 years. Many of you have been with me through all of this and I’m grateful for all that you've done.

column1:
My dream has always been to make a career performing my
music in front of thousands. All my work in the past has led me to my next
beginning and I want you to be a part of it. I’ve been working with Ramona
Simmons at Global Eyes Entertainment to develop my brand and image. Ramona and her partner Preston “Shoes” Sullivan believe I’m ready to make a top quality
demo CD to bring to the labels and start my career. Preston has secured
musicians and the famous OmniSound Studios in Nashville where artists such as
Taylor Swift, Blake Shelton and Beyonce have recorded. We start Jan 16th!
We will record three of my original songs to share with the world.

I NEED YOUR HELP! Top quality costs money. I’ve saved some
money from gigs and CD sales over the years and can invest about $5,000 but we
need $10,000 for the producer, the studio, the musicians, travel and marketing. I
need your to help with the other half. Please donate whatever you can. I’m
grateful for anything (and don’t forget your perks). If you can’t help with a
donation, you can still help by sharing this with your friends and shamelessly
asking for their help too!

I Need Your Help to Make an Album!
I've got some awesome songs that I'm REALLY excited to share with you!

column2:
My Dream

A couple of years ago, I graduated from College and ran full force into a brick wall of quarter life crisis.

column1: I could spend hours telling this story, but I won't dig into all of it here. My plans for myself weren't coming together as I had thought, and I began a season of being lost and confused. Trying to find myself while wondering aimlessly proved to be exhausting. This was my journey west. I recorded a low budget EP at home (Thanks to some dear friends who believed in me more than I believed in myself), and flew out to Los Angeles with two suitcases and a dream. Caught somewhere between courage and insanity, I spent the next couple of years barely surviving. I was healing a fresh batch of scars from being hurt and fighting to survive, as well as unpacking the copious amounts of new and fun emotional baggage that a bold move to a big city alone will give you.
I found healing in my music. Every song that I wrote helped me to unpack my burdens and tend to my wounds. The songs that I wrote brought me life, and I now I want to share them with you.
You guys, I'm so excited sitting here typing this that I'm grinning from ear to ear. This is it. This is my chance to really do something.
column3: >This will be my Debut full length album. More importantly, this album is me choosing to face my fears. It's time to stop hiding and run full force, with everything that I have, away from my comfort zone, opening my heart to whatever comes of it.

>Your contribution will mean the difference between me putting out mediocre demos for the next few years until I can afford to fund a decent album myself, and creating an album right now that is fresh with the raw energy and emotion of moving out to Los Angeles. I've been trying to do it by myself, and I need your help.

column1: This album narrates my journey to the desert. I left everything that I knew to chase a dream that I couldn't see.
column4: >This is my story, and it's worth telling.

column3: >The world is full of so much violence, deceit, and hate right now. Together, we can release an album into the world that's full of hope, love, and joy.

column1: I'm not doing this lightly. I've been meticulously planning this project for over a year, doing the best that I can with my own funds. I'm functioning as my own record label. I've got a plan in motion
column2: I just need the resources to grease the wheels.

column1:
My greatest challenge is that I am not a great producer. I've been trying to produce myself for over a year now, and I feel that I would be doing you a disservice by sharing a mediocre version of my songs with you. 

I want to give you the best possible music that I can create, and that takes resources. I don't want this project to be limited by my finances. I want to create art that moves people deeply. Great production costs money.
Once you choose a reward level to the right, you will officially be a contributor and partner in this album. So you should know exactly where your money is going.

column2: >***UPDATE!**** Due to some generous offers from People who want to help, my costs have been almost cut in half! My updated Total is $17,500!
>I've done so much research and preparation for this album, and spent hours doing the math. I'm a thrifty business woman, and I promise that I will make the most of your contributions.
>I'm not creating this album to profit from it. I simply want to cover the costs.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Trust me, I get it. Money is tight. If you can't contribute financially, there are still so many ways that you can help:

  • Make some noise!
• Share my campaign on social media. Share it on every platform that you have. The more times you share it, the better the chance that someone who CAN give will see it.
• Make sure to include the link to this campaign and tag my social media account in the post. #IntoTheDesert

• Free services - Even better than money, if you have the skills and know-how to do engineering/production, album artwork, marketing, etc, and you would be willing to help me out, that's better than money! 
  • The most amazing thing that you can do is honestly to just talk about it. Tell your friends, your family, your coworkers. Social media can become loud and chaotic at times, and the best chance I have of getting funding for my album, is getting people excited about my music. If you're excited about my music, please talk about it and get other people excited. :)

• For this crazy dream to really happen, you've gotta share it with your friends. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...blast the world. 
    Blog about it, text your friends about it. 
    Anything can happen happen when enough people rally behind a certain idea or cause

Ba-Da Boom! Let's do this :)

","I Need Your Help to Make an Album!
I've got some awesome songs that I'm REALLY excited to share with you!
My Journey & My Dream A couple of years ago, I graduated from College and ran full force into a brick wall of quarter life crisis.

I could spend hours telling this story, but I won't dig into all of it here. My plans for myself weren't coming together as I had thought, and I began a season of being lost and confused. Trying to find myself while wondering aimlessly proved to be exhausting. This was my journey west. I recorded a low budget EP at home (Thanks to some dear friends who believed in me more than I believed in myself), and flew out to Los Angeles with two suitcases and a dream. Caught somewhere between courage and insanity, I spent the next couple of years barely surviving. I was healing a fresh batch of scars from being hurt and fighting to survive, as well as unpacking the copious amounts of new and fun emotional baggage that a bold move to a big city alone will give you.
I found healing in my music. Every song that I wrote helped me to unpack my burdens and tend to my wounds. The songs that I wrote brought me life, and I now I want to share them with you.

You guys, I'm so excited sitting here typing this that I'm grinning from ear to ear. This is it. This is my chance to really do something. This will be my Debut full length album. More importantly, this album is me choosing to face my fears. It's time to stop hiding and run full force, with everything that I have, away from my comfort zone, opening my heart to whatever comes of it.

Your contribution will mean the difference between me putting out mediocre demos for the next few years until I can afford to fund a decent album myself, and creating an album right now that is fresh with the raw energy and emotion of moving out to Los Angeles. I've been trying to do it by myself, and I need your help.
This album narrates my journey to the desert. I left everything that I knew to chase a dream that I couldn't see. This is my story, and it's worth telling.
The world is full of so much violence, deceit, and hate right now. Together, we can release an album into the world that's full of hope, love, and joy.

I'm not doing this lightly. I've been meticulously planning this project for over a year, doing the best that I can with my own funds. I'm functioning as my own record label. I've got a plan in motion
column2: I just need the resources to grease the wheels.

column1: My greatest challenge is that I am not a great producer. I've been trying to produce myself for over a year now, and I feel that I would be doing you a disservice by sharing a mediocre version of my songs with you. I want to give you the best possible music that I can create, and that takes resources. I don't want this project to be limited by my finances. I want to create art that moves people deeply. Great production costs money.
Once you choose a reward level to the right, you will officially be a contributor and partner in this album. So you should know exactly where your money is going.
Here is a Cost summary breakdown:
***UPDATE!**** Due to some generous offers from People who want to help, my costs have been almost cut in half! My updated Total is $17,500!
I've done so much research and preparation for this album, and spent hours doing the math. I'm a thrifty business woman, and I promise that I will make the most of your contributions.
I'm not creating this album to profit from it. I simply want to cover the costs.
Other Ways You Can Help Trust me, I get it. Money is tight. If you can't contribute financially, there are still so many ways that you can help:  Make some noise!
Share my campaign on social media. Share it on every platform that you have. The more times you share it, the better the chance that someone who CAN give will see it.
Make sure to include the link to this campaign and tag my social media account in the post. #IntoTheDesert

Free services - Even better than money, if you have the skills and know-how to do engineering/production, album artwork, marketing, etc, and you would be willing to help me out, that's better than money!  The most amazing thing that you can do is honestly to just talk about it. Tell your friends, your family, your coworkers. Social media can become loud and chaotic at times, and the best chance I have of getting funding for my album, is getting people excited about my music. If you're excited about my music, please talk about it and get other people excited. :)

For this crazy dream to really happen, you've gotta share it with your friends. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...blast the world. Blog about it, text your friends about it. Anything can happen happen when enough people rally behind a certain idea or cause
